Oh and they also let me bring my dog in with me to order my ice cream. I love places that are dog friendly! So many more flavors of ice cream still to try...a few blocks from home...I will be down there a lot this summer. Let's just hope my waistline can take all these visits.

This. Place. Is. AMAZING!!! Their donuts are unique yet so delicious! Delicious enough to make me wake up early enough to wait in line! Lol and it's in a cute little place downtown! Glad to see they're doing so well!

Ok, it must get better over time. (I hope)! Grand opening, and the place wasn't too packed. Got my red velvet, chai latte, lemon meringue, triple cinnamon, and vanilla. All were way too dry, and lacked flavor with the exception of the lemon. But still way to dry! They must've baked way too many and had them sit out way too long. That's what I get for going to their grand opening. I just pray this isn't what to expect in the future, as I will just stick to their ice cream.
Worth the hype, delicious ice creams with great flavor combinations. I love the following flavors: brown butter almond brittle, goat cheese with cherries and bramblecrisp.
Icecream was delicious.. decent priced and well made. not toooo sweet.. although it is icecream, sweethtooth! lol

You can never go wrong with a sprinkles cupcake. I used the outdoor ATM machine on the side of the building. You select your cupcake order from a touchscreen and then pay by credit card. Within seconds the door opens and your cupcake is in a box. There is a 50 cent extra charge for buying from ATM. It is convenient. They have outdoor tables to sit at. I had the vanilla with chocolate frosting. They load on the frosting. The cupcake was moist.

I've been to a few of Buddy's bakery locations across the country, EXCEPT for the original location (beside the point). I get a lobster tail every time. It's crispy and the filling is delicious. What I enjoy most about the lobster tail and some of his other baked goods, is that it isn't too sweet. All the aspects of the pastry are allowed to shine. There's really not much I can say here that will sway most people's opinion of this establishment and the chain of bakeries overall. I'm a fan of this location and I can really only recommend the Lobster tail and the Cannoli, because those are the only things I have tried.

My boyfriend and I tried this place and it was pretty good! You get to choose what kind of cereal or ingredients get blending into your ice cream or milkshake & then what cereal, candy or other toppings go on top! Good place to go if you're craving ice cream or just something sweet

Fantastic ice cream, some of the best in South End. I love stopping by and grabbing a half scoop (or three!). My go-to favorite is gooey butter cake. Salted peanut butter is also great. Tonight I tried the limited time everything bagel which was slightly gross, but I was still glad I tried it! Just an odd flavor for ice cream. I love the out of the box flavors...I always look forward to trying the newest one!

Very nice Bakery beautiful display of fresh product which changes daily fantastic croissant and macaroon depending on what you order it can be a little pricey but the quality is definitely there I can't say I was disappointed with anything we've gotten there

Staff was super friendly and amazing. The split strawberry was absolutely delicious and looks beautiful. Got a cappuccino that just topped off the whole experience. If you're in the downtown area I definitely recommend stopping by.
Amazing. Love their cinnamon stars..just wish they were a more reasonable price. 2 lbs cost me $26. Tiramisu($5) & cannolis are always good too!

i found this place on a map search, it has no sign when i last went and you don't really notice it. When i walked in i thought it was really cute, nice and CLEAN. There were some nice looking treats and was going to order some until i seen Flies sitting on their food. I told the people that work there that there were flies on their food items and nothing was done, they just kept the food there. They need to invest in those glass covers if they haven't already done so. If i didn't experience this then i would have given it a better rating.

I seriously don't get it. The line was out the door. We tried three different flavors, and none were outstanding. They were good, but not wonderful. Maybe I'm just spoiled from the many excellent ice cream places in the greater LA area.
Great ice cream, cool place to hang out, kid-friendly. You should come check it out! Oh, and they bake all kinds of cookies and treats!

Not too impressed with Presti's... I go because everyone claims it's amazing but it's super crammed and the number system doesn't really work. They microwave their pastas and sandwiches so it's not fresh. They have a great variety of baked goods but I'd prefer The Stone Oven or Luna's bakery for that. I had their egg and cheese croissant and was super disappointed because the bread was NOT flaky and the cheese was the very cheap kind. Presti's is also more expensive than Luna's and stone oven, but their quality is not worth it. Will say they do have a huge variety which I think makes the place so great and lots of space for studying.

Having lived in New York for a bit, I went to Milk Bar constantly and I am such a big fan of it...so of course I had to visit the one on the Strip. The line was long (of course) but it was so worth it. I went with the classic cereal milk soft serve with cereal flakes on the outside and it hit the spot. Brought my friends who had never experienced Milk Bar and they were astounded by all the different wacky combinations. One of my friends got the sweet potato soft serve and it tasted so so so good. Another got the cereal milk soft serve affogato, which looked incredible.

Our favorite place for dessert! The flavor varieties are outstanding and make choosing your flavor difficult. We love the fact the size is by weight so you can select multiple flavors even with a single.
The S'mores sundae with Vietnamese Coffee ice cream is amazing!

After dining at Foosia, we were really really craving some dessert. So of course I took to Yelp to see what fellow Yelpers had said and we found Sweet Republic. There was no need to just get a regular scoop of ice cream when we could choose from their insanely delicious sounding sundaes! We ended up getting the Pecan Turtle after reading all about it here. But I could definitely go back for the Campfire S'mores in order to have some of their housemade marshmallows. Next time for sure!

I'm from the Bay Area and my parents just moved to the area. This place popped up and all the drinks and ice cream desserts looked so good! I ordered the Strawberry Matcha Latte and my boyfriend ordered the Butterfly Rose Lemonade. It was pretty packed on a Sunday Night at 7 pm. The staff was very friendly. This place is so cute! Modern and Chic Decor. Definitely a lot of photo ops lol The Strawberry Matcha Latte was delicious and aesthetically pleasing. It tasted just as good and identical as Boba Guys back home. I tried my boyfriends Butterfly Rose Lemonade and it was very refreshing as well. I'm not a fan of Rose flavored items but the Lemonade definitely overpowered the hint of Rose. I'd definitely come back. Everything just looks so appetizing and pretty.

Love of my life right here! I am sad that they had my favorite flavor (whiskey almond toffee)for only 4 days so I missed it yet again this year. Everything about this place is the bomb! The location, the ice cream, the plants, the patio seating with the string lights. It's all well put together with purpose! I just wish I could order my favorite flavor! But I'll have to wait yet again till next year and hope to get it!

Idiotically went to the Daniels Street location, thinking that it would be nice to fill up before we volunteered at Second Harvest. Turns out... it's the production plant and so they only sell 8 pints or 3 gallons at a time. We walked away with 3 gallons of Oreo mint. Totally worth my significantly lighter wallet. I love the State Street location, and they were just as helpful and patient at the production plant. Oops.

Super cute spot. More of like an old fashioned ice cream parlor with all the random decor and candies. 5 stars for the place. I got the strawberry shortcake and was highly disappointed. My pound cake was rock hard. Boo!!! We got the coke float, it was good, nothing stand out though.
Overpriced and bland. I've had better milkshake like Holsteins, strip burger or even in and out.

Went to Vegas and checked them out because I love watching their show and curious but I was disappointed. Nothing special and they are expensive. Ordered canoli and lobster tail, meh! Waste of money :(
Salted. Caramel. Brownies. The best thing ever. Chai lattes are great too and the breakfast sandwiches are delicious and filling. Get some macaroons to go and have a great time.

You can't go wrong with a shop that has Perry's ice cream, chocolate covered bacon and cake pops among about 30 other types of treats! I wandered into the shop after being stuffed from dinner but still craving something sweet. I ended up leaving with more chocolate then I have ever purchased at one time before. I aslo left with an ice cream (Perry;s has a ton of unique flavors, my choice of the day was movie theater which had a faint buttered popcorn flavor along with some chocolate). My favorite by far was the chocolate covered bacon. How can you go wrong with the salty bacon combined with the delectable taste of chocolate? I also purchased a chocolate covered chili, some chocolate covered pretzels, some cake pops and a piece of fudge. Chocolate overload! There was only one person in the shop waiting on people, so it did take a little while to get service, but he was friendly and informative. The only downside is that since it is artisan chocolate, it is a little pricey, but totally worth every penny. If you are looking to satisfy your sweet tooth or try something unique, I highly recommend Sinful Sweets.

AmÃ©lie's offers two of my favorite things, pastries/tarts and coffee, but this location offered me one of me least favorite things, terrible customer interaction and service. The employees at this location are some of the rudest bunch I have encountered. When I arrived, there were no labels on any pastries and after asking to be helped we said that we were waiting for them to be labeled, they did not offer to tell us what they were. When they finally began to label after 5 minutes, we asked what kind of cake they had and two of the employees got into an argument about one not knowing what kind it was. While continue looking, three employees congregated up front to talk very loudly and poorly about one of their fellow employees and her work ethic. After finally getting up to the register and asking about their two blends of coffee, the employee was very rude and unhelpful, all I had asked was what kind of roast and its strength, she laughed and said "I don't know", so I ordered two of the same kind and she had asked if I wanted any room for cream or sugar and I politely and simply said "No thank you", I then hear her make a remark of "Of course not" to another employee and they both laugh. After finding a place to sit I realize the weight of my coffee seems very light and disproportionate to the size I got, so I decided to pop open the lid, low and behold there is almost 2 inches of room in each of the coffees I had ordered. I had immediately became disgruntled and walked back up to the counter and caught glares from the woman who rung me up and poured my coffee and 2 others like I had done something wrong, I calmly took off both kids and proceeded to show and explain that I had asked for no room and received the exact opposite, the helping employees offers to fill them up and realized they had run out from that brewer, but she immediately brought one up after that was fresh and proceed to fill up my two cups, only to still leave room. There was no apology made at any point, I was no rude to them and did not saying anything to aggravate them either. This was a very poor experience and will not recommend this AmÃ©lie's location to anyone, spend the money on parking and go to the Uptown location where you will have a much more friendly, helpful, and honest staff of employees.
Awesome-in town to watch Broncos vs Steelers and found this gem! Great shakes and the service was excellent. Fun and yummy! Love that our server asked about straw colors!
YA! Great ice cream in downtown phoenix that is open late! Udder Delights from Gilbert makes it way to the city. The staff is super friendly and the ice cream is top notch! Hit this place up ASAP.
This place is overrated. The desserts are not that good. I got a lobster tail (stiff) and a cheesecake (flavorless). I regret paying for these overpriced desserts.

I had heard so much about the crack pie I knew I had to try it. I bellied up to the countered, handed over ~$10, and received this itty-bitty piece of pie. It must be the best pie ever for that price/size, right? I took a bite and...ok? I don't know what the big hoopla is over crack pie as it didn't come close to blowing me away. It was ok, but not worth it for the size/price. Try something else!

4.8 stars. What's not to love?! Giant, fresh donuts, lots of choices, free donut for the kids, free water, clean bathrooms, seating outdoors and at a counter... Yup, lived up to the hype. $1.50-$6, but the donuts are supersized. Quality. My favorite was the maple glazed bacon donut. Light, not was sweet as the others... Crispy, salty bacon. Old town/downtown Vegas, a few miles North of the strip.

Obviously this place is alllllll about the hype. If you don't have to stand in a ridiculous line and you get service, it's completely wroth it.... other than that, it's just a pastry shop. We waited in a 10 minute line, ordered 2 mini apple strudels, a lobster tail (what they're famous for) and 2 eclairs. I thought the apple strudels were on the dry side and the eclairs were a little too oily/too much shortening in it. It left an oily taste in your mouth. I really liked the lobster tail and thought it was made perfectly. I'm sure these vary day by day. In any case, it was worth coming to Carlo's Bake Shop just for that. I would absolutely not wait in a long line for it though. :)

What's not to love? The ice cream treats are big enough for 2 people. We had a banana split & it was great! The customer service was excellent as well. My only complaint is that the chocolate is more expensive at their store than at tue grocery store. I never buy candy directly from the Ghirardelli store.
The atmosphere is awesome. Super cute decor. I purchased a classic chocolate brownie. In my opinion, the brownie was too chocolately and too salty. Box brownies are better.

Good gelato but expensive! Old Town better but closes too early! They do not have pistachio. Less choices and a bit of a wait when crowded...it is our backup! Waffle cones are fair! The young man who works there is very nice!

Wow. So glad I had the opportunity to check this place out in between moving hotels from old Vegas to new, mid-trip. My husband and I popped in here for a "light" breakfast knowing we had plans to hit up a buffet later in the day but I severely underestimated how amazing the sweet carb-laden goodness oozing out of this establishment would be. The variety of donuts served up here was fantastic; it was hard to choose just a couple (which was great because we ended up with a few complimentary options as well). Being from the northeast, my absolute favorite was the Maple Bourbon donut. It was so large and fluffy and had the perfect amount of glaze. My husband enjoyed his Red Velvet and we enjoyed some bites of a blue-frosted donut with Halloween-inspired sprinkles as well as another gigantic concoction with chocolate filling. Not a coffee drinker myself but I'm told the coffee is delicious. Street parking out front made for an easy in-and-out. Our leftovers were a nice treat after a late-night concert (as we were assured their quality would be good for up to 24 hours). The staff were incredibly nice and helpful in our decision-making and took their time reviewing all of our options. A must-stop in Las Vegas. Safe to say one of the best donuts I've had in my life.

I ordered a slice of carrot cake for my birthday (March 5) two weeks in advance & while they had the slice ready for me when I arrived, it was the worst carrot cake I have ever had. The cake was super dry & fell apart easily. Very disappointing!

Love the location of this Sprinkles at the LINQ! And even better that they serve ice cream here. I got an ice cream sammy...double choco chip and a fudge brownie with coffee almond fudge ice cream in between. YUM! They have a door specifically to order cupcakes and another for the ice cream section. It was confusing at first to know where the line for which section of Sprinkles started. My ice cream sammy was created quickly and it looked yummy and was yummy . While $9 for this ice cream sammy was a bit steep, it's still worth a try. They also have the cupcake ATM on the side of the store, which is cool.
Big change not for the better quality down hill ... I actually threw the ice cream away when I got home tasted like it sat for weeks and I icy :( poor sad

Went in here after dinner to have a dessert, came in for the special beer ice cream. So i thought, but they were all out. Went ol tried and true mint choc chip and butterfinger chunk. Wow...i mean two amazing things in my mouth....at the same time. They may use a little too much cream, but its still great place to relax on warm day/night and watch the people or the train that runs through the ceiling.
This place has charm and personality in every room. It's a wonderful place to meet up with friends or just go and sit and enjoy a hot tea or coffee. Wonderful food!!!
My lemon tart was delicious! The macaroons were over priced.
Great service from all the staff and the best butter pecan ice cream I've ever had!!!
Best coffee and coke float ever, ample parking in back. Nice people. Hope to go many more times.

What's with the bad reviews? I came here on a Sunday night and didn't have to wait much in line. The guy working the counter was super sweet and gave me great recommendations. He had me sample a few things and I decided to order the cereal milk soft serve with cereal flakes as a topping. Goodness. It was amazing. Tasted exactly like sweet cereal milk. I noticed a lot of negative reviews complained about price. Come on people, this is Vegas, and you're ordering from a place inside the Cosmo. Obviously it's going to be a bit on the pricier side. Doesn't take away from how good the ice cream tastes. I wasn't as crazy about the milkshake as I was the soft serve, hence one star off.

This place was featured on yelp and not too far for me so I just had to try it. It's a small cafÃ© located in the Arboretum shopping area. There is plenty of shared parking. The place is clean and they have good customer service. I decided to try the yuca (seasonal flavor) and Matcha swirl based on the staffs recommendations. I found the Matcha to be very tasty and a very strong flavor it would probably taste really good with the vanilla in a swirl. They have a variety of other treats offered besides the frozen yogurt. Now so sell a variation of beverages. They sell merchandise as well. I would like to come back and try some different flavors and treats. Hope you enjoy!

Wish I could give zero stars. What I will add is the huge lack of respect the owner must have for their own customers. I waited in line 25 minutes. And then another 30 minutes to get my stuff. Should of done what several people did- leave! Feel bad for the tourist who are wasting their precious time in Vegas to buy the crap they are selling here. Hire more employees to pack orders. Although this might be intentional to make people think they are more popular than they are. If you have a car - go to Bagel Cafe. GPS it. Much of what you buy at Carlos can be found here. Many times better & for less money.
Amazing!!! The staff is so upbeat and so nice. Great atmosphere. We got the salted carmel, wasn't aware it was a huge cup but it was all eaten. Super yummy!

After constant drooling over other people Instagram pics of milk soft serves, I FINALLY got the chances to try. It was pretty much my only goal this trip. So, MISSION ACCOMPLISH~!! Overall tho, was not fully satisfied, I love the texture of the soft serve, really felt like I was eating cereal with milk. But for some reason in my head, I was seriously expecting it to be so much MORE amazing. Failed. The person who helped me was very generous, gave me a BIG one, I couldn't even finish, there wasn't enough cereal to go with the milk! I def will go back and try something else next time. Price: $6 for the milk soft serve, $1 for the Cornflakes + tax Staff: very nice and friendly

I was so looking forward to this place. After eating at Momofuku next door, my sweet tooth was calling me out. Sadly to say, Milk was more than disappointing for me. 3 stars for the Birthday cake truffles alone. They were soft, buttery, doughey and sweet. The cereal milk soft serve didn't do a thing for me and I love ice cream. Sadly, it tasted bland and wasn't sweet at all-- even with a generous heaping of corn flakes on top to give it texture. I sampled all of the soft serve flavors as well and nothing stood out. Sorry Milk, but all the hype is just that- hype.
Everything here is amazing and I now will only eat macaroons as ice cream sandwiches. ORDER ONE OF EVERYTHING

My fiancÃ© and I shared a sundae together. Forgot what it was called but we opted for vanilla, chocolate chip, and cookie dough ice cream. Came with chocolate syrup and cookie bits and whipped cream. Everything was delicious except for the cookie bits. They were hard as a rock and my teeth were in pain. However I will come back!
Yum, their salted caramel sundae is so good, also enjoy the cookies n cream shake. A little pricey, but very convenient location at the Linq Promenade. Worth stopping by for the ice cream!
Amazing!! Great for vegans and omnivores alike! I had cucumber and sweet tea sorbets and I was very impressed. Great service and creative presentation. Will be back!

Folks..Honey hut is a legendary place, Philly has Philly Cheesteak, we have Slymans..and Honey hut...I have been going there as long as I can remember..sadly, the Ice Cream is still awesome and they know it..so, I ordered a hot caramel sunday..medium, $4. and change...yet, you get last years small at last years medium...PLUS the strawberry shortcake always came in a silver container with 2 cakes on the bottom..well..they had what was either homemade or from a bakery as they were outstanding.then they switched to the round boring cakes from The makers of twinkes i think..But, Ok because the star is the ice cream...while pricey then..was worth it..this year..you get HALF of that in a cup for the same price..sad...I never begrudge someone making money..but, there is a point when enough is enough...well..you have reached that H.H...As I review this...I am eating my tiny cup of ice cream with a tiny dab of caramel and a huge glob of canned whipped cream..at the old medium cost...folks... please, stop over pricing your ice cream...even the ice cream has lost something...maybe just the bad taste from how much I paid for 2 sundays and a malt...smh...
Best bakery I've ever been to. Nothing has disappointed. I've tried so many things I could not even begin to list them. Their coffee is great, too. The only problem is that it is TOO popular.

Delicious is the best way to describe Amelie's. I first tried Amelie's through a co-worker that brought treats and was blown away by the salted caramel brownies. I decided to go for myself and tried a couple items. Everything was tasty and it was a great environment. Will be back again :)

We visited the Donut Bar on a Monday in late April. It wasn't busy. Great selection of donuts. The coffee was pretty awesome. We loved all the donuts, my favorite was the Strawberry Shortcake. Going into this visit I was expecting overwhelming sweetness. It was not the case. All donuts were well balanced!

Wow! This is no ordinary donut shop, omg! I walked in and I could not decide what to get, I want them all. I had the vanilla bean donut which by the way are gigantic and the creme brÃ»lÃ©e donut, ohhh so yummy, a must try!

Why don't we have any custard places in California? Why?! This place is so great and the staff was super friendly. We came on a warm, Sunday afternoon and the lines were long but, boy, were they worth it! I got 2 dips in a waffle bowl with cold fudge. Yes, I made it a sundae and it was so worth it! It was so tasty and hit just the right spot for my sweets craving. A great place for kids and adults - they have something for everyone! Trust me, you won't be disappointed coming here!

This was my first time ever to Jack Frost Donuts. I've driven past this location, but with all the uncertainty in the world right now, I needed a pick me up and today was the day! So whoa! So overwhelming! There are like a hundred options! The young lady who helped me was phenomenal. I decided on a donut with peanut butter icing and nuts and also a banana cream donut. My banana one was so very tasty. The donuts are made fresh and apparently they switch them out daily. I was told they have an Instagram page and was invited to follow them. They sell milk, coffee, juice and water also. This place is a gem and I will be back. Next time maybe I'll get a dozen so my family can try all different kinds. Can't wait!

We came in from a day of swimming at the YMCA. It was so hot that the kids and I thought we would enjoy some good ole ice cream. I'd seen on IG the different flavors that they make and decided it was time to give them a try. The staff greeted us right away and although it was a line they got to you within a reasonable amount of time. I don't remember the exact flavors of each thing, but I can't wait to return. They have a menu that shows all the different flavors. Its behind the counter on the wall. If you are more of a visual person they have an iPad with different pictures and the ice cream names. I usually look at the iPad and the menu to compare the ingredients and how it looks. The brownie that my daughter chose was so fresh. 2nd visit Another day after the pool we decided to visit Ninety's ice cream again. It was my friends first time visiting so I helped her look at iPad and she chose the cookie with brownie. I got the brownie with salted caramel and my daughter hot the brownie with sprinkles again. I recommend trying this place. Your gonna love it.
Brownie milkshake is very tasty. The ice cream sandwiches are good too. On the less creamy side, the sorbet is a great option
Best place ever!!!! Was totally impressed by the service and it could only be matched by the incredible taste

I really was looking forward to trying this place but honestly it wasn't all that...I have to say the customer service here is BOMB! I ordered a cake a week in advance and they were very accommodating. The birthday cake was delicious but the cereal milk soft serve with cornflakes was not good. Was hoping it would be sweeter and less bland.

Apparently, this shop has been on the Food Network as they were showing the episode on their TV. I came per Anthony G's recommendation. Tried the Peabody Espresso in a waffle cone and my husband got the Salted Caramel Butter Swirl in a waffle cone in a cup. Both flavors were yummy and the waffle cone was my favorite. Not too sweet, but crunchy. Everyone around us seemed to be newbies like us and they were also raving about how good their ice cream was. You can see how reputable they are by looking at the wall full of newspaper and magazine articles they've been in. Definitely worth a pit stop especially on a hot summer day.

My friend who I was visiting lives down the street from this place, and he took us here to start off our morning walk and let me just say I'm soooo glad he did! This little place is adorable with golden girl vibes all around! I had gotten the draft iced coffee tres leches and it was phenomenal! I also tried the apple cheesecake which I would eat all day every day if I could. Also got the caramel chocolate chunk cookie which was the size of my head and soft and gooey, yummy!

Awesome vegan options! The specialty donuts that we got were delicious and huge. We also got espresso and an americano. The indoor sitting area is kind of small but we were able to find a couple seats. Cute place, definitely will go back.
Awesome milkshakes!! Huge calorie overload but nice to enjoy once in a while! I even got one if their smaller milkshakes and had to throw in the towel. Food was great too.

Cupcakes are my all time favorite and this place does them perfectly! Every time I'm in Vegas I force my friends to come here & get a cupcake from their awesome Cupcake ATM. I've had a pumpkin cupcake (seasonal), lemon & blueberry cupcake, Sprinkles cupcake (funfetti), and strawberry. They have all been delicious. The cupcakes are always moist & soft & basically just heaven on Earth. I have not tried their ice cream but I'm sure it's pretty dang good too.
We keep trying this place since they opened but on all 3 visits the donuts were dry and stale and we've gotten really sick every single time. Gross.

Can we talk about the Cookie Cup? Cause it's fabulous. Ice cream is delicious. Staple flavors along with some fun and unique ones thrown into the mix. Netflix and Chill? Fruity Pebbles? So fun. I don't think I've ever had a macaroon and now I don't know how I have lived this long without them. In a world where froyo is the new thing, Fatty Daddy's is still doing ice cream just right.

Amelie a destination that I wanted to try for a while now. Made it there this afternoon with the family expecting an awesome experience. The decor is eclectic which I think makes this place. Their pastries was ok... Caramel fudge was good. Macaroons was average. I felt rushed since it was our first time and we didn't know what to order. The one employee that help us was nice while the others seemed as if they didn't want to be there. It's neat that a bakery opens 24/7. I will come back to give them another try, but may try their banquettes and croissants instead.
Delicious ! Cookie Monster +unicorn poop . Service is excellent and ice cream is amazing.

Great ice cream, great value, homemade waffle cones! Had a waffle cone with chocolate chip and Oreo, both delicious. The waffle cone was made fresh and is the best I've ever had. Still warm, a bit soft, but still crunchy. Note the single is actually two scoops. A triple is six scoops! Not sure how they fit that much ice cream in one cone, but I'm planning to go back and find out!

The cupcake trend is gone but this chain is still going strong and just opened at The Linq. Thought I'd try a place recommended by quite a few SoCal Yelpers. Did not expect to be as disappointed as I was. Tiny space leaves little room for a line, menu is large and not easy to read at a distance, save for the list of flavors and cute colorful caketopper symbols indicating which flavors are currently available. Service is a trainwreck. Even busy, this place doesn't need 6 people behind the counter, their ordering and fulfillment process makes no sense. Made it to counter, placed order for one single dark chocolate cupcake, plated to eat on location. My name was taken and I was told someone would be with me in a minute. I'm not sure why the same guy couldn't just reach into the case next to us and hand me the cupcake. Paying for my order was hectic. Girl misprounced my name to get my attention, gave me correct flavor, on a plate, with no fork. After handing me plate, asked for my card. Awkwardly set it down, retrieved card, then had to reach again for my ID- for a four dollar purchase, after waiting nearly 10 minutes. Really? Finally snagged a seat to eat. Cupcake frosting was good. Cake itself was dry. Just because I ordered at 9PM should make no difference to the quality of your product. Cake texture and frosting texture didn't really work well together, due to the extreme dryness of the cake and the hardened frosting topping. Opted for a cake without sprinkles, wanting to get the cute circle symbol instead. When I ate it, I nearly chipped a tooth. Given the low quality cupcake received dining in while they were still open (and busy), I'm hesitant to try the cupcake ATM. Can't imagine they retain their moisture well in what must essentially be a refrigerator. Sprinkles, you have a great brand and clever marketing facilitating your business in an amazing new and highly-trafficked area. Step up your game in the kitchen and train your employees on efficiency!

Guys. I'm a ice-cream lover, a foodie and totally head over heels for Novel. I was a Phoenix resident for 10 years. So I've had all of the usual staples.. melt, baked bear and sweet republic. This place tastes amazing in comparison its so dense, flavorful and most of all well thought out. Even tho I recently moved away I will make this a for sure go to stop for myself and others looking for a ice-cream spot. Huge shout out to Brandon what a super cool, passionate and creative dude! He is super proud of his shop and that is what truly sells this spot. You have nothing to lose! Check it out! Bet the flavors won't be the same! Just keep on keeping on your a real Novel idea!

Delicious homemade ice cream waffle bowl was thin & crispy. Salty Caramel Truffle was yummy with lots of mini chocolate caramel truffles in it. Blueberry Cobbler had lots of blueberries and mint chip was refreshing & very minty!

Great bakery! We were impressed with the variety of offerings as well as the quality. They had a lot of yummy cakes (red velvet, carrot, chocolate peanut butter ganache), cream puffs (big, w/ real custard inside, not whipped cream), thick soft chocolate chip cookies, macarons, napoleons, muffins, bialy (unexpected and tasty!), biscuits and so much more. I only listed what we got and all the items were perfect. The prices are reasonable (big portions, high quality) as well. We also got tea and a drip coffee which were also great. I think they use specialty beans. Definitely worth a stop!

This was one of the stop for the NC Tour De Food in Charlotte. Such a cute bakery.. it is very French-est. yes, I made that word up! The decor is very interesting which make the bakery a very fun place to be in. The inside is pretty spacious with 2 floor and another floor for private functions. A very lovely spot for a hot sip of your favorite brew and some sweets! As part of the tour, I was able to try the soup (forgive me I don't remember the name!) but it was so good. Very rich and creamy! Also got the try the infamous salted caramel bars. I guess it's famous for a reason!!!! biting into the bar I thought it would be a HARD caramel but it was so soft and so good! I wish I had time to buy some home but I didn't. I would recommend out of towners to visit and try some treats there!
Employees are not wearing a mask. This should not be optional. Ice cream was great as always. Service was average at best.

Great place to grab some sweets and desserts. My wife (Filipina from Phillipines) and I were surprised to find a great shop like this in AZ. We come from WA and Filipino cuisine and desserts are now everywhere. Since we were contemplating moving here, we thought it would be good to locate a new one in AZ. First, the place is owned and operated by someone who cares. She asks each of her customers after a warm greeting if they have been to her business. Just a rare amount of caring that is much needed in this crazy Covid times. It would be like walking into your aunties house. She has a wide variety of ice creams but her Taho (Taro flavored) is out of this world! The tofu us warm and silky and a lot of good sago/boba with a perfect amount of brown sugar for sweetness. I was sooooo goood... that I had to order one doe myself after my wife "jacked" me. And we polished it off with some Halo Halo... a popular Filipino version of shaved ice. We will definitely be back. Support your local small business!

Oh Carlo's bakery, you have lost your identity. Came in on a Saturday around noon to satisfy my east coast cravings and there were NO BLACK AND WHITE COOKIES, LOBSTER TAILS or TIRAMISU! Originally came in looking for rainbow cookies and ended up leaving highly dissatisfied. Dense and stale, no flavor whatsoever. This place is a sad excuse for a bakery that has simple treats that you can find anywhere else. A major disappointment and just another west coast bakery charging premium prices for average cannolis and fresh baked sugar cookies. I didn't come here for the name, I came here for the classic baked goods. You go in with high hopes of an Italian east coast bakery and leave feeling unsatisfied and disappointed.

Good ice cream and a pleasing environment combine to make Churn a wonderful destination. Churn is very small, so its popularity often results in lines out the door. Not always though. Lines were short on this Saturday night visit, although it was still a bit early. It allowed us time to sample, sample, sample. An enjoyable luxury. The friendly staff patiently endured the indecisiveness of our party of five. Of all the flavors we sampled, only coconut received a thumbs down, primarily based on texture. Just one or two scoop cones for all of us. I'm afraid no Fat Elvis sundaes this night. Simple peanut butter was my flavor of choice. Loved it. The five and six year olds were fully occupied by the pin wheels planted into their cones. Any flavor will do if there's a pinwheel to play with, confirming Churn's kid friendly status. Do not, I repeat, do not, just grab your ice cream and go. Walk to the back of the store and see if there are spots open on the patio. For me, the existence of this area is what pushes Churn into five star territory. Comfortable seating. Nice music. Relaxing lighting. The patio completes the experience.

It's a blustery night! 11 degrees. Snow is settling on the steps of Memorial Union. And inside, there's no one insight. COREY: Slow night? DAILY SCOOPER: Yup! But that's ok, this summer was crazy. COREY: I bet! Line out the door? DAILY SCOOPER: Yup! It's nice things have finally slowed. Which makes this PRIME time to go grab a cone if you don't mind cold treats in cold weather. Their pumpkin ice cream is sort of out of this world, with a color that resembles cooked pumpkin (not neon orange like some of that store bought shlock) and crisp graham pieces. Yes, ice cream in the winter might not be your idea of a stellar Saturday night. But if you're looking for something sweet, near campus, and like the fact that nobody else has the same idea... go grab a scoop! Open late and unlikely that it'll be busy.

This is my favorite place for ice cream in Phoenix! Carefully made, super creamy, and delicious! AND, the people who work here are very nice, and know what's special about the produce. AND... waffle and donut sandwiches!! Try the spiced pear!
5 Stars! Amazing pastries and sweets with great coffee/ tea. This was great place to enjoy desert after having dinner. Service is great and they work as a team to keep the line moving quickly.

I tried the Strawberry cupcake. It's probably just my taste but the frosting was too sweet for me and I didn't taste any type of strawberry flavor. My husband got an ice cream cookie sundae with a chocolate chip cookie and the cookie was a lot better than the cupcake. If I come back, I will probably only get a cookie!

Easily the best ice cream I've ever had. I love their Campfire S'more Sundae, complete with homemade marshmallows, but most visits I just stick to the salted caramel. It's pretty much the perfect ice cream. Everything they make is high quality, delicious, and they always have new flavors to try. It's become my go to when I want something sweet. Why bother with something that's not worth the calories? Can't recommend them highly enough. Cute little store, great ice cream, great service. Not a single complaint to be found. Great work.

I absolutely adore this place! This may be my favorite coffee shop in the entire U.S. The food was delicious and the coffee was pretty good. The vibe and ambience however is amazing. It borders between kitsch and eclectically cute. I could spend all day here--there are so many amazing little nooks to discover.

Staff at Novel Ice Cream are amazing! They have ice cream flavors that I've never heard of. We got a sampler of 5 different ice creams and were not let down. Each flavor is so delicious. We had: chocolate, butter pecan, Madagascar vanilla, black cherry, Cookie Monster, and got an extra scoop of cucumber lime. Everyone needs this place in their lives. So amazing!
Cool place. Get the salted caramel brownie! Best I've had.

I'd give this place 10 stars if it were an option! The ice cream is amazing. The doughnut or waffle sandwiches are to die for and come with a free topping - which I'm sure would all be super yummy but Cinnamon Toast Crunch is my favorite. Even better than the food is the service (if that's possible). We went for the first time last week and we're all blown away by how friendly the guy behind the counter was. Tonight we made a trip back down (we live on the north side) but realized they are actually closed on Monday's. When we pulled up we saw they were closed but the owner noticed us and said if we wanted to come in he'd be happy to serve us! We've never had someone invite us in on a day off just to make sure we were happy! We got to eat fresh waffle sandwiches and they were so good! Love this place and so happy to support a small business that's doing everything right. Thanks Brandon for taking care of us on what was supposed to be a day off for you! By far our favorite ice cream shop!
The macaron sandwiches are OUT OF THIS WORLD! The soft yet crisp macarons mixed with a soft ice cream in the middle will make you melt.

This place comes highly recommended from everyone I asked when I visited Charlotte. I have to say that the hype was a real letdown when I got there. It seems that this place sees a lot of business, as evidenced by the line to be served, and the full seating area (which is ample, to be fair). I tried a croissant and a danish. The croissant was dense and did not appear to take to the filling very well. It looked deflated and sad. It tasted wonderful, though, save for the dense chewy texture. I had to check the menu on the way out to confirm that it wasn't one of the twice-baked croissants. The danish was good! I ordered a cafÃ© au lait, which is my standard go-to beverage when I'm not feeling like I need a full-powered drink. Granted, this place is not a specialized coffeehouse, but it does offer lattes and the like. My drink came barely hot with about two inches of foam. The coffee flavor was nothing special. If it were my first of the morning, It was okay, but I will probably go somewhere else for coffee. I would like to return to try a cake sometime on a future visit to Charlotte. This review is mainly for my experience there, which didn't include sampling a lot of the French pastries which were available. I may want to revise my review once I try more.

OH MY GLOB! I went here for my first time on a Saturday night and there was a long line to get in and order! Hm, must mean this place is good. At least I hope so! I ordered a s'mores sundae (chocolate ice cream, hot fudge, butter graham's, and toasted marshmallow fluff) but I switched out the chocolate ice cream for Madagascar vanilla. It was AMAZING! And huge! They give you so much! I'm glad I traded out for vanilla ice cream because the chocolate would make it even more sweet and rich. My dad ordered a strawberry shortcake sundae but I didn't try it. I love Churn and would definitely love to return!

One of my favorite Italian bakeries! We stopped in on our way to NY and bought two pounds of cookies to share with family. Coffee is strong and flavorful. There is a lot of character here because locals gather for meetings, Case kids come up the street for their yummy and inexpensive lunches and in general it's a pleasant place to hang out. We love the Napoleon cake and cream puffs!

I'm so happy with my experience this afternoon I went in not really sure what I wanted and tbh kinda stressed because I really needed a cake, so thankful Noah was so patient and kind to my mom and I even when we were all over the place and couldn't make up our minds ( so much to choose from & all look so yummy) so so so in love with our cake and decorations even though it was so last minute you guys made me one happy gal. Noah and jasmine are amazing!!!!!! Thank you!!!!!

I got the crack pie slice and the bday cake truffles. The crack pie slice was so buttery and gooey; it was good! The bday cake truffles are another one of their signature items, I think? Those are just okay, sorta dry and too sweet. The problem I had with this place was the prices! The teeny slice of pie was $6 while the 3 little truffles were ~$7. I feel like for this prices it maybe should've a bit bigger or maybe baked fresh? I'm not sure about the pie, but the cookies and truffles were already in plastic bags so they were a bit dry looking. I think what I'm going to have to do is find a copy cat recipe for that crack pie though...
Some of the best ice cream I have ever tasted in life. NO JOKE
Every time I go to Amelie's I find something new to love! Totally worth cheating on my low carb diet!

A social media moment - Novel Ice Cream popped up on my yelp notifications. It is close to my house so I decided to head on down. That turned out to be a great idea! Brandon and Jenny are great and so is their ice cream. We opted for a Dough Melt - a doughnut stuffed with ice cream. For filling we went with Fat Elvis and Bourbon Caramel. Loved it! Highly recommend that you check this place out. Cool location, great owners, and darn tasty ice cream. N*joy....

Sausage and spinach Stromboli is simply perfect. Make sure you get a side of sauce. The sauce reminds me of my great grandfathers, it is very classic and delicious. The sfogliatelle is also amazing. Eggplant parm, chicken parm, etc etc. They get everything right here. The only downside is the price, and sometimes rude employees. It seems like some of them feel like they know they have you coming back for the food so they don't even bother trying to be kind to you.
I would have given zero star. I chose this place to write my thesis. But, in most of the days they had no internet. Which was awful!

Love this place for it's pastries!! In general, any combo of pastries is $12.50/lb. I've tried the raspberry swirls, some of the chocolate chip pastries and a handful of others. Great variety, good service and I'll keep coming back to it! I need to try some of the brownies/cannolis etc on future visits however. Word of wisdom: make sure to take a number during peak business hours or else you won't get served. They move pretty quickly: for example, I was in Little Italy during the Feast of the Assumption party and when I walked in, I pulled #33 and they were on #10. They were on me in less than 10 minutes
The consistency of the ice cream here is amazing. Highly recommend. Parking is tricky though so that's why I give it 4 out of 5.

This place had tasty ice cream milkshakes and among other items. I tried the strawberry shortcake cheesecake milkshake and was impressed. The milkshake wasn't overprices, they had variety, and the ability to customize. I would recommend Ninety's Ice Cream to anyone looking for a good place with sweet treats.

This place is it. Amazing start to finish 10 stars if possible. The atmosphere is hardly the beginning. With the welcome home feeling you get greeted by the best coffee smells anywhere around. Once you step up to order your eyes go wild just looking into the pastry display. And trust that anything you pick will not disappoint. There breakfast sandwiches are top notch with the best croissants I've had ever and amazing fresh ingredients. The best part is there's many coffee options and if your not sure they will recommend exactly what your thinking and it's perfect.
Awesome, the ice cream, smoothie, and people are fantastic! I would recommend this place for a nice relaxing break along the Strip!

Terrible service with coffee that taste like crap. No flavor syrup and suggested I should go to Starbucks downstairs. Seriously?! Took 15 min for a latte to be made when I was the only customer at the time and they have 3 people working.
Raised prices to 24.95 per dozen from 18.95. A 32% increase! Good donuts but not worth that price. Way to stick it to your customers.
I been here several times and everything has been incredible. At least once the cake was dry but the taste was so good I didn't even mind. I always try to stop when I'm driving past.

First visit was great. I have no idea what I had then, but tonight was VERY poor. The macarons were trash, just horrible, and that is where they went immediately. They had great flavor, but were so incredibly dry and old they should have never been sold and certainly not on display. Unfortunately the salted caramel brownies were over cooked and the caramel applied to the brownie after it cooled- so it separated as soon as you started eating. Again tasted good but the texture and experience were poor. Maybe just an off night but I didn't get that sense.

Jeni's never disappoints. This South End scoops shop is a true tastebud experience. The special thing about this place is the cool flavors. While you can order vanilla and chocolate (I can vouch. It's really good!). You really come here to try the cool ones like cherries and goat cheese or Texas sheet cake. My personal favorite is the brambleberry crisp, but the menu is always changing with seasonal flavors so I love trying something new every time. The inside of the store harkens you back to a "modernized" old fashioned ice cream parlor, with all the staff wearing aprons. The staff is super nice, and they let you try as many flavors as you want. You even get to taste on real metal spoons, which is a lot of fun! They thoroughly describe the flavors, and make you feel like you're the only one in the store even though the line wraps outside the door for about 15 minutes. It's definitely a 'treat yo self' kinda place because the ice cream is rich, and is justified by the price. Overall, a can't miss experience if you're in the area!

Best ice cream flavors I have had in a long time. My dad tried the seasonal pumpkin and it was so good he got it twice in one week. I tried the peppermint and was happily surprised that it wasn't too sugary (like store bought) but tasted just like I imagine peppermint flavored ice cream should! Waffle cones are also delicious.
Favorite ice cream spot hands down! Really happy it's located at my side of town. Rarely order ice cream, but when I crave it, I get my fix here

Extremely tasty ice cream, and lots of interesting flavors. Habanero Mango anyone? I'd come back for sure. Location is a bit difficult to find for people not familiar with the place, it is right next to the bicycle shop in case you get lost.

We've tried many different boba milks in Vegas. This place is by far our favorite. Great Boba Milk, great desserts, easy to find location, very clean and great customer service. If you like tiramisu and boba milk then this is your spot!

I stop by there after dining nearby, they really had the social distancing stuff going on I thought that was pretty cool. I realize though that part of the ice cream experience is the social aspect of it. However I cannot take away from the deliciousness of the salted caramel milkshake that I got. It actually beat out the peanut butter milkshake that I used to get about three hours south of here. Overall I say to snaps up Mitchells

Delectable range of flavors that are as fun to dream about (I'm looking at you, 'Netflix & Chill') as they are delicious. I'm fearful of how dangerously close it is to my house and that I'll soon become Fatty Daddy's lesser-known cousin, Roly-Poly Kristy. ;) Fun and friendly team-will be back!

The best donut ice cream sandwiches ever! There waffle ice cream sandwiches were amazing as well! My whole experience here from the moment I got in line to the moment I finished my food was spectacular. Definitely worth the 49 minute drive and I'll definitely be back again!

Yeah, I get the hype now. My first visit was above average, everything was delicious, but I left debating if the 25 minute line was really worth it or not. After craving some elevated soft serve, we made a trip back, and again, and again, and again. Each time trying something different. I get the hype now, this place is legit. They have a ton of different flavored soft serves, all of them are extremely well executed! Their sundaes are enormous and can easily be shared between 2-3 people. While the line may appear long, it does move quickly. Cash only with an ATM on site. The one thing I do wish they did is call out orders via a numbering system. They have designated spots for those who have ordered to wait by and hear their orders being called out, but you have to be paying attention to hear your order called, and know who ordered before/after you, as oftentimes people will get the same things, especially if they're running their seasonal menu. There's been a few times where a customer and I will be in a silent standoff debating if the Nancy B Cookie Sundae was theirs or mine. Would be much easier if they gave you a number which they called out, rather than calling out the order details. Either way, we can't wait for Page Diary Mart to reopen for 2022!
we came twice yesterday for snacks. halfmoon cake was my favorite. i never heard this bakery chain before, but they are good, they almost sold out everything at closing time.

I personally avoid sweets but I make an exception very now and then. The sweet republic gives me a reason to make that exception. The ice creams are definitely delectable and the flavors like lavender aren't your run of the mill ones. I am definitely looking forward to them opening up at sky harbor this spring

Not sure what the fan fare is about. It took 20 minutes of waiting on a Sunday night to finally order ice cream with staff members who didn't seem happy to be there. We had half scoops of whiskey pecan and pumpkin spice. The whiskey pecan could be okay if the pecans were fine ground or small chunks. Pumpkin was disgusting. It was like any other hard ice cream just weird flavors. Very expensive!

Ugh I feel terrible only giving a two star but unfortunately Milk Bar just did not live up to my expectations. I was like that crazy girl who stalks her prey on the internet before finally committing to find/meet the person, or in this case restaurant, in real life. I watched Mind of a Chef. I bought the cook books. I follow on Instagram. So last time I was in Vegas and found out they opened a location it became clear that the time had come. First the line was long. Meh, I've been to Disneyland I don't care. But then when I finally got to order I felt really rushed and flustered. Maybe it was just butterflies. But then It took FOREVER for them to deal up some soft serve with cereal sprinkled on and it was good but not great. It was SO much sugar. And I know sugar. I live for sugar. I eat candy for breakfast. I put maple syrup on almost anything. But there was something that was just not there for me. And the same could be said for the cookies and milk shake we ordered. One of the cookies was good. But the other two were down right bleh. And on top of everything, this ish is expensive. If I'm going to spend that much and wait that long then that monkey better get to dancin.
Delicious desserts...late night hours...adorable establishment...friendly service. What more can one ask for?!?! It was my first visit to Amelie's, but won't be my last.
Great treats. Love the cereal milk latte, and also run the cereal milk soft serve with corn flakes whenever I have the munchies thanks chef tosi!!
Mitchell's ice cream was a fantastic experience. Serving one of America's greatest desserts ice cream. The help was wonderful and the product was top grade.

After reading all the reviews I expected great ice cream, but I did not realize I would also get such an amazing experience. I really wanted to try the Frosted Circus Animal Cookie ice cream, but we went late in the evening after the Grand Avenue Festival and I really did not expect to get to try it. The owners are amazing! I ordered butter pecan from the case, but I mentioned the Frosted Circus Animal Cookie ice cream I really wanted to try even though it was not in the case and they brought some out for me and put a confetti cookie on top without me asking for it. I love the cookies from the store, but the ice cream is so much better!
Fantastic. My favorite cupcake/shop. Theres always a line, but it moves pretty quick. You can't pass Sprinkles without stopping in. You'll be missing out if you do.

I love macaroons so much, I spent $17.50 on 6 macaroons. That was probably the most I spent on anything my entire weekend in Vegas aside from my flight and hotel. What was I thinking?! Well let me tell you... it was DELICIOUS and worth every penny I paid. I think I will go back for another 6 the next time I'm close to a Bouchon bakery. I enjoy their macaroons the most because they're sweet, but not over the top. I get a great taste without the pure sugar overpowering the flavor of the macaroon. I tried the pistachio, chocolate, lemon, vanilla, and coffee. Pistachio and chocolate were my favorite. Their chocolate croissant was delicious. Buttery, light, and flaky. I LOVE flaky croissants even without reheating it! AH HEAVEN. I also got myself a "forgetaboutchu" (?? I forgot), which was alright. It was chewy, salty ,and sweet... Caramel, chocolate, nuts, sea salt. Meh, that $3.25 coulda went towards another macaroon.
My absolute favorite coffee donut spot in the valley. Always fresh and delicious. Fabulous variety.

Ughhhh butter pecan ice cream is the best ice cream I have ever eaten. I don't think I've ever ordered butter pecan in my life but one sample spoon bite changed my life. I got a single scoop of it, which was surprisingly big. Halfway through eating it I started getting nauseous because I was already really full from dinner. But I kept eating and now I'm laying in bed dealing with the consequences of my gluttony. Worth. Every. Bite. Butter pecan: salty, sweet, creamy. Lots of pecans. They had a slight popcorn taste which was cool. Salted chocolate chunk cookie: chewy with crispy edges and a really nice salted taste. Also one of the best cookies I've gotten at an ice cream shop. Please go.

The space is absolutely fantastic, dark and gothic but also homey comfortable, I love it! We tried a few different cakes and pastries and all of them were exceptional, the focus on herbs was pleasant and played really well. I had a herbal tea and my friends had lattes, all were good. I'm definitely adding it to my lawrenceville agenda when I'm in the area!

Hmmm, not bad but I have had creamier custard. I tried the limited edition cherries jubilee with cold fudge topping. Was hoping for fresh cherry flavor since cherries are in season, but got a pepto-bismol pink concoction with strong overly sweet maraschino cherry flavor. Combined with the cold fudge it tasted like those chocolate-covered cherries you can buy in a box at the drugstore. Husband's chocolate custard with almonds on top was a much better choice. We didn't wait in line and the service was fine. I winced at the amount of styrofoam they must be contributing to landfills, but maybe it's needed to make the custard stay cold longer. I'd be happy to use paper and eat faster! Cash only, kids, or take your old-fashioned checkbook.

The absolute worst italian ice (supposedly cherry) I've had. Had to throw it out -- first time I've ever discarded a dessert. I suspect it was 97% corn syrup and 3% Red #5. I'm told by others that their actual dairy-based ice cream is good, but this is a review of my experience, not theirs...

Let me start off by saying I think that my bad experience may be based on how busy they were. The parking lot was packed. After ordering, I tried to find somewhere to sit. I finally found a place in the atrium. Unfortunately it was too far away to use their wifi. After waiting about 20 minutes on my food, I decided to get it to go instead. The girl at the counter was very pleasant and helpful in getting it changed over. As soon as I got to outside I realized the cup of soup was spilling in the bag. Btw- it was portobello & onion, the mushroom seemed like an afterthought in decent french onion soup. I then noticed that the full sandwich I paid for looked very small(they only gave me 1/2 of my full sandwich-the pieces didn't match based on the diagonal cut). At this point, I didn't feel like even going back in to deal with the missing half sandwich. I'm sure someone in the kitchen enjoyed it. I liked my half of the turkey and brie. I'll probably go back, but not if they are packed.

Mood - pastries Upon entering it began. The race to get the pastries. Some shelves were empty, as you walk thru in a semi nice orderly fashion and go to the next station, then an employee calls out fresh bread, everyone scrambles to that area, and takes goodies. The idea of nice orderly fashion out the door, and survival of the fittest sets in. Honestly I was confused, I didn't know I needed a game plan to get all the goodies. We opted for the premium milk, Taro swirl, egg tarts, and cookies, plus beverages. Can I say wow, and I can almost understand why people behaved that way. Interior is of course, the shelves full of goodies, roped area as you wait to pay, a small sitting area in the main room, and a larger seating area in the 2nd room. The tables weren't that clean, however it does seem that most people grab their items and leave. Would def recommend- pricing was reasonable, and can def add up when your getting alot. Be prepared for a line, either outside, or when you've entered and are getting ready to pay. Location is Spring Mountain/ Arville ( Shanghai Plaza) ample parking, can get very congested though

Page's is a Pittsburgh staple and a must stop for anyone visiting. If you go at night time be prepared for a very long line, but it is definitely worth the wait. They have some of the best sundaes you will ever have. My favorite is the grilled sticky buns sundae. It is vanilla ice cream with two warm sticky buns and maple syrup on top. Their chocolate chip cookie sundae is also very good. An underrated part of Page's is their food. They have one of the best cheesesteaks you will find it Pittsburgh. Their burgers are also great.

Their vanilla macaron was the best thing I ate in Vegas (which included Wynn Buffet, Aloha Kitchen, BLT, rm Seafood) $3.50 isn't so bad because they're larger than most macarons I've seen. They sell a 5 pack with all of their macaron flavors for $16.50. The carrot cake cookie sandwich ($3.50) was very big and I liked how it didn't have raisins. No complaints. I'd stay away from their red velvet cupcakes. They have a strange filling and the cake had too much cocoa. Tasted more like a chocolate cupcake more than anything.

Really good, long line. Much smaller than the NYC store, but bigger than the Vegas location. When we got there early, we saw EVERYTHING available. We went again before we left Napa, and A LOT of stuff were gone. :( Everything is pretty expensive, but I absolutely love their baked goods.

This place is amazing! I secretly knew Thomas Keller couldn't disappoint me. After visiting Bouchon in LA, I knew we had to make a pit stop to his bakery here. I've personally never had a good macaroon before but Bouchon has since convinced me such deliciousness exists. The chocolate macaroon was beyond heavenly! I can't wait to try the other flavors next time. The chocolate croissant was to die for too. Crispy on the outside but soft and chocolate-y on the inside. What more could you ask for?! The BF also ordered their mocha special and was pleasantly surprised by the hint of nutmeg. Everything here was outstanding!
Yes it's fabulous. ..the food is amazing ...theres.no words to describe it..worth stopping by if in Las vegas...

Don't limit yourself to Fremont St when visiting downtown Vegas - especially at breakfast time. The donut bar is a block away and serves up some pretty righteous gourmet donuts. This aint Dunkin Donuts here - they've got some funky flavors like Reeses Peanut Butter topped with chunks of the candy bar. The flavor is fantastic and they dress em up all fancy like =) And the price is right too. Coffee and a donut here costs less than just a coffee at Starbucks.

omfg i LOVE LOVE LOVE this place.. parisan macaron's are GINORMOUS and SO cheap. I loved the pistachio macarons and raspberry macarons!!! The bakery was located right below from where i was staying in the venentian. If you ever go to New York or Las Vegas, you HAVE to try this place.. i can't wait for the next time i go to las vegas cause my mouth is watering just thinking about those ginormous macarons. Until then i guess i'll just have to pay for overpriced tiny ass macarons :(. Til we meet again sweet airy delicious macarons. PST.. my cousin tried to eclairs and she said they were pretty good. If that's the case, going to the actual store is going to be on my to do list!

I've always wanted to try Jeni's out and I'm so glad I was able to! The flavors that they offer are so unique and artisanal and they had a good amount of choices for dairy free, which is extremely important since 40 million Americans are lactose intolerant! My only complaint is that it's a bit pricey, but if you're going out to eat ice cream at an establishment that makes it fresh in house and has such unique flavors you can't ~really~ complain.

Don't worry: the calories consumed in Vegas, stay in Vegas ;) Donut Bar Las Vegas is very well-known, but I wasn't searching for this gem when I stumbled across it. In the Fremont Street Experience Area, Donut Bar is a cute, small donut shoppe that was put on the map with its signature Big Poppa Tart donut (it has a PopTart inside of it!). Let me tell you: if you have a sweet tooth, you'll LOVE this donut. It was simultaneously filling and light letting me get my fill without bloating me. In addition, the workers were SO sweet and patient, telling me about all the donuts I had a question about. This place is the MOST recommended foodie destination for anyone visiting Vegas (well, Most Recommended by me, anyways). Love, love, love! Service, donuts, and price are all five stars :)
Edible cookie dough, sooo good. It's almost too good, this is one of my favorite dessert shops. If you don't follow them on Instagram you should - I can't eat it everyday but I can definitely look !

Disappointed. Just had a red velvet cupcake and I've actually had better from a grocery store bakery at home. The cake was very bland and the abundant icing was just saccharin sweet with no flavor aside from pure sugar. I grew up in NJ and hope that Carlos' more traditional confections are better, because this cupcake was an embarrassment to my heritage.

One of my absolute favorite laces on Charlotte. The potato and leek soup is amazing especially when paired with the croque Monsieur! Open 24 hours a day...one of the only places in the area that does this which is a major plus if you're a night owl :) staff is friendly, all the food and desserts are good...simply put this place rocks

This place is a gem in phoenix! My coworkers and I heard rave reviews about this place during happy hour and knew we needed to pay it a visit before leaving. The place is very small but it definitely takes customers down memory lane with the decorations and beverages. They make donut icecream sandwiches and i highly recommend trying it! or the flight of ice creams if youre indecisive but the owner is also super generous and will let you sample everything if youre willing to ask (i was and i tried EVERY flavor. #noshame). The donut icecream sandwiches are also toasted a little so it's warm when you take a bite! All the flavors are amazing but the Madagascar vanilla, chocolate and strawberry are rich and really takes basic to a whole new level! I ended up choosing the lavender vanilla and it was light and delightful.

This bakery has some great Italian pastries, like cannolis and lobster claws. They are pretty close to New York bakeries. Great assortment: cookies, cheesecakes, biscotti, shortcake, specialty cakes. Always a line to order so you know it has to be good.
Good place for ice cream on a nice day. The line can get pretty long, but it typically moves quickly.

After my dinner at B&B Burger where no dessert is offered, I walked around the corner to this little spot where I got a pumpkin tart. The tart was very good and just what I'd expect from Bouchon. The only problem with this small outlet near the sports book and clock tower is there is no place to sit. It is almost entirely takeout. The tart was boxed which wasn't necessary. I ended up removing the tart from the box and using one of their plastic forks to start eating the tart. I soon gave up and picked it up and ate it like that. There's a water dispenser at the bar with the plasticware and sugars/creams for coffee, but it wasn't working. After finishing, I went to the nearest bathroom in the casino to wash my hands. A great little pastry and a perfect end to a dinner somewhere else!
Great spot for a quick bite. A little too pricey for the food and we sat so close to other people but overall great
Very good! I liked the coffee a lot and the ice cream was, of course, amazing. I also thought the employees were very friendly and welcoming. I'll definitely be back.
Super fresh and a large selection to choose from. Staff is friendly and helpful. Best donuts in town
1st time and ice cream is yummy. We had salted Carmel and chocolate. They also have shakes, and dairy free sorbets

The Lobster tail and strawberry shortcake...omg my mouth is watering just thinking about these.... ahhhhhhh. My cousin Keane, his wife Adriana, my bf Javan and I decided to go to Carlos' Bakery the night before we had to leave Vegas. We decided the go 1 hour before they were closing and upon arriving there wasn't too long of a line and plenty of desserts and sweets to choose from. Adriana strongly recommended the lobster tail to me and when I saw the strawberry shortcake it was too hard to pass up. I also purchased one of their cannolis to see what it was about. Ordering and paying was quick and easy. The staff was very nice and helpful too. I barely watched Cake Boss when it was on TV but I was definitely hyped for this spot and the hype is real! If you're going to visit, get the lobster tail for sure. The crunchiness of the shell and buttercream together are a match made in heaven! The strawberry shortcake wasn't too sweet and just the right size to eat. The cannolis was soft the day after I bought it but still good. If you're at the Venetian, stop by and grab a lobster tail. You won't be disappointed!

My Order: Cookie Monster. I haven't had much ice cream in Phoenix yet but it was a fantastic flavor. Will be visiting again to try out the leslie knope. Price: Appropriate for what we got. Service: Excellent, polite and quick. Seating/Social Distancing: No tables in the patio section in front of the serving window. Employees wearing masks. Doing the best they can. Parking: Free. Not crowded when I went. Street parking or small lot.
Solid ice cream spot that's open until 10pm. Got the maple pecan and it didn't disappoint. Try out the flavors prior to committing to an order.

Donuts are okay. They have an interesting selection. Pricier than average, but you pay for the novelty. Had a caramel espresso donut. Seems like a regular yeast donut heavily iced. It was huge. I didn't taste coffee but it was covered in caramel. Tried the birthday cake donut. It was okay. After the hype from others, I expected more. I prefer Crunch donuts for novelty.
Love this place the icecream is amazing my only complaint is they run out of cookies so I miss out on my favorites a lot . The salted caramel with a chocolate chip cookie is crazy good.

You must try this place! I'm glad I did and can't wait to try more goodies from this place. My first try was an egg tart from here--heavenly custard!! It was so tasty and smooth with a perfect flaky crust. Oh. My. God. And, it's size? Perfect! A great treat to cap off a busy day. I'm definitely going to be back to try their coffee and other bakery items. A++++ all around!
We had the ice cream-stuffed doughnut and it was amazing! Pretty good size, one is perfect for sharing. Fun live music in the outdoor seating area, too.

I would like to recognize Kris for outstanding customer service. I called one night about purchasing a slice of Elvis cake the next day, and was advised to prepay over the phone to guarantee its availability at 9 AM the next morning. I was appreciative of that suggestion. Disappointedly I was told at 9 AM at the store that no slices were available. The cashier asked Kris for assistance. He listened to my account and made it happen in 15 minutes! A similar situation occurred again on Mother's Day that the strawberry lemon slice was not available at 9 AM when I had been told that it would be. Once again, Kris made it happen. He is attentive, generous and considerate. I also very much appreciate Las Vegas Milk Bar offering cake slices. Otherwise I would have missed out on sampling the cake varieties.

I feel like the hype is a little too much for this place. Don't get me wrong, I thought what I ordered was delicious, but the dessert doesn't seem to reflect the price for me. Pros: -The Cereal Milk ice cream with the Cereal topping add on is delicious! (The milk does taste like how it would after you eat all the cereal. AND the crunchiness from the cereal pieces on the bottom and top were a good bite!) -the cookies are laid out In their wrapping so you can see what they look like before buying them. -the cashiers are quite nice and helpful when it's your first time! -the crack pie was good -cute and picturesque packaging Cons: -To get here, you have to go to the Cosmopolitan on the strip. (I'm a local and not a fan or trying to just get dessert but having to get on the strip. Good for tourists though. Stay for less than an hour and parking is FREE!) -the portions of the Cereal Milk ice cream and the crack pie were fairly small. (Think the "like it" from Cold Stone if you know what I mean) -the price for each was a bit ridiculous for the amount and taste you got (in my opinion) Cereal Milk ice cream: $6 but extra $1.25 for cornflake crunch. Crack pie is $6.50 per slice and fairly small. I'm glad I gave it a try, especially since I didn't get to in NY, but I think I'll stay away for now. If I do go back, I hope to try their cake truffles and their cookies! My cousin and her friend bought 12!

The ice cream flavors are so good. The sweetness level was just right for me. We had the salted buttered caramel and the brownie swirl. It's a good spot for a quick ice cream run or a place to chat and relax.
Get a Southside Shake with hot fudge shake and peanut butter sundae on top - absolutely amazing!
Staff is so lovely and really take care of you. Even during the pandemic they managed to stay sweet. Recommend this ice cream shop over any.

They now sell slices of cake. CAKE!! Fall fast for the fall season Pumpkin Dulce de Leche or indulge in a classic birthday cake. Tried some cookies this time around. Nothing corny about a classic sweet Corn, the Blueberry & Cream is like a solid cheesecake without the cheese, and the Compost is all sorts of sugar, salt, savor, and crunch. We got half a Milkbar pie to go as well. It's the same thing as the crack pie with a family-friendly name because "family-friendly" is the first thing that comes to mind when I think about Vegas... They make it in ice cream too, and it's the best kind of sugar rush. I'll never get tired of the desserts at Milk Bar - they're quickly becoming a classic, and no matter how long they've been around, they'll never get old.

Came here after a dinner at tornado. I'm sure this place would be great if you love ice cream since there are so many flavors, but I thought the butter pecan I got was average. Not as creamy/milky as I would have hoped, but the staff was super patient and nice and let me sample the flavors I wanted to
There aren't any clear signs of where the Bouchon bakery is. It is not near the bistro... :( ask for directions. Hehe.

If you have patience, you will find it worth the wait to get a crepe from CrÃªpes De Luxe. Taking a long overdue trip to the West Side Market from Lake County, it was important to get breakfast before buying all of the tempting goodies my fiancÃ© and I could carry. First word of advice: if you see there are fewer than 10 people in line, get in line. If you decide to come back, you will likely find the line got much longer and so, too, will be the wait. Another piece of advice: before you get in line, examine the menu carefully. It will be difficult to read once you get in line. There are a number of really great options to choose from, both sweet and savory, and you can also order your own custom crepe. Our tastes this particular morning were varied, so my fiancÃ© ordered the savory Florence (egg, spinach, Gruyere cheese), and I ordered the Black and Red, a sweet crepe of strawberries and Nutella (chocolate is an option to the Nutella). The ingredients were all fresh and most of them prepped right before us. The crepes were huge, very flavorful, and a substantial breakfast both of us enjoyed. Final piece of advice: Be sure to grab extra napkins because as you get to the end of your crepe it could become a bit unwieldy and fall apart. You might even wish to use a fork to enjoy these tasty treats with minimal mess.
Churn has some of the best ice cream I've ever had! What an amazing, nostalgic and fun spot.

Small Business Saturday in Concord. So glad I tried this place. The Italian cream cake is loaded with pecans and sooooo good! - a surprise for the hubby. The cannoli is well balanced and perfectly cinnamony - all mine!!! Friendly and warm service. Highly recommended!!

There's only like 3 places my husband and I would drive out to Phoenix for from the East Valley and Scooptopia is one of them. :) I am so happy that there's a Filipino desserts spot in such a fun area of Phoenix. They seriously serve the best halo halo in town! I have yet to go and try their taho, and I'm sure it's just as good. They also have the best customer service ever! You don't want to miss out on this place.
An institution worth the title. Exceptionally delicious homemade ice cream. Glad to see Mary Coyle's live on! Pb chocolate is da bomb!

The food quality is outstanding, but the service last Sunday around 2pm was some of the worst customer service I have ever had. I ordered two coffee drinks and was treated like an idiot because I didn't know that a "standard shot" is actually two shots of espresso. I ordered one drink with an added shot. She corrected me telling me that drink is called something different when served in a cup vs mug, and when I received the drink from the barrista, she called it something different entirely!
