Who knew coffee could be so complicated?! The person at the counter spoke down to me, then went to chat with her coworkers while I waited. The drinks were not started until after they finished chatting. I asked for clarification on how many shots I was getting and she just did not do a good job explaining and made me feel like a moron. I hope they correct this problem, because I really want to keep going there.
andrew is such a king fr. this man scooped my ice cream with love. he needs a raise. love u andrew

This is one of my favorite places to grab last minute goodies for work, parties, and celebrations. Heck even goodies for myself. Bread is made fresh, and there are so many selections. Cakes are bountiful and fresh even on holidays. And there are drinks and slivers of cakes. In all my years going to 85 degrees (in California), I've never gotten the drinks. But I can attest that the bread and cakes are delicious. Most recently I came here to pick up a tiramisu cake for Father's Day, which of course was a hit. The cake was soft and moist and not overly sweet. Most of the time you don't even have to book your cake in advance.

5 stars for friendly staff. 1 star for pastries. Disappointed. Cannoli was old, waxy and had funny flavor after. Bananas on the pie were old & dried. We ended up throwing everything away. because it was so bad.
I think the best macaroons I've ever had. Fluffy light outer cookie with perfect not-too-sweet flavor. If you're int he Venetian you gotta try this.

Great ice cream. I had the goat cheese and cherry ice cream which had a nice sweet and tart flavor to it. Others in my party had the Texas Chocolate Cake ice cream. They didn't even notice it was dairy free and loved it just the same. In fact they didn't believe me when I said the sign said that flavor was dairy free. That's when you know they've got the flavor profile right! There weren't any tables out because of CoVid and parking is limited so plan accordingly. Some people were eating their ice cream on the steps outside the building but not the most comfortable option. We just ate as we walked back to our car. Still fun given their unique flavors!

Oh my gosh. This is the bakery in my dreams. I have always wanted to go on a date with my husband to a place like this and it was absolutely heavenly. Everything looked delicious but we ordered two Creme BrÃ»lÃ©es, one vanilla bean and one mixed fruit. We also had one of their famous caramel brownies. The creme brÃ»lÃ©es were torched after we ordered them so they were perfect and so creamy. You could see the tiny vanilla bean caviar in the cream! It was soo flavorful. The brownie was like nothing I'd ever had before. It looked overwhelmingly sweet at first sight but when I took that first bite, I immediately went for another. It was crunchy on the bottom, soft in the middle and caramel salty sweet on top. I loved it! It's too bad we don't have a place like this in Tucson, Az! Hint hint!

I've been coming to Page's since I was a kid and at 25 I still get that "YAY ICE CREAM!" feeling when I go here. Their soft serve ice cream is great and their Hawaiian Ice/Slushes come in several different flavors. The dips on their ice cream cones are very good and very popular as well. However, my favorite thing to get their is their Artic Swirls which also come in distinct and fun flavors (I really enjoy the Banana Cream Pie). Did I mention the great prices and friendly staff? This place has been a staple of the South Hills and it never fails to attract a large crowd of people. You can't go wrong with Page's!

Hella expensive and it did not meet my expectations. Lol the worker tried to convince us to buy two lobster tails because as he put it "is like a piece of heaven"... idk about him but if that was his heaven then that's pretty sad. The lobster tail looked good don't get me wrong, but the taste and texture wasn't amaze balls. The outer shell was crunchy and hard, not flaky and soft. We also got an individual strawberry cheesecake with crumbs and for the size of my palm (and I have a small palm) you pay $10 for okay cheesecake. I wouldn't mind paying if it was a GOOD pastry but I did not think this was at all worth the money.

The famous Churn ice cream. They are attached to Windsor restaurant and a fun establishment. They have old time toys and candies to browse through while you wait for your ice cream. We went right after they opened so we had to wait about 15 minutes for them to put out all the ice cream but the employee engaged us and looking through the toys killed the time. I had the pineapple sorbet in a cake cone and my boyfriend had the Vietnamese coffee. The Vietnamese coffee was very sweet and uses real coffee ground. Delicious! It was perfectly creamy and just like drinking a cup of Vietnamese coffee. The pineapple sorbet was very refreshing and crumbly. Delicious. The reason I took a star away was lack of preparation before opening and the only bad thing: stale cone. My cake cone was so stale that I took 2 bites of it and threw it away. Yuck! Being socked in the sorbet didn't help at all. I'll be back but next time, I'll just get it in the cup.
The brownies are amazing. The deserts are perfect. Short wait time and great customer service!

East coast gal visiting. This place was to par with the donut speciality shops near Manhattan but I was disappointed in how they were sold out within an hour of opening. They were also expensive in my opinion. The donuts were great, coffee was okay. The self serve coffee bar needed to be restocked.

Churn is one of my two favorite ice cream places in the central valley (the other is Sweat Republic). Churn makes their ice cream from natural ingredients and it is good... like "oh man that is good" good.. They also have Illy espresso which is amazing by itself but even better poured over ice cream. There is one problem however... Churn has some of the WORST parking ever! It is right next to (and owned by same owner i believe) the Windsor, which also doesn't have enough parking... Given the parking issue and the recent opening of Sweet Republic on 16th st., I will most likely go there instead. I will say that Churn's ice cream is a bit "milkier" or "creamier" than sweet Republic's, but they have less adventurous flavors as well. You wont go wrong with either shop... If you can find parking at Churn. Update! Churn no longer has parking issues which is fantastic! They do however use some ingredients in their ice cream that are questionable if you are looking for all natural product... They sometimes use candies for their ice creams that may contain food coloring or other ingredients that someone who is trying to follow a stricter dietary regimen may find questionable.

I tried the canoli ($3.95)pastry from here and it was so good. The place was a mad house, just like it is on TV, but the employees are friendly and attentive. There was just enough variety to choose from, based on the size of the store, which wasn't too bad. I would go back again to try more baked goods.

This is the de-facto hipster place to go in Charlotte. If paying an arm and leg for pastries that cost next to nothing to make is your idea of cool, you will fit in here. The pastries taste good, but they are nothing special and not worth the price. This is not a "must visit" foody destination in Charlotte, and you are certainly paying a premium for its popularity. I would be willing to bet that 90% of AmÃ©lie's fans have never baked before. Avoid.

If you like donuts that not only look good, but taste even better, get over to Donut Bar. Many times I come across donuts that look cool, but don't taste good. The donuts here are the exception. Made fresh daily, with a variety of flavors, Donut Bar is a local favorite (and I can taste why). Be sure to get here early since they sell out quickly. The staff here is super friendly which is always a plus. The prices? Great for the types of donuts they sell.
Lived up to my expectations after watching Cake Boss all those years. Went back three times during our visit! Definitely recommend finding and their Restaurant across the way is awesome too!

It took me many years to get out to Scottsdale to taste the goodness of Sweet Republic and boy am I glad I did!! Delicious ice creams and a cool store!!! Loved the flavors and the fact that they are made in small batches. Writing this review has me wanting to drive 40 minutes to get me some Sweet Republic ice cream :)

Villani's has been a sanity-saver during the pandemic! Tasty treats and great health/safety protocols go great together. I've been calling ahead to place my order, providing my payment method, and then picking up at their takeout window 10-15 minutes later. They have a very active Instagram account which allows you to keep up with their rotating cheesecake and macaron flavors and- trust me- it will keep you drooling!

Uhhhh i cant get enough of captain crunch i LOVE it! I live in Gilbert and i go all the way to Phoenix just to eat ice cream here! I probably pass 10 ice cream shops on my way and nothing stops me from coming here! My fiance is driving me there as we speak mmmmmmm LOVE ITTT!

There are few things in life that make me as happy as really good chocolate and really good ice cream. Thus sweet republic is my personal temple to the ice cream gods, where I go to worship the two asian artisan ladies who invent the weirdest and coolest and most delicious flavours of ice cream I have tasted. Wow. Everything is made in house with real, fresh ingredients (as in real mint for the peppermint ice cream). On weekends you can enjoy caramelised bacon flavoured ice cream and their salted caramel is their overall best seller. Their sorbets are definately worth a try too. A tasty, lower "impact" alternative to their full cream varieties. Dont be shy to try exotic things such as their three cheese ice cream or chocolate turtle (chocolate with fudge swirls and cashews), my favourite. Whatever you do, order some salted caramel sauce on top of your creation if you have even the smallest hope it may go with your chosen flavour. It is THE BEST! And on a chocolate ice cream it is an absolute dream. The ladies are always friendly and happy to let you try their alchemical concoctions. A lovely place to unashamedly live out all of your wildest ice cream fantasies.

I love EVERYTHING here ... literally, There's all kinds of yummy desserts here such as cookies and cakes & my personal favorite is the rainbow cake it's DELICIOUS Every time I visit Las Vegas I have to make a stop here just for that rainbow cake!! I usually buy one slice of it & then regret why I didn't buy 2 But the good thing is, that it's a giant slice and serves me twice!!!!! Yaayyy

Sprinkles was right outside The Flamingo Hotel! I had had sprinkles cupcakes before in Chicago and they were amazing! This shop was spacious and had cupcakes and ice cream. The attendants were very friendly/helpful and everything was very clean. There is a Sprinkles ATM (vending machine style) outside of the shop but the store offers more flavors. My husband had never had sprinkles and is now obsessed. I got the Strawberry Champagne and he got a Red Velvet. Both were so yummy. The cake was moist and the icing was flavorful without being too heavy or over powering. I am sure we will be visiting the Chicago location more often now! If you have never had a Sprinkles cupcake you haven't had the best. Get you some!
OMG!!! Sugar-Tooth-Heaven!!! As a kid I enjoyed rainbow cake. Italian/American folks know what I am talking about. Carlo's Bake Shop nailed it. The chocolate strawberries are so freaking good.

Really good! Has some yummy chunks within, and I enjoyed the texture, but more so the flavours. You can see them making it through the glass behind the counter and the kids corner that Bek and I had a lot of fun drawing at haha. Lovely little place
Everything is delicious - haven't had a bad dish yet. Tartine was crispy and perfect portion. Coffee is good. Deserts - yum Negative - always busy and loud, pricy

After a less then pleasant experience with another bakery I needed to find my wife 's favorite cake, carrot cake, somewhere else. After reaching out to friends, Batch bakehouse was a consensus to try out. I am glad I did so, their carrot cake was wonderful and my wife loved it. Thank you Batch for wonderful dessert and also making the ordering very easy online. I can not wait to try other delectables from your bakery.

We had a long wait in line about 30 to 40 minutes. It was worth the wait the crumb cake was on the stale side we did get our money back from that. But other than that the cupcakes the lobster tail was delicious. It was worth the wait in line

Great atmosphere, pretty good desserts. Good pecan pie. Do not love the macaroons here, they are a little bit hard. Try the ones at Le Macaron at Metropolitian if that's what you are in the market for.

I'm not going to lie, but I could smell Sloan's from 3 stores away. You can not walk past Sloan's without getting some delicious treat! They have everything ranging from ice cream, to donuts, cookies and much much more. If you are looking for a place to fulfill your sweet tooth Sloan's is the way to go. The prices aren't that bad either.

I should sue for false advertisement. The bag listed only 3 locations of Bouchon but then I come to find out that there are 5 locations (2 in NYC, 1 in Vegas, and 1 in LA). This bakery is hidden (at least in my eyes) because it is located behind and underneath the escalator at Venetian! If I recall correctly, I saw pastries (croissants, danishes, muffins), sandwiches (ham and Swiss baguettes), cakes, cupcakes, cookies, eclairs, and what I came for: macaroons. Macaroons sell at $3 a piece however, I must admit that they are huge and I should have opted that route however, being the fatty that I am, I bought a pack of mini macaroons for $13 (all flavors: coffee, chocolate, vanilla, pistachio, raspberry, and caramel). The macaroons were light, fluffy, and smooth (the filling)... I can't describe it in words that can fully justify the macaroons but I reckon I will be back every time I am in Vegas simply because I work hard and workout hard so $13 for a pack of macaroons that I can devour entirely in less than 24 hours? Hell to the yes. I should have bought 2 for the plane ride home.

Flavor everyone's got to try - Cookie Monster. Delicious creamy ice cream. Dozens of other cold desserts to have. When you visit, make sure you bring a cooler and some ice because you're going to want to bring something home.

I was very disappointed in the cereal milk soft serve. There was no flavor and it wasn't good at all. I've ordered it at the NY location so I know what it's supposed to taste like. Total waste of $6. The crack pie was pretty good. I ended up dipping it in the soft serve to try and give it more flavor.

Located in the Eastern and 215 shopping center, Somi somi has taken over the old Rolled Ice cream space. We went on opening day and it was a little bit of a cluster, as you expect from opening day. But we've been there 4 times since their grand opening, a month ago, and they have definitely smoothed out the kinks and now is like a well oiled machine. Somi Somi is a Korean inspired dessert place. Their signature is the Taiyaki, which is a fish shaped pastry filled with a filling of your choice: cheddar, Nutella, custard, red bean, Taro and Oreo. Taiyakis are 2 for $3.95 or 5 for $7.95. The taiyaki are perfection. Crispy on the outside and chewy and perfect once you bite in. We chose the custard, Nutella, red bean and Oreo fillings. All were really good. The Oreo was a little dry as it's just an Oreo cookie broken in half and placed in the middle. We also ordered the Ahboong $5.95 which is soft serve with a fish cone on top. Soft serve flavors change out as they are seasonal. When we went we tried the matcha, Oreo and ube swirl. The soft serve was thick and creamy. Tasted so rich, like frozen custard. Sooo good! Mashisoyo. You can choose a filling to fill inside the Ahboong as well but we opted not to. Once your order is ready, you go to the pick up counter and can add complimentary toppings like a macaron shell, sprinkles or a fresh strawberry. So incredibly happy to have Somi Somi come down to the Henderson area. A great new and fresh addition to the sea of restaurants on Eastern. Check it out you will not be disappointed. There taiyaki is the best we've ever had.

How do I start I love this place for their soft serve cereal milk Ice cream. I go out of my way at times just to go here for dessert. I live in Vegas so it's one of my go to places. I don't like the other flavors that much like the crack pie or salted pretzel way too salty for me and i don't know jus too much for me but they have another one fruity cereal that I love but they don't have all the time what a bummmer. I also recommend the cake truffles if you want a burst of sweetness in your mouth. You can also take them home and freeze them if you like! Overall this place is awesome I love the vibe the girls are always friendly there! And they give big samples!
Authentic French pastries; late hours; plenty of casual and relaxed dining. Oh, by the way - they do lunch too!

I have had several good experiences at Chocolate Shoppe, and I appreciate that they have vegan options! However, I was quite disappointed during my last visit. First, I ordered a "vegan milkshake with ultimate oreo soy and peanut butter" (peanut butter was one of the listed topping options, and I have gotten a shake with peanut butter at that location before). When I got my shake, it didn't look like it had any peanut butter, so I asked the employee if they included the peanut butter and they said "the peanut butter cups?" and I said, "I actually ordered peanut butter, and I don't think the peanut butter cups are vegan." The employee looked at me like I was an idiot and said "it's confusing, but we don't have peanut butter... I guess I can re-make it without the peanut butter cups but no peanut butter" and slammed it down on the counter. I said, "no thanks, I'd actually like to switch to a scoop of the raspberry nebula soy in a pretzel cone" and the employee said "well the pretzel cone has dairy in it" (this is contrary to what I've been told in the past, and I'm pretty sure the employee who told me that it was vegan had checked the ingredients list, so I'm interested to know what the correct answer is). I was so disappointed in the service I received that I decided to leave without getting anything, what a bummer.
Amazing ice cream! One of the best in downtown Charlotte! Service was quick and fast even though the line is always usually busy!

Absolutely 10/10 experience every time we come to Amelie's! Such a cool vibe that is 100% backed up by its delicious food and pastries, and wonderful staff! Allana (apologies if I spelled it wrong) helped us this time and was moving the large crowd through efficiently while also being so sweet and helpful!

Milk Bar is a hit for a reason. I was skeptical, but all that skepticism went away upon trying the treats here. First of all, I will say this place is quite pricey for the small quantity you get. But man, is it amazing. The Cereal Milk soft serve is amazing, which has a slight sweetness but is accentuated by notes of saltiness, like actual corn flake cereal! We like to have this with the corn flake topping, as the crunch offsets the smooth ice cream. Another go to for us is the Crack Pie. It is called Crack Pie for a reason. Though it might be on the sweeter side, it is delicious. Similar to the Cereal Milk soft serve, it is a very sweet pie that is accompanied with notes of saltiness and bite to it from the rolled oats that are within. I hope you guys enjoy this place as much as I do!

ICE CREAM HEAVENBest butter pecan & raspberry ice cream with banana split, butter pecan, rocky road & raspberry drizzled with Carmel & Hot Fudge, whipped cream & cherry = "Nick's Delight". Will be bringing all 12 of my grandkids to this Ice Cream Heaven next visit

There are a variety of pastries that you can choose from. They bake it there at their bakery. All pastries are individually wrapped. You take a tray and grab whatever you want and place it on the tray. Then, you stand in line to pay for it. They also have drinks and whole cakes that you could buy as well. I got a marble taro bun, guava strudel, and a Hokkaido custard. All where amazing! The marble taro bun was very soft and chewy! On the inside there's a thick taro filling that tasted so comforting! It went so well with the bread! The guava strudel was very tasty! The guava filling was strong and the breading on the outside was very flaky, crunchy and not too sweet. I wish there was more guava filling! But, it was yummy! The Hokkaido custard was delicious! It tasted like a milk cheesecake! It was soft and creamy and the crust was baked to perfection. Soft and crunchy at the same time. I definitely would get these items again. I will be back here to try the other pastries!

This is such a gem of an ice cream destination. Be prepared, the shop is very small and there is hardly any seating, plan to take this ice cream to go. The ambiance of the shop is so cure, it's very much decorated like a vintage ice cream parlor with lots of toys and candy in the background that you can also purchase. They have a wide array of flavors, with made non traditional options. I love their floats and sundaes!

Bought extra thick cookies and cream milkshake. I couldn't drink it fast enough with a straw. Extremely runny from the time it was handed to me. Clerks were friendly as they took my money and handed me my liquid shake.
Very expensive for it (my hot fudge Sunday) to be served in. Plastic cup & spoon. What happen to the large glass goblets & metal spoons?

Wowwwwww - this is an amazing full service bakery. They have every pastry and cake you can imagine, cookies, brownies, cannolis, cream horns, cream puffs, Italian cookies, and homemade cheesecake. They also have several types of croissants, which is what we chose for breakfast. I had a cappuccino, and my husband had a caramel latte. Both were very good and at a nice value. We would love to return (and might go back today to take some goodies home).
The creamy coffee beans favor is unforgettable. Not too sweet and It went well with the peanut chocolate coated waffle bowl.

This place is awesome! The atmosphere. The music. The people. Yes, yes, yes! The Maiko Special is so good. Normally these layered desserts are super (too) sweet but this one is amazing. You can taste the flavors of each item in the cup and nothing is too sweet. The mochi is on point.

Finally,was able to try their halo-halo which I was dreaming of for quite a while.. It's a distance from where I live, but since my grandson was in town visiting and wanted halo-halo--- we then drove 30 minutes just to get there. It was not a disappointment! It's a family owned store. Gina and her daughter were very accommodating! Her daughter who was taking orders was very considerate with what my grandson requested for his halo-halo. I also got us gulaman & taho & the frozen pork BBQ (which I found cheaper & fresher than the oriental stores). We took it to go and my grandson was eating his halo-halo on our way home but just kept on saying that it was really the BEST halo-halo he has tasted!!! Definitely will be going back & driving that distance just to get our craving satisfied...

After watching tons of episodes of cake boss, you can bet that I really wanted to try these seemingly mouth watering desserts. I was absolutely thrilled that I could finally taste it, and not just imagine how it would taste! The appearance of the store imitates the Hoboken store from the show, and there's also a window where you can watch people decorating things, which is kind of cool. When I went, it was only the second day it was open, so it was pretty crowded. You take a number, and when it gets called you get to order your desserts. Then you have to get that same number called again so you can get it all packaged and pretty and pay for your stuff. There's not a lot of sitting room, so plan to take your desserts home. If you're really impatient, you could always sit on a bench by the "canals" in the Venetian and eat them while watching the gondolas. EVERYTHING LOOKS DELICIOUS! I settled on the "lobstertail", which is a pastry stuffed with I think it's french cream, since it seemed to be something sort of unique to Carlo's Bakery. It was so good! The outside was flaky and crispy, and the inside was rich without being too sweet. It was so perfect! I'm definitely looking forward to trying more desserts! The big problem will just be what to get next!
Good value for what u get. Huge portions affordable price. Would highly recommend! Great service from staff! Not as good as sweet moses but still recommend

A small shop tucked inside The LINQ shopping plaza leading to the High Roller Ferris wheel that I chanced upon when staying next door at the Flamingos. I've been to OG Ghirardelli location in San Francisco as well as the one on Hollywood Blvd in Los Angeles and am a big fan of their sundaes so had to indulge. As the shop is small it seemed pretty crowded even though there weren't too many people inside. Like the location in San Francisco there was a cutie at the door passing out one Ghirardelli chocolate square free to each person who walked in so that was a nice touch. During this visit I got the Warm Brownie Sundae ($9.45; most of their sundaes are priced around $10) and managed to get a high chair facing the outside window. As usual the sundae was excellent. Yes, it was pricy but entirely justified as they provide a healthy portion without compromising on product quality. Yelp check-in get's you a dollar off, so do use that. Surprisingly I've never bought any chocolates from Ghirardelli outlets just sundaes, so apart from the standard Ghirardelli chocolates that one can buy in any supermarket I don't have much to contribute. Goes without saying that this Ghirardelli location also gets two thumbs up from me.

BEST BEST BEST MACAROONS!!!! When I visited New York City last November (2012) I've been on the hunt for awesome macaroons because I've never really liked them until I tasted it there and one of the places I've tried was Bouchon Bakery. This past trip to Vegas (Oct. 2013) me and the boyfriend and some friends stayed at the Palazzo and the 1st day we arrived, we past by Bouchon bakery on the bottom of Venetian hotel so you know I had to get me some macaroons...yes, it's a little pricey for just one but come on' they are awesome macaroons and the macaroons are actually big and fluffy and creamy and sweet and delicious! I made my boyfriend buy me macaroons from here and the Bouchon bakery next to the Venetian theater everyday we were in Vegas....yes it's that good! I tried the salted caramel, vanilla, seasonal and pistachio flavor but any flavor is legit good!...The lemonade drink is also refreshingly yummy!

Service was good and staff friendly - I got a slice of the caramel pretzel chocolate cake and while the frosting and fillings were excellent the cake itself nearly dissolved in my mouth and not in a good way. So I ended up eating around it which was disappointing considering the hype around the cakes here and the $14/slice price tag.

Oh Mitchell's, how I love your ice cream! I particularly love the seasonal flavors that this place makes. On my most recent visit, there was an autumn apple ice cream on the seasonal board - a cider ice cream with caramel swirl and almonds, that I had as a caramel sundae. It was delightful. My only complaint is the amount of nuts used in the recipes - for those with nut allergies (not myself, but one of my friends who was with me), Mitchell's can seem limiting. He ended up with a scoop filled with brownie chunks that he was very happy with. Scoops are generous, the ice cream is rich & satisfying, and I have never been unhappy with a choice I've made at Mitchell's!

Fugetaboutit... From an Italian and former New Yorker, this place is very overrated. Rainbow cookie was stale with a smear of raspberry jam in it. Save your money. Don't believe the hype and be a sucker for the old "he's got a show on TLC" jig.

I have been a fan of amelies for years, I usually never complain but I have to say....since covid it's not the same...the pastries are just "okay" tasting although they are still pretty and the attitude behind the counter is terrible...what a shame...plus they aren't open late anymore or abolle to sit inside.... I used to go weekly multiple times a day pre covid...now I've been 3 times since covid hit and the disappointment is just too great. Now I have to hunt for a new pastry and tea late night hide out spot.
If the French had anything to do with this je ne sais quoi, is simple divine! Oh la la decor e french macarons mercy! Now they also speak Italian, they had amazing Cappuccinos bene!

My friend and I had been anticipating coming to Villani's for our love of cannolis, and it was everything we expected and more. The cannolis had a light cinnamon flavor and an excellent creaminess. Along with our cannolis, we got four macaroons- mint chocolate, pistachio, birthday cake, and mocha. They are definitely some of the better macaroons I have had in Charlotte. They were a great size, where you can really try many of their creative flavors. I can't wait to go back to try more.
always delicious. One of the best chocolate croissants outside of Paris (nothing really compares to fresh chocolate croissants in Paris).

Love the tastes and texture of this ice cream. Graham Central Station is a perfect example of this. Love trying new flavors and I haven't been disappointed with any of them! 2 buck Tuesday is awesome!

The many, many different homemade flavors is what got my attention. The way the flavors are created makes me curious. Love the way they serve it too. The old school walk up window makes it different. Creates a different appeal and expectation for their patrons. Tries the strawberry cheesecake and blueberry cobbler. Served on a waffle cone, it was a real treat! They also serve hurricanes, sherbert, sundaes and pops! The line is usually pretty long, we got lucky but be prepared to wait, especially during the summer.

Found this gem on a whim during a vacation. Staff were super friendly, helpful, and patient. They genuinely seemed happy to be serving you and worked together well which made the whole experience better. Ice cream was not your typical ice cream flavors which can sometimes be scary, but these were great! This will definitely be our go-to whenever we're in Phoenix!
I'm a vanilla aficionado, and theirs was deliciously creamy and not too sweet. Leaving 4 stars for now until I try some other flavors and combinations!

Yum, yum, yum!!! I haven't had a bakery item that I haven't enjoyed here. My absolute favorite has to be the lemon biscotti. I ordered 10 yesterday, and they are gone today...oops! The cannoli also makes me feel like I'm back in Italy. Make sure you take a number when you walk in the door. Trust me, there will be plenty of people in front of you which will give you time to make your decision!

Ninety's is always good and delicious and they are constants switching out flavors and providing new flavors to try ... This trip I got the birthday cake, cookies and cream, and Graham cracker crust which are all delicious. & they really pile on the ice cream. 3 scoops for $5 is an Excellent deal compared to some of the other ice cream places ... Customer service is always on point ... It's in a nice area and an easy date spot to get ice cream and then walk around the boardwalk to just chat. There are also other restaurants in that area as well if you wanted Ninety's as an after dinner option.

I see you Bouchon Bakery with your massive macaron. This place popped up when searching for places with good pastries. Its located on the street in front of the Venetian. It took quite the effort to find but it was well worth it. Bouchon is two stories and has a nice outside patio seating area on the first floor.The only downfall to this place is there is no inside seating. There were many pastry and drink options available on their menu including a TKO(Thomas Keller Oreo) and TLC(Oatmeal Pecan Cookie) that are unique to Bouchon. I didn't read about these gems until after we ordered but they seem to be a crowd favorite. I ordered a Almond Croissant, pistachio macaron, and Iced Chai. If you are a Chai lover, this is one is a must! The almond croissant was a little dry and flaky on the corners but was delicious. The pistachio macaron was massive and tasted great. They had a handful of other flavors including pumpkin in November, so I imagine there are other seasonal flavors offered at different times of the year.

Honey hut has good ice cream, but don't expect to get any other option besides ice cream. They don't serve yogurt, low sugar, sugar free, or vegan options. I emailed the company a couple of times to ask whether or not their ice cream was gluten free and what their kitchen/serving practices are and never heard back. I do know that you can ask the server for a clean scoop but as all of their ice cream is hard packed, everyone else's scoop has already been in the container. Unfortunately this is one of those places that has great ice cream, but limited/no options for those who need something a little different. That being said, if you don't have any food allergies and want some good old fashioned hard scoop ice cream, give Honey Hut a try. Their honey pecan and chocolate peanut butter are excellent options.

I have found my go-to place for sweets, specifically halo halo. My goodness, the presentation and substance in my drink has done justice to my palate. It had so much of the flavorful ingredients that you have in a halo halo drink and more. The ube, buko panda, and flan what makes it so delicious. It was around $6 and well worth it. It's located in a strip mall and by the rails so it would be hard to miss. It's a great place to meet up with people for a variety of drinks and sweets. Will definitely will be back!

I am a huge ice cream snob, I've had ice cream all over North America & Europe and this is the best ice cream I've ever had. On my first visit I tried the S'Mores Sundae and it was epic! Homemade marshmallow on top that they hit with a blowtorch and it's served with what is quite possibly the worlds greatest chocolate ice cream. The service was quick and very friendly, I definitely recommend this place and I'm worried I'll be putting on some extra pounds now that I've found it.
My husband loves milkshakes !!!! and since we were in Vegas visiting, I decided to surprise him with a cerealmilk milkshake and he loves it!!! We will be coming back soon!!!

Hands down the best ice cream in Arizona. The flavors are exactly as described and always flavorful and delicious! If you want ice cream that is hand made and worth the price come here. They have seasonal and holiday special flavors as well. My favorite is a honey lavender flavor I think should be added to the permanent menu it's that amazing. A little pricey but worth it! I think they deserve to be at a better location and in a prettier shop! Because this is top notch ice cream. The shop is in a very unassuming low key shopping area and is a little out dated in decour, in fact you might miss it if you drive by. But if you stop In, it will be worth the effort. I would call this place a hidden gem! They even put chocolate in the bottom of their cones so the cones don't drip, and they will give you ice if your traveling with your sweets!

Decided to give this place a try after eating at Momofuku. The soft serve literally tasted like the leftover milk after you finished your bowl of cereal. I ordered the cereal soft serve with cornflakes. The cornflakes is very crunchy and a bit saltier. Very addicting combination.
You can't go wrong with Amelie's. Always a great place to grab coffee, a nice lunch or late night dessert.

First, Upward Projects never fails to deliver the cutest, so tastefully executed concepts. I'm obsessed. Churn continues to impress. Peach & Honey ice cream in a waffle cone. First, whoever was the mastermind behind peach & honey ice cream, are you single, and do you want to marry me? Second, That waffle cone... no words. I love the old school vibes this place oozes. Also, that wall art in the hallway? SWOON. Such a fun little evening date spot. If you haven't been, I recommend. Be sure to stop for dinner at one of the Upward Project joints before you mosey on over to cure your sweet tooth!

What's not to love? It's a little taste of Paris, right in NoDa. The coffee, pastries, sandwiches, atmosphere and staff are all superlative. If you haven't been yet, get in your car NOW. You can thank me later. With a cream puff.

This was our 1st experience at Donut Bar and it will definitely not be our last! We got the creme brulee donut, blueberry cheesecake donut, big poppa tart, a cream donut, Nutella donut and a Halloween themed donut. They were all fantastic! My favorite was the blueberry cheesecake donut. The staff was wonderful, they were friendly and helpful. Highly recommend!

I turned 50 this weekend, for a milestone birthday I asked my husband for a birthday cake from Milk Bar. It's a tiny cake and cost around $60. The cake is very cute. The frosting is good, not typical sickeningly sweet frosting. The cake itself, was the driest most crumbly cake I've ever had. Such a let down. It was impossible to cut an actual slice, we served a plate of crumbs held together with frosting. My one friend said he was so glad we wasted the money on this pretty cake, we just saved him 60 bucks. I just can't express how disappointed I was with this cake.

Was visiting Cleveland with my daughter. We had walked into the neighborhood and decided to stop for lunch. The cuban panini was good, but when we were getting ready to leave we picked up a few bakery items to take for the ride home. What a wonderful surprise! The pastries were excellent. These may be some of the best we've had. Only wish we had gotten a couple of lbs of cookies instead of just the one & that we had grabbed a few cannoli's. It was a great ride home with some wonderful pastries and cookies. A definite stop if we are ever in the area again.

I really liked the bakery decor and reminded me very much of NYC. Unfortunately we got there when there was only one vegan dessert option (would've liked to have been able to try a couple more). However, this blueberry cobbler was to die for so I'm not mad . Do stop in for a tasty treat!
The food here is insanely good! The tai tea macaron ice cream sandwich is delicious, and the service is nice as well

I used to love Amelie's, but I feel that the pastries have gotten worse and more expensive. They are so pretty to look at and look delicious, but they virtually have no flavor. I ordered this strawberry cake, which is a perfect individual size. I was super excited to try it. The cream frosting had no flavor. It tasted like whipped, non-flavored air. The sponge cake tasted like spongy, non-flavored air. The strawberry juice soaked into the sponge cake tasted like cold water. The strawberry on top tasted like a strawberry. So I ate a whole cake to taste a strawberry on top. Super disappointed. I will stick to sunflour baking company

My boyfriend and I wanted to check this place out for awhile now, but the location is so far from where we live. The inside of this place is so cute and clean, definitely insta worthy. What I ordered was a cone mixed in with cinnamon toast crunch, topped with cheesecake bites. Costed roughly around $6. I've read yelp reviews about ice cream being costly, but lemme tell ya, it was so much ice cream, I couldn't even reach the cone!! It was so good and my tummy was so happy, but full at the same time. This ice cream cone could definitely be shared with others. My boyfriend got a milk shake with apple jacks mixed in. They also topped the milkshake with the cereal as well. My boyfriend enjoyed it a lot, he finished the whole thing. We will definitely be back soon and can't wait to try their teas.

Lavender ice cream really? It's amazingly refreshing one of my favorites. Horchata, Huckleberry or Madagascar Vanilla if you will. This place only uses the freshest ingredients many purchased from the Farmers Market right here in Scottsdale. Great ingredients produce great ice cream and this place has the best I've tasted. They where recognized by USA Today as one of the top 50 Ice Cream Parlors in the nation for good reason. They always have a new amazing flavor or two in the rotation in case you've already tried the others. Highly Recommended. Try the turtle sunday - extra nuts and whipped cream. Awesome.

The lobster tail is a basically a crispier cream puff. It's flaky, crispy, and has delicious cream (again, it's cream, not custard) inside, but it didn't blow my mind and I don't think I'd wait in line just to get it again. The line is ridiculous and not even their most famous canoli convinced me to come back.

Everything sunshine and sparkles over here until I didn't get what I ordered despite pointing out the item and no one picks up their phone. I recommend Whole Foods for fresh fruit tart. Service in daytime at AmÃ©lie's is significantly better than evening.

We went and ordered strawberry cream donut and maple bar. My daughters were in absolute delight. They loved the strawberry and cream. My husband loved the maple bar. The owners are extremely nice and pleasant. The place is clean and inviting. Long line but they move very quickly. This vegan will definitely be back!!!
An amazing assortment of locally made flavors. Each one is better than the next. There is usually a line, but it moves fast.
Best bakery in town. Great soup and homemade cheeses too. Love the atmosphere too.

Uhh . . . Portland (voodoo donuts) , we have a problem. These are amazing donuts. Strawberry stack, chocolate old fashioned, and creek brÃ»lÃ©e with a hard shell! The strawberries are delicious and the whipped creams is light and fluffy! The old fashioned do it itself is not sweet at all and has a crunchy outside and the chocolate is dark and slightly sweet. The creme brÃ»lÃ©e is amazing! The filling is a rich not-too-sweet custard. Wow! I don't even like donuts, they tend to be too sweet. Huge fan!

Banana Cream Pie on two buck Tuesdays. You're welcome. I really should end it there. Blueberry cobbler was too sweet. Mint chip was alright. Graham Central Station was amazing. Good thing I don't live here anymore. I'd stop by way too often!

Ohhhemmmmgeeeee! I'm seriously so in love with this place. The cake was so freakin good. Somehow she managed to serve it where the bread was slightly warm but the icing was still cold. Chefs kiss man. You can tell it was made with quality ingredients & a lot of thought was put into the flavors. The ambiance of this place is amazing. HIGHLY recommend. We visited Pittsburg for the first time this weekend & this was on my list of places to go- it surpassed all expectations.

This place is fantastic! Not your ordinary donut store by any means. They make gourmet donuts that will satisfy your taste buds and wow your belly. I absolutely loved their cake donuts as the freshness was apparent and not to mention the flavor of the peanut butter cup one was outstanding. Definitely a must visit when I'm back in downtown Vegas. Very friendly staff to top it all off! Nice job Donut Bar!
A trip to the Westside market and Ohio City is not complete without a stop at Mitchell's ice cream probably the best ice cream I've ever had I wish they had locations in other cities

Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this place. Granted, we stopped by at 9pm on a Saturday but they are open till 10 so figured we give them a try. My first observation is that in a fridge full of great looking cakes, none of them were covered. What I mean is when you start cutting slices from a refrigerated cake, you MUST cover the exposed inside of the cake with some type of food grade paper or cover to keep it from drying. Out of about 6-7 cakes *none* of them were covered. I thought "these could not possibly be fresh and likely dry and tasting like a fridge". So, decided to skip those. My wife opted for some sort of pastry that had a light cream filling in another cooler cabinet. Wow, I wish we would have taken a bite while at the place because when we did later in the car, we almost lost a couple of teeth. I mean, this thing was hard like a brick, tasted like freezer burn and was insipid. Horrible. Look, I get it that on a Saturday at 9pm I don't expect necessarily for things to have been made the hour before but I have eaten at late night bakeries such as Amelie's and I have never had to throw away something because it was not fresh. At VIllani's they clearly do not care what they are serving late at night. I get that maybe a few pastries would sneak in between the fresh batches but the fact that the cut cakes were completely exposed to the fridge air was proof enough that they simply are not trained in food freshness efforts. Tip to them: Cover your cakes, toss old pastries, and offer better. If the goal is to serve the drunk crowd from plaza midwood, then that may be good enough but not for anyone else.

Our waitress at a the vig tipped us off on this place when we needed a late night dessert downtown. Omg, first it's in the cutest historical courtyard. Ask the staff about the history of the buildings. Secondly, ice cream stuffed donuts? Yes please. Worth the 5 minute drive to the arts district if you are downtown for a show or game.

They have a great cappuccino! I think I will get another tomorrow. They have very little food items. The pics on Yelp show omelettes and stuff, but those are not available. They did have some delicious looking pastries.
Best ice cream in Vegas! A variety of flavors and different presentations. The kids that work there are great!

I was beyond excited to finally try the pastries from here but I gotta say i was pretty disappointed... I got different flavored cheesecakes, canolis, red velvet cupcakes, crumb cake and these other pastries I don't remember the names of. The cheesecakes had no crust which is like the best part and they were overall tasteless. The red velvet cupcakes tasted like regular vanilla and the cream cheese icing was overwhelming. Canolis were VERY soggy! I couldn't even finish one because it felt like mush in my mouth. I dont even remember the other pastries. The only reason I'm giving this place 3 stars is because the crumb cake is beyond amazing and the guy who attended us was very friendly. Oh and another thing was that it was very difficult to get to the register to pay after we had chosen our things because there are sooo many people in the way and once we got there we had to reach over some guy to pay because he refused to move and the cash register lady didn't do anything about it. Overall disappointed and not worth it.

Sprinkes - my favorite place for cupcakes! This location now has ice cream and cookies (but no Cupcake ATM) Yes they are expensive - but you are paying for a brand and top notch cupcakes. This trip I had the Smores and of course, the black and white. The smores was good, but I still saw Black and white is the best!

BAZILLION FLAVORS O_O I could decide where to start... literally there are so many things to choose from... they serve everything out of a window which reminds me of the snack shops along the beaches back home. There were 2 workers working there when we came... they seemed young.. the guy that took care of us could not remember our scoops so he had to keep coming back to the window... we ordered the 4 scoop sampler which is just scooped into one clear Togo container. Definitely thought that there would be some dividers or something. PINK CHAMPAGNE SHERBERT - light & also had a pretty color aahahaha ORANGE SHERBERT - not my choice... but it was still OK SPOUSE LIKE A HOUSE - thanks to Jin N. Review we got this for the big brother & he liked it w/ the chocolate COFFEE CHOCO CHIP - My choice & it was good definitely had a whole bunch of chocolate chips in them which gave the coffee a more espresso flavor STRAWBERRY CHEESECAKE - Could use more if the cheesecake flavor STRAWBERRY x2 - Cant go wrong w/ strawberry CHOCOLATE - Chocolate is chocolate Will definitely have to come back to try some other stuff... but two of the 4 sampler scoops came out to be about close to $10

I was very excited to go to Carlos Bakery on my trip to Vegas. I love going to pastry shops when I travel and bring home some goodies as souvenirs. Pastries: Generally, the pastries are pretty good and they have a lot of filling!!! *Cannoli - Pretty dam good *Eclair - So much filling. Yum! *Lobster tails - There were four flavors and I got the hazelnut and one other. *Cheesecake - I didn't try this but my friend said it was average. Cons: - There are no price tags. Don't over order! I ordered six items for a little over $40... - Out of the six items, I was missing one cannoli!! When I opened the box after I got back to my hotel room, there was one missing! - The service wasn't that great. Basically someone on an iPad will follow you around and you tell them what you want and they put it in their iPad. I asked what a couple of items were and the girl seemed so annoyed. Honestly, she was helping me for less than one minute and she seemed like she hated her job. I want to give them more stars because the pastries were pretty good but the service was not great and they forgot an item! If I'm being charged over $5 a pastry and is missing one, I don't know if I want to come back. Vegas has many other bakeries you can go to...

I had a craving late at night like most of us do, I thought I'd look around for ice cream other than your basic ice cream stores like Baskin robins or Yogurtland. Found this place and give it a try, I ordered 4 different flavors ( Oreo, Coffee Chip, Black Cherry, and Vanilla) just to see what they were about. My absolute favorite was Black cherry followed by coffee chip, it reminded me of the Thrifty ice cream I used to get, but with so much more natural flavors. If your on the west side of Las Vegas, this place is a MUST!

Wonderful experience... we stop by based on yelp reviews to find a lovely small little ice cream boutique shop with homemade specialty ice cream. It was just spectacular. We had bourbon caramel something or another, I fell in love. You can order with a donut or a waffle. Owners are great too. We will be bsck

If you're expecting something amazing please don't go prices are steep and the quality just isn't there. My wife wanted to try it since she's a fan of cake boss and we where both extremely disappointed

STOP!!! This is what I observed during my visit tonight Saturday March 20, 2021 at 9:15 PM. The same staff member that takes your order and money goes to the dipping case to scoop your ice cream without washing his hands or wearing a pair of gloves. At best, this is not sanitary and worst they could be spreading COVID-19. We all know that money is filthy and we should wash our hands after handling it. The unsafe practices at the establishment should be criminal. God know just how many unsuspecting customers caught the COVID-19 virus from this place.

I was very excited to try these donuts. I finally made time to go to this donut shop on my day off. I purchased 4 donuts & was given an additional 4 donuts for free. The customer service was good, but the donuts were not. I was sadly disappointed in these donuts. I will most likely choose another place to buy donuts whenever I get a craving.

Simply very good ice cream. A wide variety of flavors, excellent size options and very good prices. The servers were welcoming, offered advise and quickly transacted our purchase. Just a very nice experience following our trip to Red Rock Canyon..

Awwww yeeeeeeah. Just went to this place for the first time and it was awesome. I had driven past it many times and my curiosity was piqued by the many signs all over the building with delicious-looking ice cream on them. So naturally I was super pumped to go to celebrate a friend's birthday. We pulled up and found parking right by the building, and then only had to wait in line a few minutes before placing our order. They have about 15 different flavors of soft serve, a whole bunch of different dips, different cones to choose from (pretzel, waffle, cake). They also have a whole bunch of delicious looking sundaes and Arctic blasts, and tons of other options. I went with a cone of the birthday cake soft serve dipped in chocolate. It was fantastic - the soft serve has a great smooth texture and the dip was on point. They also put a plastic sleeve on the cone to catch drips, which totally saved my clothes. My husband got the Yinzer Sundae, which had a blondie, vanilla ice cream, milk chocolate, white chocolate, caramel sauce and whipped cream. YUM. The employees were polite and very efficient keeping the line moving. The place has a fun laid back, retro atmosphere. Can't wait to come back!

I really wanted to come here after I heard that there was an option to get your ice cream served on top of egg waffles! They did not disappoint. Since my family and I came here right after dinner and birthday cake, we were already pretty stuffed, so we all shared. We got marzipan (almond) and black sesame ice cream. The black sesame was really good, but wow, the marzipan blew me away. It had a rich almond flavor and wasn't too sweet. It went perfectly with the hot, fresh, egg waffles. I also loved the whipped cream on top. This is a small local business that makes its own ice cream in small batches. I hear that the flavors rotate every day, so there is a lot of variety. It is quality stuff and I will definitely be back here as much as possible!

I've been to thirdspace many times recently, however none had been within Novel's hours. So last night, I was happy to see the door open with its smiling ice cream painted walls inviting me from within. I walked up with the intent of checking out the flavors (WITH MY EYEBALLS) and walking back out to my people. I even announced as such to the couple behind the counter (spoiler alert: they're the owners). They smiled and kindly insisted I try one. Nah, I'm good. But then I saw the honey lavender, which is often too strong of a flavor by most ice cream shops. So they offered again that I taste. Well, maybe just this one.... And then they offered another. And then another. And I found myself falling into a black hole of needing ice cream that I was doing PERFECTLY FINE WITHOUT mere moments prior. But here's the thing, this isn't just ice cream that you can get at any old place. These are fresh, delicious, creamy, and perfectly balanced flavors. If I'm going to be eating ice cream, please know that it will be this ice cream and only this ice cream. Anyway, I ended up walking out with a scoop of the honey lavender. My boyfriend was intent on getting the sweet tiki and his friend couldn't leave without the Leslie Knope (waffle sammy) with sweet tiki ice cream. This is, of course, after they realized I'd been gone for so long that they had to investigate, then also found themselves coerced into tasting all the flavors upon the bidding of the ever-pleasant and obviously business-savvy owners. Ice cream is the perfect way to round out a good evening.

Why do we have to give a star? As a longtime fan of the show my expectations were pretty high, but sadly completely let down. I had called earlier that day to see if they had the coffee crumb cake and if they could set it aside for me. The girl said yes and when I arrived I was told they didn't have it and there was non in the shop. I told them the situation and they said oh well. So I called my family to see what else they'd want me to grab since they didn't save the coffee Cake. The girl who was helping me had a lot of attitude with me after that and they began snickering with other workers whenever I would ask for something else and then they would say it was out. My experience here was horrible mainly due to customer service and made me not want to even purchase the items... then to top it off I got into the car and tried one of the cannolis. I've had better cannolis at lascaris. So disappointed in the service and pastries...
Good ice cream with interesting flavors to choose from that rotate pretty frequently. Nice that it is right off the bike path as well.

What a disaster. This place does not live up to the hype. The pastries were dry, coffee just so-so and the service was clueless. The Uptown location tries to be 'lively and hip' but it comes off as plastic and busy. Better places to spend my time and $'s

Listen if you see a huge line don't wait, if the line is ok wait and try the pastries. I just promise one thing you won't be impressed, at least I wasn't These are the prices for what I ordered : Large Cannoli $3.95 , French NapoleÃ³n $7.50 , and the total was $12.39 & btw they only accepted cash ! So disappointing because my expectations were a bit too high I guess.

Great place to get that creamy, rich yummy homemade ice cream! There's no store front persay, it's more like a window walk up. You walk up, order than wait for your treat. Outdoor seating only. They offer an abundance of ice cream plus sherbet options. We've tried the pecan praline, salted caramel, banana foster, blue monster, chocolate and oree. All were delicious. We got a small and medium (2 flavors) in a waffle cone. And one banana split. Service is ridiculously sloooooooooooow. So if you see it's a line, that's why. Average to high price. However you get great quality creamy ice cream. Overall positive experience.

Minus 2 stars for the absolutely horrible in store service. We were the only ones in the store and there were at least 4 employees, including the manager Priscilla, who was the absolute worst of the bunch. Right when we began to order, some employee (named Kat?) seemed utterly confused and annoyed that we wanted two separate orders. Is that such a difficult request? After she takes both our orders to the register, she gets confused and asks us if we want to pay together. I said no, and once again, I'm met with a confused look. After a bit of commotion, another employee asks ME what is in the box, and after I tell her I'm not sure, she throws the box back down and proceeds to leave. I'm not asking to be treated like a princess, but if you don't know what's in the box, can't you just open it and check if it's my order or not?! Now I was actually getting annoyed at this point so I asked for the manager. Turns out the woman who was too lazy to check what was in my box WAS the manager. Not sure if I caught them on a bad day or if they were too lazy to work, but thankfully there was one competent employee (blonde haired, tall male named Aaron?) who took the time to apologize for something he didn't even do. I would've just left without any macarons after all that attitude and sass, but since they are soo good, I had to suck it up and stay. Delicious treats, but horrible employees (minus Aaron).

I ordered a delivery for Mother's Day that was never delivered. I've been trying to get my money back ever since. No one can help when I call and I never receive a call back by someone who can. During one call, I was told, "So many people complain and I don't know why. [The owner] never makes his deliveries for some reason." No idea how the treats actually taste, but the customer service is absolute crap.

Had a craving for ice cream and knew this place was the go. It was the weekend so they were slightly busy with limited capacity indoors, no tasting the ice cream flavors and no diving indoors. I was got the wild berry crumble with hot fudge, strawberries and m&ms and definitely hit the spot. They allow for you to order online and pick up curbside but that way you don't have the choice of sundaes, etc. Service was quick and efficient. Will definitely be returning.

Craving some ice cream on a Sunday evening, I decided to check out Handel's Homemade Ice Cream. Located in a busy shopping center anchored by a Smith's , I noticed the line building in front of Handel's as I pulled into the parking lot. At first glance there is a long list of flavors to choose from and a few stood out for my first time. There were 3 open windows to order from so the line went pretty quickly as customers seemed to know what they wanted. My turn to order I decided to try a scoop of chocolate chip cookie dough on a cake cone. The chocolate chip cookie dough was amazing and just the right amount of sweetness and texture. I wanted to try other flavors so I ordered a 4 flavor sampler pack which is a great value for first time at Handel's. The four flavors in the sampler pack were Coconut Milk Ice Cream, Graham Central Station, Vanilla Oreo and Oree Dough. All of the flavors were amazing but my favorite was the Coconut Milk Ice Cream which has no dairy but a great flavor and texture plus coconut chunks inside for a nice touch. Definitely going back to Handel's ASAP!

This place is a little gem! Hidden just down E Carson, past all the shops and busy streets there is a tiny little unassuming building on a large corner lot. I've never been a fan of soft serve or gone out of my way for it, but this place will make you do just that. Not to mention the fresh squeezed lemonade made to order (yes, they squeeze the lemons right into your cup.) Burgers and fries are also made to order, so be prepared for a short wait while you prepare mentally for the heaven you're about to consume. I'm not a fan of their fries (they tasted like they were made in old grease) but wow that cheeseburger. I have a small appetite and can't usually finish most things - so when I ordered my burger and fries I let the bf know he was expected to finish it for me. Little did we know he wouldn't get any of that delicious burger, because the second I took the first bite the rest magically disappeared. Oh! They also have old fashioned dip cones which are one of my favs. Definitely recommended.

I had the pleasure of visiting the LV Sprinkles Cupcakes & Ice Cream in April 2014, soon after they opened. It's always neat to see how each Sprinkles location differs, and this particular store just screamed "VEGAS," from its light-up signage to the attention-grabbing cupcake ATM. This was the first Sprinkles store that I had seen actually joined--cupcakes and ice cream were not separated--which was neat but also confusing. I think that, because the store had only recently opened, they were still trying to figure things out. I entered from the ice cream side, but I was directed to stand in the line for cupcakes (when I wanted ice cream, not cupcakes). Hopefully by now, the Vegas store has everything a little more under control, because with two entrances, it can be easy for customers to get confused/not know where to go when it comes time to order. I was surprised to see that I didn't have to wait in an enormously long line to order my ice cream (there was a line, but it moved along). I appreciated the fact that there was a good seating area outside the store for customers to enjoy their cupcakes and ice cream -- more seats and tables than I have ever seen at a Sprinkles store. I ordered the seasonal "Cookie Dough" ice cream flavor--one of my favorites; I wish it were a regular menu item--in the "Sprinkles Sundae," complete with my all-time favorite "Peanut Butter Chip" cupcake. I think because the workers were still getting into the groove of things at Sprinkles, the ice cream scoops were a bit larger than what I usually receive ... and hey, no complaints about that! The ice cream and cupcake quality were the same as I had experienced at other Sprinkles stores, which was great. However, I was a bit disappointed with the "Salted Oatmeal Cornflake" and "Peanut Butter Pretzel Chip" cookies that I ordered. Instead of the normal slightly crispy exterior and moist, soft interior, these cookies were on the harder, crunchier side, and the "Salted Oatmeal Cornflake" was definitely saltier than I would have liked. But, then again, gotta have some grace and patience because the store had just opened -- hopefully the cookies are a bit more consistent with the usual Sprinkles taste by now. The BF ordered the "Sprinkles Shake" with his usual combo of "Captain Crunch" ice cream and "Peanut Butter Chip" cupcake. The shake was as sweet as usual--I got a few sips in there--but we both noticed that the texture was also chunkier than usual. At one point, he had to use a spoon to get some of the larger cupcake chunks (definitely different from being able to inhale everything quickly with a straw). But he had no complaints--he said it was actually nice to munch on those cupcake bits every now and then. The friends we were with decided to share a "Sprinkles Shake" with "Red Velvet" ice cream and cupcakes (she really likes the "Red Velvet"). They were extremely pleased with their foray into Sprinkles and said they would definitely get the "Red Velvet"-heavy shake again (though, they were happy that they shared it, saying that it would have been too much red velvet for one person to handle). Overall, I had a positive experience at this LV Sprinkles. I really, really liked its dÃ©cor--the dazzling lights and huge marquee made it stand out from any other store I've been to so far--and the dÃ©cor really made the store easily spottable. I have no doubts that this location stays busy far into the night and keeps up with the Vegas nightlife. I do hope, though, for customers' sakes, that the ordering system is a bit more streamlined and organized to avoid confusion when entering/exiting the store.

The chocolate custard is pretty good. I didn't care much for the snowstorms, cause the few times I've gotten them, they've been pretty melty, and they're comparable to Blizzards, depending on what you're looking for. Student staff is friendly, but the others have are slightly standoffish. My biggest complaint is that they didn't accept cards, but I didn't dock stars for that.
Awesome place we loved it!! The pastry was excellent the first day but did not travel well. When we got back home it was not worth eating unfortunately!

Wish this place weren't so close to my house. Pastries are to die for, sandwiches, salads and soups are fresh and good. Servers are very helpful as to what to order and why. Cute atmosphere for a fun lunch or after dinner dessert. Great for take out dessert as well!

EDIT- I came back to try something new at Milk Bar the other day because maybe I'm limiting my review on just Klossies (see review below). Caroline reached out and offered me to come back to try some other treats, and I honestly couldn't resist. I tried the fruit loop soft serve w/ cornflakes and the birthday truffles. The soft serve was pretty generous, and it tasted just like the cereal milk from a bowl fruity loops. The cornflakes were a little salty and crunchy which was great with the sweet soft serve. The birthday cake truffles come refrigerated but they aren't super cold. Maybe it's because I waited a bit to try them. They're the bees knees, so if you stop by, I'd definitely try the truffles! The customer service for me was great both times I stopped by, so no complaints here. Both times, the staff were very inviting and professional, so it makes me want to come back again for them. The drive still sucks if you're going to the strip during peak hours. Don't try to navigate the strip on friday and Saturday nights or during rush hour. It'll be a bit of a while to get through the traffic. Tldr- great service, try the truffles and maybe the fruit loop soft serve if you want to treat yo self. Driving here and parking still sucks, but I guess it's just something I'll have to accept about the strip. OG REVIEW- I've always wanted to try Momofuku's Milk Bar ever since I was in New York and saw that the line was way too long to stick around. Must be something that's good there right?! Ehhh, i'm low-key disappointed... and by low-key, i'm not just low-key disappointed.. I'm straight up disappointed. I got the perfect 10 and the coco klossies. For those of you who aren't familiar with what these are, they're the vegan cookies made/endorsed by Karlie Kloss, the model. The cookies were about $3-4 a cookie, and they aren't bad but they aren't definitely worth it for the price. They cost too much for just 1 cookie. If they were maybe $2 a cookie, I'd be more inclined to make the trek to the strip, sit in traffic, navigate the Cosmo's awful parking, and buy these cookies. The cookies themselves are slightly dense and very flavorful which saves these cookies. So all in all, the klossies are great cookies but definitely not worth it for the price and the annoyance of getting my butt through the traffic/headache that is the strip. If i'm already in Cosmo, then yeah, I'll probably go back but I wouldn't go to Cosmo solely to try their treats.

Vegan heaven!!!! Happy to see these lovely ladies have there own shop up and running now!!! They have so many options we got the Boston cream, cookie dough and the glaze twist. Our favorite was the classic glazed twist. It was amazing!!! The other 2 were really good but something about a glazed donut makes me happy. Love love love!!!

The ice cream here was not the best per say. It was good though. The part that I actually loved is that they put that cold ice cream right in the middle of a warm donut. It's a small cute little ice cream shop and I like the area it's in. I will however be trying it again

Yuuuum!! This place is incredible. I went with the chocolate cake w/raspberry buttercream icing (it was vegan). Probably one of the best vegan desserts I've ever had. It was so tasty and rich w flavor, which is not the case in most vegan desserts. The service was great, and our waitress was very helpful. I heard about this place from social media so I decided to try it after dinner. It was the perfect end to the night! It also doesn't hurt that it's so freaking cute inside! Love it. I will be back.

When I bit into my first Jack Frost donut my mouth was like, "SHAZAM" and then I was sugar drunk and probably should have taken a nap. It was the real deal. These donuts were friggin' delicious and the spot is newly renovated and modern/hip. They are so creative with their donuts - there is no shortage of options here. We got a dozen and chose from a plethora of cake and fluffy raised donuts. Personally, cake donuts are where it's at for me - and Jack Frost makes a mean cake donut. I did find some of them to be a little bit over the top sweet, but.... it's a donut... that's basically why it exists. To put you in a sugar coma. I love this place and their donuts and the patient people that let me choose all of my donuts. The end.

I can't even begin to describe how AMAZING this place is!!!!! As soon as you walk in the Decor Smacks you in the face and you IMMEDIATELY LOVE everything and want to live in this bakery somehow somewhere!!!! The Sampling of tarts muffins and brownies I bought have each been MIND BLOWING delicious!!!!!!

Sprinkles Cupcakes is literally the one thing I can honestly say that I wouldn't get tired of. My friends and I love it and we have turned it into a group tradition to eat it together always! The frosting is crazy delicious and I don't understand how a tiny cake could be so flavorful! The staff is also so friendly and helpful. Bridget is the definition of a sprinkles cupcake, sweet and makes my day! Best cupcake shop I've been to:)
Their blondies are outrageously good. Love their cakes, they have unique flavors and they're open much, much later than most bakeries so it's better for the night owls.

Viens ici pour un rÃ©gal franÃ§ais...full disclosure that's Google translate for "come here for a French treat". There are many things that I "amour" and the top three, in no order. 1. GREAT FOOD AND DRINK whether you are getting just a sweet treat (which there are dozens of options), or feeling something a bit more "remplissage" they have a full breakfast and extensive sandwich menu. 2. The atmosphere here is perfect, it's trendy, French inspired, and often times makes me smile or chuckle with how they pull it all together. 3. They are open 24 hours. Need some good coffee and breakfast at 4 am before a flight but don't want fast food? They got you. Been out in NODA drinking craft beer and want a tasty nightcap? Come get a salted caramel brownie. This might be my top place to recommend here in Charlotte. Shoutout to Summer for being a great brand ambassador and Tony for being genuine and putting a smile to my face.

I was very disappointed with my last visit. The sample I got of taste the rainbow seemed pretty good but as I ate my cookie bowl I got an overwhelming flavor of key lime flavoring to the point where my friend and I had to throw it away and he never wants to come back.

I have been to the original location in San Francisco and while this one may be smaller it is just as tasty. My sister bought a chocalate chip cookie that was 5 dollars which seems expensive but it was the best one she has ever had and went back to get another. Definitely try the ice cream with the fresh whipped cream

I loved this place! New ice cream shop in the cutest area and an easy walk if you live downtown. Made from local ingredients and you can absolutely taste it. I had peanut butter and cinnamon, but next time I'm going for carrot cake or cucumber. Very friendly owner who was more than happy to let us taste all of the delicious flavors. I will definitely be a regular here!
Awesome customer service, good variety of ice cream to choose from, amazing flavors and very cool vibe. Would HIGHLY recommend this place to anyone!

Giant. Giant donuts. Delicious giant donuts. Amazingly puffy delicious giant donuts. Fresh and amazingly puffy delicious giant donuts. Great variety of puffy delicious giant donuts. I failed to eat just one giant donut. It was a delicious giant donut. Giant donut! Giant! Be sure to get there early because they are open until they sell out.

How have I not already reviewed this place considering how often I try to drop by when I'm in the matthews/ballentyne area! This is a MUST TRY if you're in Charlotte. Okay so this place is amazing and you absolutely need to visit to get your matcha ice cream and other dessert options as well! It's a small cafe with much-limited capacity due to COVID but they're accomodating and doing their best which I appreciate! The ice cream is definitely the must get item for 1st timers since it's creamy and delicious as well as pretty accurate to the matcha flavors I've had in Japan. The vanilla with matcha is a good match if you're not used to the bitter taste of matcha that can be acquired, but that combination is great no matter what! I've also had hojicha (burnt matcha?), black sesame (seasonal), and ube (seasonal) and all those are great as well! Hojicha is still one of my favorites with match ice cream. The black sesame is good as well if it's an option. The ube is a lot lighter than I expected so if you're expecting that rich flavor you've had a Filipino places, you might have to curb your expectations a little bit. I've only had the other matcha ice cream with all the toppings that I forget the name of and I'd also recommend that if you're in a hungry mood or want to share! I've had that several times in Japan and this place is up to par for this dessert option! Parking is pretty easy and there's a lot of food options in the area. Or if you want boba, kung fu tea is also a short walk down because my mom wanted boba more than ice cream so there's room for everyone :D I'd say drop by if you're in the south charlotte/Matthews/Ballantyne area, but really if you're in Charlotte this is a MUST STOP AREA you have to try. It's unique and leaves a lasting great impression.

It was a cold summer day in Cleveland. (I love the fact that that occurs here...) Walking briskly around Little Italy, we happened into this little cafe, drawn in by the tempting word: Gelato. I have no idea how the canolis, bread, sandwiches, or stromboli taste... but I know the Gelato is pretty good. While service wasn't warm, it wasn't bad. The decor is light and cheerful, and despite numerous other empty restaurants nearby, this one was mostly full. So, despite mediocre service, we had good gelato, and colour us satiated. :)

$17.50 for a box of 6 macarons. Why can't they all make it this big? I tried every flavor except for pistachio and raspberry. The only thing that should taste like pistachio nuts is pistachio nuts. I gave my raspberry one away and the recipient of this macaron did not offer me a bite :( The coffee one was definitely my favorite. I thought the chocolate was too sweet but everything else was pleasant. They didn't taste good at all the next day, so stuff yourself before they get stale.

I went for a soft opening and omg their crepes were so good. I've had the mango-raspberry and mixed berry crepes as well as the avocado kani rice ball. The rice ball isn't worth the price ($2.50) but the crepes are amazing. They come out nice and crispy with a slight sweetness from the yogurt cream. There are also crunchy chocolate rice balls at the bottom of the crepe to make up for the lack of crispiness there which is so nice!! I definitely recommend this place for their crepes. I've yet to eat the other things like the lightbulb drinks and ice cream, so I'll update once I try those.

Brilliant! Definitely the best ice cream in phoenix! I always get the salted caramel freezie, and it's to die for! The staff is incredibly friendly, and the atmosphere is so creative and fun! I love sitting outside under the heaters with a delicious dessert. Nothing beats a night with Churn. The line can be a little long, but tends to go quick, and just shows how successful this place is!

This is one of my favorite bakery anywhere I go! When I found out they have one here in Las Vegas, I was excited to go! It didn't disappoint me! I had the brioche (this is the best) especially when it come right out from their kitchen, the matcha chocolate bun, choco bun and white macadamia cookies! They were all really good! If I had a bigger stomach, I would get more! You need to go early otherwise the bakery items are gone!

Guys behind counter was friendly. Menu reads "Super thick shake". Husband ordered a vanilla shake and it was running over the sides of cup like milk. Not thick at all. The flavor was lacking. He asked for a refund. The guy said he had to get a manager. After 3 min, he came back and said that the manager told him that all sales are final but he can remake the shake. There is no sign that reads this. If it were so, the guys up front would know.

I came in today with two other people. There were no other customers present waiting, so we didn't have to wait terribly long. We immediately appreciated the interior design. The two women in the back came out and greeted us and took our order. I ordered a brown sugar milk tea, one of the people with me ordered jasmine milk tea, and the other person with me ordered a chocolate chip cookie dough milk shake. The person with me did not like their jasmine milk tea, but the other person with me loved their chocolate chip cookie dough shake. I enjoyed the milk tea and felt it had the proper sweetness, nothing too overpowering. I ordered a pink rose milk tea.
