I loved the floral flavor, but felt the sweetness should have been toned down a little bit. The other person with me whom ordered a jasmine milk tea ordered a Thai iced tea. They said that it was better than a lot of the restaurants we previously ordered Thai tea from. The woman who took my second round of orders encouraged us to try the soft serve the next time we visited and recommended the strawberry shortcake. We will definitely be returning and I look forward to trying the strawberry shortcake.

I've written a review of Donut Bar in San Diego. Well, we were visiting Vegas and stumbled across the Donut Bar while driving around and exploring. I had my husband stop immediately and I got out of the car and checked the business hours. We were staying at the Aria and planned to wake up early to ensure I didn't miss out on the creme brÃ»lÃ©e donut that I missed out on while in San Diego. The next morning, we drove to Donut Bar and there was no line. Talk about excited!!! Again, the employees were warm, welcoming, and patient. The service was cheerful and the employees were all smiles. On to the donuts. Needless to say, these donuts are great. This time we bought the strawberry split (our fave), the apple crumb (hubby barely tasted it last time cuz I ate it), the salted caramel, and of course the creme brÃ»lÃ©e. The strawberry split is our absolute favorite!!! The donut is light and the filling is light and airy without being overly sweet and the fresh strawberries brings it all together. The apple crumb is more like a light cake that has a hint of apple. The salted caramel is like a glazed donut but the glaze it caramel. This donut was good but I think a little more restraint on the salt would balance it better. It wasn't my favorite but it was good. Now on to the donut that got me up early in the morning, the creme brÃ»lÃ©e! This donut was actually really good but I'm still partial to the strawberry split. At first glance, it looks like a typical filled donut with a hard glaze. I cracked the glaze and opened the donut to expose the creme filling. Creme brÃ»lÃ©e is my favorite dessert and I was pleasantly surprised to find that the custard was spot on. Without a doubt, I will be returning to the Donut Bar!
Very delicious. Menus and prices were clear & accurate. Good portion sizes. Big outdoor seating area
Absolutely the best ice cream in Cleveland. They have so many flavors to choose from. It's also really cool to see them make the ice cream at the west 25th location

I was visiting Charlotte for my best friend's birthday weekend. We stopped in twice this weekend and I really enjoyed this bakery. The staff was nice and very helpful and patient explaining what the items were. I ended up buying a raspberry fruit tart, pistachio macarons, and their seasonal passion fruit strawberry lemonade to drink. All were really good! The tart was sweet, but not too sugary. Just enough tartness to it! I just recently started enjoying macarons and this was so fresh. The passion fruit strawberry lemonade had stronger hints of passion fruit and sparkling fruit soda, the strawberry lemonade taste was not as strong on my order. It was really great!!! I hope I can come back before I leave tomorrow night. I hope to find something similar to this bakery back home in the Philadelphia area.

Honey Hut is the BEST! My favorite treat is a banana split made with Coconut ice cream and Pineapple topping - I get it with almonds instead of chopped nuts... So YuMmY!!! I call it my "Hawaiian Delite" LoL :) So happy they have a Solon store now... Honey Hut RoCkS!

Lovely little local place with locally-made fresh frozen desserts. I got blueberry sorbet and vegan banana (as I am lactose-intolerant. boo.) Sister got Lucky Charms (lucky!) and a butter finger sort of ice cream. She said they were very good. My blueberry sorbet was outstanding, but the banana tasted like something I could make at home with a yonana maker. Should have sampled it first. OH well. It was a lovely evening, so the outdoor seating was on point. Worth a drive or walk to try if you're in the area visiting or after a baseball game.

Looks pretty, but tastes pretty bad. We got the cereal milk ice cream with birthday cake and sprinkles. The first bite was extremely unsatisfying and honestly pretty disappointing considering we paid $19 for a pint of it. The birthday cake crumbles are super dry and have a distinct salty taste which is so off-putting in ice cream. The sprinkles are giving everything they've got to save the entire experience but unfortunately it's not enough. If I were you, I'd seriously consider going to one of the extremely overpriced convenience stores in the hotel and getting an overpriced ice cream as it'll be better than this and you'll still come away spending less money. You've been warned!!

Ersha was very nice when we checked out. She asked us how our day went and was very welcoming and even talked with us about the bakery while we were waiting for our transaction to go through. Anyways so it's 1am and I woke up for a midnight snack right (yes I am a piggy) and I went to take a bite of the milk tea bun I had gotten from earlier. I... There truly are no words... You know that question you'd get asked in like middle school "If you were stranded on and island and could only eat one thing" sorta thing yeah this. is. it. It's everything my inner child and I have ever wanted in a consumable item and more. This milk tea bun will make you rethink about your life and why you need to sit down and enjoy the moment. This milk. tea. bun. will tell you you don't look fat in those jeans. This milk tea bun will hold you, cradle you, and kiss you on the forehead while it reads you a bedtime story like the child you are. This milk tea bun has gone to college and recieved a PHD in healing your particular soul. This milk tea bun.... This. Milk. Tea. Bun.... Reminds you to slow down and enjoy the good things in life. Farewell and good. night.

Awesome place for Donut's.. Love there Strawberry n whipped cream sugar Donut. !!!!! Price some but awesome and get one every time when I'm in the area and some times just a drive there as well worth it n the coffee is awesome a long with the out door patio setting.. Love it Love it Love it.!!! Thumbs up to all n your awesome donuts.!!!!!

Stayed in Vegas for one night and wanted a quick coffee and doughnut fix before hitting the road again. This place was amazing. The doughnuts were crazy original and yummy. Ended up eating our doughnuts there and enjoying the small patio space they have out back. Would recommend you take the time to visit!! Super friendly and nice.

Walking in, I felt like I had been transported into one of those British bake shops where you can can hang out with your girlfriends for hours around cake and lattes. That's exactly what I did. I absolutely loved this quaint little place and they had plenty of comfortable seating. The only reason I'm giving this place 3 stars instead of 4 is the simple chocolate cake we ordered was a tad dry and the buttercream was hardened. It was as if the cake had been sitting out too long in the fridge and it was almost to the point of being stale. I've heard people rave about their delicious cakes so I'm going to assume we just got there on a day of a bad batch. The latte's we got were fine, nothing too special. I definitely loved the atmosphere and its a great little place to meet up with a few of your friends. Sure it was pricey for the subpar cake I had, but I want to come back and try it again to give this place a 2nd chance.

I stopped by their stand in the West Side Market for a cupcake, and later came here to get popcorn and buckeyes. The cupcake was amazing--key lime. I'm not usually a fan of dense cupcakes, but this one was moist and tasted great. The frosting was sweet but a little tangy. The popcorn (I tried fruity and got dichotomy) was soooo good. The buckeyes were just so so in my book. (My sister makes better ones!) Overall, definitely worth a stop. :)

You guys in the Upper South End area are so lucky. Between all of the trendy restaurants and bars, now you have an amazing Ice Cream spot too? So, Jealous, over here. I can't complain too much, I live in North Charlotte, my office is in South Charlotte, and my job involves traveling everywhere in between. So I get to see and visit any noteworthy business in the QC with relative ease. Jeni's is no exception to the list of 'noteworthy' places in my book. Between the kick-ass ice cream flavors and the friendly staff that know way too much about their product (and just ice cream in general), this place is a prime example of what every business should strive to be. So what makes them stand out? The flavors really are "next-level" exciting. Between Brambleberry Crisp and the Goat Cheese w/ Cherries, I couldn't tell you which one I crave more. That's right, I said goat cheese! You're probably thinking that goat cheese doesn't belong in Ice Cream. Well, why not? Who's this absolute authority that says what can and can't be Ice Cream? Forget the norm and live a little, darn it! Hats off to the staff. Everyone in the building is quite adept at the craft. How about finding out that "Darkest Chocolate" flavor has so much chocolate that if it had just 1% more it would "legally" have to be called fudge! They have a little morsel of knowledge for every flavor they sell. They also make fresh waffle cones. You can literally smell the caramelized/nutty/sugary aroma from three blocks down Camden. Everyone on site is as nice as can be, you can try any flavor you'd like and they even have metal tasting spoons. Some flavors are amplified versions of true classics, and some are truly unique creations that push the boundaries of what Ice Cream can be. Maybe it's best that I don't live around here or I'd be as big as a house in mere months. Just a small drawback is that on my last two visits, they've been out of one or two of my favorites. When the "Flight" of minis comes with three different flavors and a wedge of waffle cone, missing two flavors you're looking forward to is a real bummer. That being said, any substitution I've got here is always top notch. I've never got a bad scoop here. Splendid is such a good description for Jeni's. You won't be disappointed here.

Mary Coyle's is an ice cream shop of my childhood. It quickly became tradition to stop in for a scoop or two anytime we were in the area so I was more than thrilled to see them reopen! The homemade ice cream is to die for and the portions are generous! I have never been let down!

Pretty amazing ice cream and sorbet. The flavors are surprisingly captured very well , especially the key lime pie and the mango. Really unique flavors and great options. I bought two scoops and it was a bit much, single scoop should suffice unless you are looking to try multiple flavors. Mixing tart and sweet flavors is always a good choice. They also sell it by the pint separately if you really like it! Great service and not much seating , would come back !
Went here got a 4 scoop sampler it was so yummy. Orange dream, strawberry cheesecake, mango sorbet and banana cream pie. They are amazing!!!

Get Momofukos next store and come out and get a little dessert. First impression...too small for price. Then I ate it. Well...inhaled it. Ate it too fast for a pic! Milk bar pie...aka crack pie. In the age of sensitivity we don't call it crack anymore. But my body tells me otherwise. I'm a "crack" junky. Step aside bitches the crack is mine! Christina Tosi...I love you! (Shhh...don't tell my wife! You supply the crack pie and I'm yours!)
Flew all the way from Las Vegas to Champaign for the Cononut Choc Almond ice cream. Just too good... I'll be back!

This ice cream place is covered in fun and colorful decorations filled with ice cream, candies, and toys. Unfortunately the customer service was extremely slow and there was a long line that we ended up leaving. My brother in law decided to go back 30 minutes later because it was finally empty but when we got the cookies and cream it was disappointing and underwhelming.
very disappointed that I visit Vegas to find that your location in Linq was close and I could not find an airport atm.

Delicious ice cream! Expensive but a nice treat if you like ice cream. I must say, I was excited to finally try this place when it came to Charlotte (we even have her recipe book and make her ice creams at home from scratch) but when I came to the shop the service was less than great. The first lady helping us was nice but we went on to be helped by the other server who did not smile once. She did not seem like she wanted to be there! That definitely made me less interested and excited about my purchases. Maybe let's teach the staff to smile more.... But all in all I would come back because of the ice cream. I had the boozy egg nog (half off) and the bananas foster/creme brulee one. Yum!!!

Found this place on yelp and I am not disappointed. Cute little shop with amazing owners! They were both so welcoming and detailed with what they had to offer. All of their homemade artisan ice creams are soooooo good! I was so indecisive after sampling everything but ended with honey lavender which is AMAZING. Check this place out!
I'm obsessed with milk bar!!! I got the cereal milk soft serve with cereal on top, I loved it so much I wanted it again after I finished it lol.

I love love LOVE Sprinkles Cupcakes. Every time I come here, I try something different and it never disappoints. The cupcake cut into half with a scoop of ice cream (Captain Crunch ice cream makes the world go round) is probably the best thing ever invented. The ATM is fun to take out of towners to see and even though the line is always daunting, the staff does a great job of getting everyone what they need and fast.
Love the deserts and the soup and sandwiches, this place is definitely serving some delicious food but the long waits to purchase and hard time finding a place to seat inside is a turn off for me.

Dear God, everything on the menu sounds like my personal heaven. Shakes, sundea's, splits, soft server... Give. It. All. To. Me! My friend and I were driving through Homestead past Nancy B's Bakery when she said "You know Page Diary Mart makes an ice cream sundae with her homemade chocolate chip cookies?" No more words needed to be said between us. The decision was silently made that we'd head down Carson Street and there as no stopping us! The only child in me wanted to order the entire chocolate chip cookie sundae for myself. The calorie counting adult in me knew the right decision would be to split it. I mean, let's get real... this thing is monster size! You can easily split it BUT... I could EASILY gobble that whole thing down in one sitting! It was amazing! We watched them heat up the cookies and toss them into the soft serve vanilla ice cream that melted it just enough that it mixed in perfectly with the warm chocolate chip cookie. Add hot fudge and it was ice cream overload to the max. But in the best way possible. Me thinks I'll be stopping here a lot this summer... it cannot be avoided!

Great place for amazing pastries and desserts. We passed by this place every morning on our way to the Strip but never went in until our last day in Vegas. Kind of a last minute decision to come in to check it out and we were glad that we did. Lots of tempting options at the counter. We would love to try every single thing available but we knew that we couldn't do it so we settled with a chocolate almond croissant and a strawberry lemonade macaron. Omg they were delicious. Some of the best desserts we had in Vegas. They were so yummy that we came back and bought some macarons and croissants to bring home. We would love to come back to this place again for more tempting sweets the next time we are in Vegas.

Yes yes and yes! If there were more stars I would be clicking on them. I work downtown at Pizza Lotto and have been craving donuts all week thanks to the growing bean in my belly ;) I walked in and COULD NOT BELIEVE MY EYES. I ended up getting a dozen because why not. Fast and friendly service and absolutely delicious donuts. Thanks guys!
10/10 would recommend! The staff was very nice and the ice cream choices are endless! So many different flavors, and signature flavors! Will be coming back again!

I went to Milk Bar in NYC and I've been craving the Crack Pie ever since my last visit there. I ordered the Crack Pie ($6.50) here and it was nasty and disappointing ugh. It tasted like straight up butter so this ruined my craving boo. It was not the Crack Pie that I enjoyed eating in NYC. However, I liked the crack pie soft serve ($6) which I ordered with rainbow sprinkles (50 cents more) which was sweet! I enjoyed the Confetti, Compost, and Cornflake Chocolate Chip Marshmellow cookies (3 for $8) as well which were way better than the crack pie unfortunately.

While visiting Phoenix with family, we stopped at Novel for after lunch ice cream. Brandon, the owner, greeted us immediately and encouraged us to sample as much ice cream as we desired. Between the five of us we all had a Doughmelt which included a warm donut with a generous scoop of ice cream and a topping of our choice. Each flavor we had was excellent, but the experience with Brandon was definitely what made this a five-star location.

Best ice cream and milk shakes. The staff is friendly and happy! They will let you try all the different favors to see what one you like the most. I found this place on yelp one night after work doing a search for dessert. It's my new favorite spot! I would eat it for all meals forever if I could.

This place is a hidden gem. The people working here are so nice. The flavors are amazing, and the kids had way more sugar than they needed (but that's kind of the point here)! The only downfall is the small building. If it's busy, there will be a line outside the front door, as only one group can reasonably be in there at a time, but there is no way to know that if you enter from the back. Will definitely be coming back.

Had just decided to go vegan two days prior to traveling to las vegas. Looked up vegan sweet treats on yelp and found Sprinkles. Its super cute and girly inside and they have the most moist and delicious vegan red velvet cupcakes. Totally recommend trying this place whether you are vegan or not!

Melt isn't the same as it used to be. I was a regularly customer for several years until they and sister-business Jobot were forced to move two streets over to "gentrification central" under Roosevelt Point from their original location on 5th street. In the past 2-3 years, I've seen a great decline in taste and quality of their ice cream and overall customer service. They have gutted many products and taken away several "classic" flavors from their arsenal. I am not sure what has been happening but I hope it changes soon because the Melt that I had come to know and love just isn't the same anymore.

Still dreaming about the delicious goodness that is the strawberry croissant even though it's been more than a month since I've been here *drooool* This is no place for people on a low-carb diet. Their pastries are so ridiculously good - you really can't go wrong with anything on display. Their macaroons are monster and the size of your face, but my favorites here are the croissants. The almond croissant, the chocolate, and my personal fave - the strawberry croissant are all to die for. Perfect flakiness, sweetness, and the texture of the smooth strawberry filling...omg. Who needs cronuts when you have croissants like these! They make a solid brew as well and the service was friendly. A definitely go-to whenever I'm in Vegas and around the Venetian!

There are a few things I like about this Bakery, the top reason has to be the balance of Bread and other bake goods it offers. I love bread, but most bakery I found is just pastry shops, cookies and cakes, etc. No bread. It is very hard to find good quality bread. This bakery has a good combination of bread, croissants, and other sweet stuff. The second reason is that it is a local shop, not a chain or a franchise, so that's worth an extra star. As far as the quality of the bread and pastries, it ranges from average to very good. I would not say anything is out of this world, but I do wish I had a bakery like that in my neighborhood.
This is a terrific place. Great food and services.

I had the pleasure of attending this location for outing recently. Upon entrance, much of the place is lit up well with lots of abstract lighting. I have always enjoyed visiting each of these locations as no two are the same and follow an unorthodox decoration style. We visited late at night so the staff was ready to get us out of there but always stayed kind and efficient. The pastries and deserts were absolutely delicious and come at a fair price for the quality. They offered a fair bit of outdoor seating along with having plenty of indoor seating. I love this place as it is perfect for any social gathering or if you prefer to just keep to yourself and get some work done.

The rainbow cake is THE BEST item to get! Followed by the cookies and cream lobster tail! I've been here several times and have always had great customer service. Sometimes there can be a line up but they tend to move fast. I Always stop by here when I'm visiting Las Vegas.

Breakfast quiche! Cookies! Gelato! How can you NOT be a fan of this place? It really is a Cleveland institution. I like to come here from breafast all the way to my afternoon snack. For breakfast, I like to get their breakfast quiche or the croissant sandwiches. They're super buttery and flaky and filled with egg and cheese and your choice of breakfast meats. They're hearty and filling. For my mid-morning snack, I'd pick up a few cookies. There's an assortment of cookies and you purchase them by weight. I often like to get a few of each. It's not too expensive considering the amount of butter that's in these babies. You can taste the clogging of your arteries -- now that's a damn good cookie. For lunch, they have a lot of meal combos. From the Italian favorites of meatballs and cavatelli to a quick lasagna, they've got your lunch meal ready for less than 10 dollars. I often get one for there (they'll heat it up) and one to go (they close pretty early so dinner is sometimes not an option). For my afternoon snack (I sometimes like to stay inside all day because with their free internet and delicious coffees, I can afford a study date there), I like to pick up a pastry. They used to start selling their morning donuts at a discount starting in the afternoon. It seems like their donut chef has recently left and so there are NO MORE donuts. But that's alright, I suppose, because I'm filling the donut hole in my heart with plenty of chocolate tirimisu and lemon tarts. But if the pastry gods are listening, please bring back the donuts! PLEASEEEE!!

So approaching this place, you immediately wonder if you are going to see a movie or grab some ice cream. Definitely a cool entrance. The ice cream is pretty stellar and the staff is friendly and pretty amazing. I can see why this place is as popular as it is. I definitely have to give this place my recommendation.

Great spot to get some really good ice cream. We like to get the sweet sundae where you can choose 4 different kinds of ice cream, comes with a cookie, brownie and a toasted marshmallow. This is a great item to share. I have also got the sorbet, strawberry and coconut which is very refreshing as well. Typically on the weekends they have enough employees to handle the line. When I recently went this past weekend, they do not have any seating inside only about two tables outside. Love to come here when we are in the area!
Very overpriced, two small scoops of ice cream for $5.50! The ice cream was ok, but nothing special. They have some unusual flavors, which is interesting. I don't think I'll go back though.

Amelie's is a unique place among all of the fast food and chain stores here in Charlotte. The original location in NoDa is the best, but the parking and the lines can be pretty rough there no matter the time or day. Definitely a must see. Their lavender lemonade and chocolate hazelnut tart are among my favorites.

I'd honestly like to live at Amelie's. The staff is thoughtful and friendly, the food is excellent, the coffee is killer (I had one of their innovative seasonal offerings), and the decor is spectacularly quirky. It is a must do and must see for Downtown Charlotte!
Definitely one of the best donut places to go to an Cleveland they have a bunch of different flavors always fresh it's a must try

WOW. what a diamond in the rough the inside is quirky and fun, the baked good omg the baked goods! the salted caramel brownie still has me drooling a bit the houseblend coffee was really great too seating can be a bit hard to find so just be prepared or go outside to the atrium ( its covered) and grab a table

This place is just ok, not really worth the hype or the wait in line. My friend and I stumbled upon this place by accident while walking into the Grand Canal Shoppes in The Venetian. I was excited to see a black and white cookie here (I'm still longing for the William Greenburg ones I ate at the Plaza Hotel in New York) and this was an extreme disappointment. The cookie itself was dry and lacked flavor. The sugar cookie I also bought was the same, hard and dry. IIt was such a shame considering how much they charge for cookies! I wouldn't recommend going out of your way for desserts here.

This is a solid place. PROS: - decor... omg soooo cute!!!! Very eclectic and French-inspired. Always something new to look at. Check out their French word of the day. CONS: - everything I've tried, from coffee to pastries, has been average - busy all the time. Good luck finding a chair!

I had to try it all! I got the fruity pebble shake which was super yummy and it was so cool that they got clumps of cereal to stay crunchy in the ice cream. I got the cereal, chocolate, marshmallow cookie which I can't wait to try and duplicate. And of course I had to get to get a slice of the crack pie, which did not disappoint.
This place is amazing. The chocolate almond croissant and TLC cookies are my favorite. The shortbread cookies are heavenly. Every time I visit Vegas I go out of my way to visit this sugar jewel.

Well, the desserts are as good as they look on social media. Whatever you imagined something you viewed looked like, that's what it tastes like! After cyber-stalking this trending bakery on social media for few days , I decided to make a pilgrimage for something...anything she ( the baker) had left. Luckily, after standing in line, I was able to try a couple of items pictures with this review. It was worth the wait. If you have time to kill, the line isn't that major. Just bring a friend to catch up or whatever. There is seating indoors , and hot beverages available on the menu as well. This foodie call is worth it, trust me .

Ok - you know it's good when it's winter...freezing (for Vegas standards) and we are all waiting outside for ice cream. The taste is rich, creamy and authentic! Love love love and can't wait to go back

Smooth, creamy and nicely sweet all over! Tried the Peanut Butter and Chocolate Mint Cookie flavors in a cone. The Peanut Butter boasted true PB taste without being too overpowering - probably would be a great pairing with Strawberry ice cream and, of course, Chocolate. The Mint Cookie had that perfect not-too-minty taste with slightly softened chocolate cookie chunks. This one was our fav of the two, though both didn't disappoint.The mouthfeel was quite smooth and didn't leave any of the butterfat film on my mouth or grainy texture. It was frozen to the perfect degree, not too hard or soft. Looked to be about 16 different flavors to choose from at any given time and they offer a unique pretzel cone for those looking to mash up their sweet with a little salty. The nostalgic shop atmosphere makes for a fun experience. What's more, there's a cute garden/patio type setting out back to enjoy the sweet treats.

Great gelato, great coffee, and great pastries/desserts to indulge in as you come here before and after your meal in Little Italy. I think it's probably best after a good meal in any of the many restaurants surrounding the bakery. The place is wide open and can easily get busy, especially as the weekend nears when we all have time to experience life outside of work. If you're in the area, come here get your italian sweet fix....you won't be diappointed.

Very good ice cream!! Love the honey lavender and berries and cream! There were 6 of us and we all had cones, except for one donut sandwich and he said that was really good too. So creamy amd flavorful.

Quick service, and simply the best Chocolate and Peanut Butter ice cream you'll ever find. After grabbing lunch on the Terrace, why not stop in for a cup of delicious Babcock Ice Cream? The staff are usually friendly and efficient, and the price is reasonable for a cone or cup of your favorite flavor. Mine is the chocolate and peanut butter. This flavor seems to be hard to get at the grocery store, but the Babcock version of it they serve at the Daily Scoop is the best I've ever eaten. It is the perfect blend of chocolate sweetness with that slight hint of the saltiness of the peanut butter. Nothing better on a hot summer day.

The owner, Brandon, was an absolute gem. Very friendly, knowledgeable and extremely passionate about his ice cream and overall concept. Every flavor I tried (which was several, because Brandon insisted I try as much as I want!) was delicious. Great choices for toppings, and you could even get your ice cream pressed in between donuts or waffles. Such a great little addition to the Grand Ave scene!

My mom brought home a box of donuts that they brought to work today. I look at the box and think, "Well, they can't be that bad," and snatch up a donut with chocolate icing and sprinkles because they're my absolute favorite. Keep in mind, the donut is beyond cold and I thought would be very stiff. But I bit into it and it melted right in my mouth and the taste was delicious. All I kept thinking in between every cold bite was, "Wow, this is literally the best donut I have ever had." And it was COLD! I'm so excited to go in and try one deliciously fresh donut. Happy that the place is so close to home, too!

The best cookies I've ever had in my life. You can taste the passion and love put into the treats. I am soo glad that there's finally a shop. I usually just put in orders for birthdays and special events. I am not a big breakfast person, so a cookie and a cup of coffee from the Batchhouse is the perfect start to the day!! Thanks for opening up your home and sharing with the community. Oh and thanks for being a friend!

This is such a local gem. Everyone from the 217 knows this place as a symbol of their childhood. The crazy lines are part of the experience. Use it as an opportunity to observe the townies, we're interesting people. You have to pick a side though, are you going to call it Jarling's or Custard Cup? Cold fudge is their specialty, and yeah, it really is better cold.

What is the hype about? I have been want to try this place for a while and I was so disappointed. Got there at 1140 on a Friday so there were only three types of donuts left; Crete brÃ»lÃ©e, strawberry cheesecake, and Nutella overload. I wasn't disappointed with the lack of selection as I would have chose two if the three anyway. They were dry, and all disappointing in flavor. The brÃ»lÃ©e topping tasted burnt and not sweet and the cream was almost tasteless. The strawberry cheese cake was a jelly filled with cheesecake icing I guess? Not enough filling , couldn't taste anything like cheesecake, and the filling tasted cheap. The Nutella overload an underload with not enough filling. It was straight Nutella which was the only saving grace of the donut experience. They did have nitro cold brew which I tried and it was good but their cold brew was bitter and not smooth. Will not try this place again.

I just wasn't that impressed. My apple whatever donut was a regular donut with what seemed to be industrial kitchen straight out of a bag pie filling on top. I tried another of their donuts and it seemed to be the same type of deal. Regular donut with a very sugary industrial filling on top. I might consider for buying dozens for an event, but I won't be making Sunday morning trips with the family.

I usually come here for halo-halo but today will be 1 star because for some reason the guy who made our halo-halo was slow and didn't put enough fruits/ingredients in our halo-halo. Or maybe they are trying to be stingy with recipe.

We had to go her for our pasties of course, being a fan of Cake Boss and all. Well needless to say they do a wonderful job!!! We went 3 out of 4 days of being in Vegas, yummy all the way!! They do it right savory and sweet, we got a spinach feta croissant type pastry, caramel lobster tail, and chocolate croissant. Everything was so delicious and very memorable to say the least. The staff extremely knowledgeable and kind!! We will be back when we go back to Vegas!!

I really like the chocolate chip cookies here. Everything else I have tried, (cupcakes, cannoli, cream puff variations) are good but not anything special. I have yet to try their lobster tails, so I will return for those next time I stay at the Venetian. The line can be a bit of the problem here, enough to say that if the wait looks too long, it might hamper your expectations on the dessert themselves.

Hard to do reviews like these since everyone has different tastes. But this is my experience. The cookie was good, didn't try the cupcakes, and service was nice. The ice cream was terrible. I can buy store bought ice cream that tasted better. The pieces of chocolate in the ice cream felt like chalk and took a while for the pieces to go away. I couldn't even finish the cup I got. Regret wasting almost $9 on subpar ice cream.

Oh my, oh my, the croissants are so delicious. warm, soft, and buttery. Almost as good as the ones I would buy in Paris. There seems to always be a line here weekend mornings, but I don't mind waiting. My parents really enjoy their macaroons. I tried this fruit tart that was to die for. It was overloaded with fruits and just the right amount of sweetness. I haven't tried their cupcakes, and I think I'll be keeping it that way. Its supposed to be a french bakery, so I'll stick to the specialties.

Ninety's has been a staple in University area for quite some time now and they recently revamped and renovated the interior of the store. The menu was also revamped, with there now being a main focus on ice cream and desserts offered. The last two times I got the Yum-eee bun and both times I got the S'mores one with graham cracker crumbles, chocolate ice cream and marshmallows wedged between a heated up glazed donut. Each time I feel like I tasted more of just the donut and the ice cream than the graham cracker crumbles and marshmallows, but the concept is interesting and is a great treat if you are looking to indulge a little bit. They have other types of Yum-eee buns and you can also create your own. In addition, they have traditional ice cream offerings, macaroon ice cream sandwiches, cookie dough pops and cereal milk shakes as some of the things you will find here. It's pretty original compared to anything else in the area. Prices are a little high in my opinion for some of the things they offer, but the place seems to do really well, especially since remodeling the store. I recommend it, but try to avoid the place on a Weekend evening in the summer since the place can be packed with a line to the door.

I was expecting much more from this place. I've heard so much about it and from all the posts I've seen from Milk Bar in NYC, I knew I had to give this place a try. I got to sample the flavors - crack pie and cereal milk. They were both decent in flavor. I ended up with cereal milk and the worker convinced me to get corn flakes on top ($1 extra) by saying that it was really good with the corn flakes. Honestly, unpopular opinion but... it wasn't good. They were WAY too salty and didn't really add much to the soft serve. Also, the soft serve was too soft - bordering on watery. My friends got the cookies - they tasted burnt to me - and the crack pie - really good, but really expensive. Overall, this place was not for me. Super basic and overpriced soft serve, I would most definitely choose McDonald's soft serve over this place.

WOW! My Yelp review is mainly about customer service! In town on my Honeymoon! We stopped at Sprinkles after riding the ferris wheel. We grabbed a dozen box and were greeted with some pretty awesome counter girls! After we chatted for a few we went to leave and my new bride tripped on her dress and dropped our cupcakes all over the place. One of the girls came running out to see if we were OK and then told us to hold tight while she helped us out. Literally a few minutes later she came out with a brand new box of cupcakes free of charge and that there was also a special message waiting inside the box. When we got back to our room we opened the box and the cupcakes spelled out Tie The Knot IN CUPCAKES!!!!!! Needless to say we were blown away and called the store back right away to rave about our experience. They went out of their way when they didn't have to and you don't see that every day, anymore. Oh yeah, and the cupcakes are BOMB! 7 down, 5 more to go! Great frosting, super moist cake but best of all SWEET service. Thanks so much ladies, you really made our day special and it will be a forever memorable moment.

My favorite bakery. Even more than Jean Philippe. Bouchon is relatively cheap and gourmet. I got an iced mocha, better nutter cookie, TKO cookie, and one of the plain baguettes for about $17. That's cheap even if not on the strip. The cookies are huge. Iced Mocha - rich with quality cocoa powder. The best mocha I've ever tasted. Has notes of coconut from the rich cocoa powder. Get it! Macarons - best macarons IMO. They are big too. No hollow shell like some places. Perfectly soft with the nice macaron shell crust. Not chew like some places, although I'm not against the chewy type macarons. These macarons melt in your mouth. Cupcakes - I saw a giant cupcake for $3.25. They are in between the jumbo muffin and regular sized muffin cups. I've never tried any of their cupcakes, but they look really good. $3.25 for a cupcake is a steal these days considering Sprinkles at the Linq charges somewhere around $4 I think. Better Nutter cookie - GET IT. Even if you don't like peanut butter. This is like a peanut butter lover's dream come true. My mom isn't fond of peanut butter but she is absolutely obsessed with this. The cookie has bits of peanuts in it as well as peanut butter I believe, the cream filling is a peanut butter italian meringue buttercream. OMG, it's soooooo good. TKO cookie - chocolate butter cookie with white chocolate ganache filling. Meh, it was okay. I wish the filling had some vanilla flavor, but it was really just cocoa butter flavor and cream. I think vanilla would've helped the flavor shine a bit more. The cookie is also really soft. It was hard to break pieces off. But hey, that means you don't have to share. The chocolate cookie itself was good and not sweet. It balanced the sweetness of the filling nicely. Bread - it's their standard baguette they serve at dinner in their restaurant. They toast it up for you if you want and ask you if you want jam or cream cheese. The bread does get hard after it cools down, so better eat it while it's warm. Nice crust and chewy. Great aroma. Americano - the first place I've ordered an americano that tastes creamy without anything but espresso + water. I don't know how they managed to do that. If you need a dairy-free option, get the Americano.
Unbelievable ice cream! OMG...Habenero Bacon ice cream!! Amazing flavors and concoctions. I got the Pecan turtle sundae. ..its the best Sundae I ever had.

as i was walking down the street one day, my sniffer picked up a scent. could it be a burger or a cake I pondered. aha! it was a donut scent I picked up on. my big kangaroo feet carried me as fast as I could to get to the source of the smell. I rounded a corner and saw it. a big building. It looked like any other but inside I knew was something special. I pounced through the doors and was assaulted with smells like no other. so many good smells in one place overwhelmed me and I screeched and ran. I finally worked up the courage to go back yesterday and crawled up to the counter. I ordered and when i took my first bite I screamed so loud my cat heard me (she told me about it later) and I clicked my heels and off I went. It takes a while to build up courage but once you do it's worth it

This one is my favorite of the Amelie's. Maybe because it was my first but I think it's because of the quaintness of the place and the many places you can sit with friends or get some work done. Their bakery is endless. Never know what to get but typically select something that has raspberries. Bottom line... you can't go wrong. Located in Noda I love going to Amelies any time it's open. The smell Itself will wish you away. Enjoy

I love the size of these donuts! For donut fanatics like me, it is a glimpse of nirvana to see a giant fresh donut with delectable toppings. And the variety! So much to choose from, I get paralyzed when I want it all. I can't decide! And kudos to them for not serving all cake donuts, which is what many bakeries do so that they can stack multiple toppings and glazes on top without them losing their shape. Nope, Donut Bar serves nicely soft, huge yeast donuts, which is comparatively rare. And yummier :-) I chose the Brad Fritter with bacon and caramel, a blueberry cheesecake filled, and a lemon pistachio "glazed" yeast donut (small tire sized). Took me 2 days to finish them, such is my gluttony. They serve a nice assortment of caffeinated drinks to wash them down. Not a whole lot of sit down space, but that's the only shortcoming really. Worth the walk.
All of their cookies are great but I can't pass up the pignoli cookies. The live music was a nice touch. It really added to the "Little Italy" experience.

As others have mentioned the wait in line is painfully long. That being said they are working as quickly as they possibly can to get you through the line in an efficient manner. As you can see in my photos we bought a lot of different things so we could try it all. Everything was delicious and I even have a coffee mug now as a souvenir from our visit. It is pricey so be prepared.
Great little ice cream place! Be sure to try the Dough Melt, a mouthwatering doughnut stuffed with ice cream.

Mitchell's is amazing! I have never been disappointed. Their coffee with chocolate chunk ice cream and their cherry with chocolate chunk ice cream are my favorite but that's just because I can't try anything else new since I'm addicted!

Who isn't a fan of yummy ice cream?! Ghirardelli's is great in San Francisco and it's also great in Las Vegas! If you need a sweet fix head over there, they will definitely make sure to give you your sugar fix!
This is a hidden gem of a place. So glad we found it! The cookie cup was so delicious!! Wish we had found this place earlier during our vacation. Very friendly people who run it too.

I've been craving for taho for so long that I randomly searched it here on Yelp. Pleasantly surprised to learn about Scooptopia and so happy to finally get my taho fix after years! It was still warm, the tapioca was freshly made and it wasn't too sweet. We also got halo-halo, sago drink and ice cream. Everything was exceptional. Also worth mentioning are the very nice people behind the counter who were so helpful and accomodating.

I can see why this place has 5*! Brandon was very friendly and helpful. Visiting from NY, he let us try all the flavors if we wanted. He was patient and it didn't matter if there was a line behind us. He treated everyone equally and with respect. The ice cream and sorbet was BOMB! Would definitely come back for more and support Brandon next time I visit Arizona.

Their ice cream is wonderfully distinct without being pretentious. They work out of a humble converted house; divided in two and selling their sweet creations out of the left half. Parking is plentiful because there are streets all around. The outdoor seating was a perfect view of the blood moon tonight. I really couldn't ask for a better ice cream experience. I love the brandy/toffee ice cream which was one one of the five flavors I tried in my flight. I think their fudge brownie ice cream has the highest brownie to ice cream ratio I've ever had. I really like the chocolate rose pistachio, it was such a strange mix but it worked. I'm very glad I stopped in for a bite.

Pricey but pretty good treats. I've been to the LA location a few times and I probably prefer this location better. I am usually a fan of their cookies and ice cream. The last time I came here was when I stayed at the Cosmo. I do not drink dairy and asked them to make a Milk and Cereal Latte for me with something non dairy. So I guess they couldn't with that option so I went with their regular size Birthday Cake Latte with almond milk instead ($6.50). I didn't think it was anything super special but it was good and I was glad I got it. I also got their Gluten Free Birthday Cake Truffle which I highly recommend ($6). It comes pre-packaged with three truffles inside. The packaging is cute and they were SO GOOD! I definitely recommend them. I do appreciate that they have non-dairy options and gluten free options available when not many dessert places do. I also like that most of their sweets are pretty good but just pretty pricey.
Not sure if you can be vulgar about a description, but these are better than sex. No shit. Best donuts ever.
Amazing atmosphere. Food is consistent, parking can be tough but it is just a heavy plaza

Ordered through the outdoor window and ate outside. The donut sandwich was incredible and the staff was nice, helpful, and quick! Would recommend for a quick stop, the place has parking and a fun outdoor seating area, but no misters or cover so during summer you can't stay long.

I was excited to try this place since I've been on a macaroon phase. I bought a box of six macaroons. They looked so pretty in their package but unfortunately they did not live up to the hype. The macaroons were HUGE compared to other places but I would probably not go back for them.

Saw this place and I thought I would stop in. Yes, it's expensive....any where you go in LV it's expensive and they are on The Strip, so I can only imagine what their rent is in The Venetian. The cookies are large and everyone enjoyed them, you have to be pretty bad to mess up a cookie. My rating is lower because I'm a celiac. You would have thought by now they would have made something for someone like me and others to eat who can't have gluten. So, this is a one time stop to the shop.

Every mall needs an Eataly for real. La Pasticceria is the pastry section with things like tiramisu, fruit tarts, and cannolis. I came by on my last day in Vegas for a caffeine pick me up because I was exhausted. All of their espresso drinks came in hot or iced and had 3 sizes to them. Price-wise it was slightly more than starbucks with their iced latte in the smallest available size being a 12oz for $4.90 before taxes. It was very good though. Strong, smooth, and creamy. As a bonus they had paper straws available. Vegas is kind of behind with respect to their conservation initiatives (no separate recyclables) so the paper straw is a nice step.

Stopped by on 1/21 as it was near a place I was at. I wanted some breakfast and decided to give it a try. The location was clean, with items being restocked and rotated throughout. There were plenty of items out at 9:30am, with the option to order your drink ahead via a kiosk before selecting all your pastries. I opted for a Matcha Bun that had chocolate in it. A Twist that had raisins and a sweet filling, and also a bacon cheese roll. All of the items were individually wrapped, with things still available to pick up things. I did like this but I do think it's quite wasteful with all the added plastic. As I was checking out, I added a Rose Milk tea (hot) to my order. My total was $10 which wasn't bad for 4 items. The tea came out fairly quickly so I didn't have to wait and the cashier was quick too in checking me out. The Matcha Choco Bun - normally I don't like filled buns (not into the creams inside) but this was actually quite good! Not overly sweet and good texture. The Coconut Twist - I was surprised to find raisins inside as I didn't expect that but it was good and the filling was good as well! Not too much of a coconut flavor, however, it paired perfect with a warm drink. Rose Milk Tea - this was ok, not the best I've ever had but good! The flavor wasn't too artificial (some rose flavored drinks tend to taste like bitter petals) but this drink was balanced well in flavor profile. I do wish they had more combinations as I like rose with match. Bacon and Cheese Bun - I ended up eating this the next day (right before typing this). I microwaved it for about 15 seconds in the plastic bag, and it's so soft and perfect! Very delicious and not stale at all considering I had it a day later. I would definitely buy this again next time! I recommend giving this bakery a try!

So went back today. Got 6 donuts to test. The vanilla cream, maple glaze, chocolate glaze and even the plain glaze for a glazed donut were all different. The glazed donut was still decent, despite the change. However the maple is just awful, thankfully tho the cake donut itself was still good. The vanilla cream improved over our last trip, so that was positive, but the chocolate glaze went downhill. I just can't fathom why they would change a perfectly good product. The donuts remain the same, delicious, soft and fresh. But the toppings need some help. Bring back the old recipe or the old ingredients, we can taste the difference and we are not happy :(

Oh no! We just found this place yesterday!! We are in trouble!! Amazing drinks and sundaes. I had a quake shake with mint chocolate chips. Very relaxing and easy to get in and out. We decided to have a seat and enjoy and I left with a bag of chocolate. A good quick fix if you cant make it up to SF. Service is great!! Very clean and well stocked with all their items you would want. Very Dangerous!! I will stopping in again for their cocoa.

Oh Bouchon, how I adore thee :) I love macaroons, but this place saved me. The chocolate and vanilla macaroons are amazing! My boyfriend and I stopped by for the 4 days we were in Vegas, and when I was back 3 weeks later, I purchased the minis to take home for my man, and some for my best friend. Long story short, I have a few more orders coming in from the NY bakery as well I also tried the actual bouchons and my my goodness! A sweet tooth paradise

So many options! The quality of this ice cream is so good. There are so many flavors of ice cream that this is a spot for everyone! Service was friendly and fast, even with the line. I had the butter pecan and blueberry cobbler and it was an amazing mixture. Will definitely be back even if it is a drive for us!

Part of my favorite morning routine before I stepped out of the Venetian to hit the Strip was to stop at this small bakery outside the hotel and nibble on their delectable goodies. Their huge slider-sized macarons caught my eye when I first walked past and I knew immediately I had to come give them a try. Oh, and these babies? The Queen bees of macarons as their gargantuan bodies stood out amongst the vast array of smaller, more delicate confectioneries and other irresistible French baked goods on display. I purchased their Pistachio, Vanilla and Chocolate macarons and, not surprisingly, Pistachio was my favorite - I've been completely smitten ever since! Quite possibly the best Pistachio macarons I've ever had. The cookie shell was perfectly crisp, yet easily giving way to the pillowy soft goodness within as you take bite after delicate bite - sigh, Heaven. The prices were great too at $3.50/each. I also tried their croissant which wasn't bad as it was buttery and flaky. Honestly though, I just wish Thomas Keller can open a Bouchon Bakery closer to where I live as I now have a new, potentially lifelong, obsession with their Queen-sized macarons!

Terrific doughnut stop! Easy to locate. We got a nice assortment and we were pleased with each. The tiramisu doughnut was piled high with creamy white icing. They are very generous with all icing! My only complaint was that there was not a visible menu of the days' doughnuts. Overwhelming choices led to many questions from us and we felt pressured to make a decision with the line behind us.

Always yummy and fun!! Just so pricey for ice cream. I hate that places like this mark everything up (my $2.00 brownie mix is $5.00 here). That's the only reason for 4 stars. Service was Awesome!! Rayna (sorry if I spelled it wrong) was at the cash register and was so fun and full of energy! We all had sundaes and the folks making them did an excellent job. I don't gamble so this is a great place to "lose" my money after a night walking the strip
I am from Youngstown OH!!! This was where we went... All the time. BEST ice cream EVER. Your first time you must try Chocolate Pecan!!!! You will keep going back... Take a quart home!!

The perfect little donut shop! I love this little shop and the customer service was excellent. We went after the Color Run and don't judge this curvy girl likes sweets...lol. They had a huge selection of donuts and some were huge. I got the birthday cake, strawberry and creme, and cake batter. I also tried their grilled cheese that was awesome. Lil Olivia said it was sweet and savory. The only thing I didn't like was that their was only about 10 chairs inside for dining. We had to go to the back patio and it was a little chilly but it would be cute if a little warmer. I am really glad I tried this spot and the prices were pretty cheap. The time we went the line was out the door but went quickly.
Best place on the strip. We got great service and vegan options. Would recommend to all

The atmosphere of the store is awesome and my boyfriend and I love their milkshakes. The only reason for 4 stars is because I feel it's a little pricey for the size of the shake, but if you're just treating yourself every once in a while then it's definitely worth it!

Stumptown coffee, amazing gigantic donuts...get here early or they will run out of your favorites. Free parking around the corner in the lot by the juice store. Met the owner and founder ...everyone in there is so nice. Will have to be back soon too many good choices.

Staff is still very rude but pastries continue to be marvelous. It's a mystery to me why people bother to go to Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf when this is a escalator ride away. The fruit servings and pastry size have shrunken since the pandemic, but that is to be expected when minimum wage increases to current levels. But I digress. If you want to enjoy fine pastry, shut up, get in line and be grateful you don't work with these people.

Was in the area and decided to give them a try. The ice cream was very rich, creamy and fairly sweet. It seems like they make their own? This is what Cold Stone USED to taste like. Definitely a decadent treat!

Woah!.. have seen this place on YT vids and finally was able to stop by.. I'm so numbed that I didn't earlier as I had the BEST donuts ever! I won't miss this place ever again and will come by every time I'm in Vegas

Love this place. Fresh home made pastries and ice cream. Fantastic shakes and freezes. A lot of options for any sweet tooth. Slightly over priced but in this case you get what you pay for. High quality ingredients and friendly staff, also a nice outside patio.
We love to stop at Page's. They have a huge selection, and prices are good. Staff is always very friendly. It's a Pittsburgh tradition!!

Ok first off, this place SMELLS like heaven! (What I imagine heaven smells like, anyway) The line was quite long for pastries. I waited about 20 minutes before it was my turn but it was well worth the wait. There's so many desserts to choose from, but I chose a regular cannoli, chocolate cannoli, white chocolate mousse cake and a hazelnut cream puff. I really wanted a black and white cookie but unfortunately they were sold out for the day. Everything I chose was delicious! My favorite would have to be the white chocolate mousse. At $9.95 I was a bit skeptical on whether it would be worth the money but I'd happily pay this again. I may have eaten the whole thing by myself.............. Not sorry. The cannolis were awesome. They tasted homemade, as they should. I preferred the regular cannoli over the chocolate covered one. I recommend letting them sit out like 10 mins before eating them because when they're straight from the fridge it's a bit hard to bite into. It tasted better when thawed out :) Good thing I don't live near Carlo's because I'd be super fat if I did (but I'd be happyyyy)!

Pretty poor! Coming from North Jersey, and being immersed in the Italian culture, the cookies from Carlo's were extraordinarily underwhelming. I've bought better Italian cookies in Publix, in Florida. Honestly, Great Value Cooke's far out-class what I purchased today at Carlo's in the Venetian. Mama would be vety, very disappointed, Buddy. What is also amazing (not really) to me is that for all the reviews here on Yelp, there isn't a comment back from the company. I guess Buddy and his gang are just too full of themselves and too rolling in dough to even care that their quality is so pathetic. Guess they believe that there are plenty of suckers born every minute. Sorry, Valastro, but you have completely tarnished your reputation as an actual quality baker - you're just another side-show charlatan. Nuthin' matters but the almighty buck, huh?

Pros: I wanted so badly to love this place, but it was simply just good. I'm not day dreaming of the cake or ice cream as I suspected I would.  I will definitely give it another shot when I'm around another milk bar and I certainly finished the entire cake/ice cream pint, all very tasty, but this place has so much hype, it just didn't live up to it.  Cons: pricey, but it's Vegas

I had to try this place after seeing it everywhere.... TRASHED it after 2 bites. The reviews are mixed so I wanted to play it safe, I got the cereal milk soft serve with corn flakes, sour tasting soft serve and regular ass corn flakes on top... I don't understand how this place is still in business with sooo many other choices that actually taste GOOD in Las Vegas. Save your money, you WILL BE DISAPPOINTED. McDonald's soft serve is better than Milk bar.
By far the best croissant, flakey, crisp, every bite was amazing, the food had great flavour and really good service, best experience i had in las vegas.

I don't know where to begin. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. The worker who scooped my ice cream was one of the rudest people I have ever met. She gave my sister and I SO much attitude when trying to explain how we can have two scoops and not one. She handed the ice cream cone to me with the second scoop practically falling off the cone. When I asked her if I can have a cup since the ice cream was FALLING OFF she said no. I had to ask another worker, the cashier, for a cup. Even the cashier was giving me attitude about handing an empty cup to me. Stay away from this place! Extremely disappointed!

I was excited when I saw they have a Sprinkles that made ice cream but the clerk at the register had no knowledge of how anything was made so I ended up just getting a cupcake. The lady behind me ordered and why did he assume we were together and put our cupcakes in the same box. We said no we're separate then he said we charge for separate boxes.. that doesn't make sense to me.. got back to eat my cupcake and it was crumbly and dry.. smh

Hands down best ice cream sandwich I've ever had. I ordered there fresh waffle ice cream sandwich which was unreal, the customer service was awesome, really cool place, I will definitely be back again!

My only regret is not finding this place sooner! Novel is a unique gem! My husband and I came on a Friday night around 8 pm. It was busy but we got to the front of the line in about 10 min. Brandon, the owner, is amazing. He explained all of the ice creams to us and let us sample as many as we wanted. We each tried 3 or 4. I decided on the bourbon toffee caramel crunch in a glazed donut. I loved the warm/cold combo and the flavors were delicious. Brandon has an awesome staff, too. Everyone was very friendly. So excited we discovered Novel!
A must do in Charlotte for baked goods and desserts, love the French patries. Inside decor is an experience in itself very eclectic, very artsy and cool.

The new star is in town - Sprinkles is now open in Vegas on a remodeled street between what user to be Emperor's Palace and Flamingo. Open pretty late (midnight) - they serve cupcakes and ice-cream - or both in the shape of a cupcake sunday - yep! and you can get pie crust, melted marshmallows and crumbled red velvet on top as well. Too good to be true? I think there is more magic in this place than at any magic show! Oh, and for those after hours - there is a cupcake ATM (yep, like the one they have on Rodeo Drive in Bev Hills).

Bread is amazing, along with their cold deserts. If I could I'd buy every single one. We tried their drinks and were very delicious. Social distancing and masks were required. Great service. Will be coming back for their tiramisu.

I love the ham and cheese croissants, one of my favorite things anywhere. I tried a variety of macarons and the texture was spot on but the flavor was forgettable. The vanilla was the best one. I would try some other things here
Home grown Ice !! Have to swing here... Trending and always new trys! Swing by this place after a slice of pizza across the street from Grads Pizza

Dear Readers, It was a slightly breezy night during COVID-19. Our group stood in line outside Churn (at a safe distance) for less than 10 min as they were letting in one group at a time. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable about their products. More importantly, they were all wearing masks. The flavors were unique and intriguing but we settled on mint chip ice cream + mint chip cookie and goat cheese pistachio topped with strawberries (per the recommend of the masked associate). The flavors were fresh and authentic. We sat in the back patio with friends and enjoyed the night. Sincerely, Hillary and Andrew

I was in Vegas for six days and passed this bakery's kiosk multiple times a day as I went to and from my room. My plan was to pick some up before my flight home. On my departure day I was unexpectedly running late but MADE time to run by. Luckily no one was there at the time I arrived. So I asked the lady working the kiosk some questions about the croissants ,but she looked completely annoyed (first experience with bad service in Las Vegas) the I ordered two of the Oreo cookie sandwich things and asked her to box them because I would be taking them aboard my flight. When I got home that evening I excitedly opened the box to present the two Oreos to my two boys at home....and was horrified to see it was only 1.33 cookies!!! Ugh!

Salted caramel brownies - the way to anyone's good graces! This 24 hour bakery has savory and sweet French baked goods and you can't go wrong no matter what you order. Lattes even come with a fancy design. Quirky Parisian style - including a locks of love fence add to the fun here.

Uhm. Go. That's all I have to say. But seriously, the ice cream is amazing, the doughnut is amazing, then they roll it in your favorite cereal?! I don't think it matters the flavor you get, but I had the frosted sugar cookie, rolled in Reese puffs, between the most deliciously warm doughnut I've ever had. The ladies working are the sweetest. Just... go! You won't regret it.

While the ice cream is very good, I found the flavors to be uninspiring. Churn is good if your'e a classic-flavors kind of person, but I like to try new things and they didn't offer many beyond the traditional.

Honestly didn't like any of their soft serve flavors, I tried all three. I also didn't like the cornflake crunch, it was pretty salty and I was expecting sweet, pretty disappointing considering all the raving reviews I had been hearing from people.
Quite possibly the best doughnut, ice cream combo I've tried. I literally eat ice cream 3 days a week and there is none better in the valley.

I'm absolutely obsessed with this spot! My friend brought me here on my last day visiting her in Charlotte, and I'm so glad she did! The service is AMAZING! The staff is super friendly, helpful and kind. Answered all my questions and were so patient when I couldn't decide between all their incredible desserts. My friend and I shared the millionaire cookie (chocolate chip, caramel) and their signature oatmeal cream pie. Both were decadent and insanely good. The aesthetic of this place is so quirky and charming and their Golden Girls themed bathroom is EVERYTHING. I'm sad I don't live in Charlotte because I'd make The Batchmaker a weekly stop. Oh, and it's in a complex with it's own parking, so very convenient as well!

Well, damn it now that I know this plane exists - how am I supposed to control myself? My friend James posted about this place and their Graham Central ice cream. When I read about it I immediately thought - Graham cracker ice cream =yuck! But I saw they had Butter Toffee as one of the flavors.... I literally drove there the next morning, arriving right as they open. This place doesn't have any open to public doors... just walk up windows but the ice cream speaks for itself! Dani was the absolute best. You can tell she loves her job and is very helpful in choosing flavors. I asked about the Butter Toffee, but she informed they don't have it but recommended I try the Graham Canyon... Begrudgingly, I said OK.... But was already trying to figure out what other flavor I'd really order. HOLY MOLY Graham Canyon is the best ice cream I've every had. Graham cracker ice cream with delicious pieces of butter toffee... I'm seriouy in love. Highly recommend this place. Delicious ice cream & amazing customer service! Great job, Handel's!

I had been so used to just having Mitchell's all the time that this was such a pleasant delight and truly a Cleveland gem! I don't hear about it often, maybe because I live on the East Side and there are more locations on the West. I personally like their ice cream better than Mitchell's. It's not only more of an old school alnd nostalgic feeling environment, but I also feel it's slightly less sweet so the flavor isnt overpowering, making your cone easy and pleasant to manage. I got the honey graham flavor, of course I had to pick something with honey in it! I see this as my favorite ice cream shop in Cleveland and would definitely enjoy it as a special treat I would venture out for in the future.

I'm ashamed to say I get the same thing every time I go... an egg sandwich on a buttery soft and flakey croissant. The coffee is great and the atmosphere is even better. It's a great place to have quick business meeting or sit and focus to get work done.
Great choice for a snack when you are sick of casino smoke and 80's music. The service was only average though.

I know Charlotte is a restaurant/bakery wasteland (it's trying, but Jesus how long is it going to take?) and I know Amelies is actually the best around - I'll give 4 stars generally, 5 stars within context if Charlotte, open 24 hours and everything- but knowing you're the pinnacle here could you just try to staff enough people and bake enough for, you know, thurs fri sat nights? This isn't Tartine or Milk or the nyc cronut place at its zenith. Waits shouldn't be 45 mins all the time. That's a tactical staffing and product issue not a testament to genius. Still, the macarons are dope.

Wow, really? Bought one item from them, a ham and cheese croissant. First, I couldn't pay with my credit card since they weren't ready for such a strange form of payment. Then, they were supposedly heating my order up with their toaster oven press and when I got to my room it was as if they had taken it out of the refrigerator. Too bad I didn't notice it until I was already to my room. Obviously they didn't have their little heater plugged in or something. Plus, the woman at the counter who took my cash didn't even say thank you. The other lady who thought she was heating up my order did say thank you to me. That's the only reason they're getting two stars and not one. You provide lousy service; you get one or two stars from me on Yelp. Don't underestimate the power of reviews from real customers. It'll decrease your businesses if you stink. Thanks for reading.

Amazing coffee and pastries. Best chocolate croissant I've ever had in my life. Had to break keto to enjoy one! I did get an almond milk latte with an extra shot of espresso here that was out of this world, so good they beat out Starbucks. I'm glad we don't have one back home, or I would testing my willpower. Definitely a must if you're staying at the Venetian. They're only open mornings, which is a small disappointment.

Friendly and sweet service. We tried the pomegranate sorbet, the banana ice cream and the butter finger. It was good, wasnt spectacular. I sampled the coconut milk and strawberry and it just tasted funny. The service was sweeter than the ice cream. Minimal shade in the seating area. Napkins werent readily available, but I asked and she happily gave me them and even got them wet for me. Packaging is super cute and they give you whatever samples you ask for w a smile. Ice cream gets 3 stars, & for $4 a pop, that wasnt the business, but service gets 5.

If you love creme brulee, then run to Sprinkles before July 31 for their seasonal ice cream. This was the second time that ice had Sprinkles. I decided I was going to try one of their cupcakes as well as some ice cream this time. I was going to get their Cap n Crunch ice cream, until I saw that their seasonal flavor was creme brulee. I couldn't pass that up. I got the ice cream sundae where you pick out a cupcake and they cut it in half and put a scoop of ice cream in between. Delicious! I tried the vanilla cake with chocolate frosting and sprinkles. My boyfriend got the Cap n Crunch and coffee ice cream in a red velvet waffle cone. Everything was really good. Prices weren't too bad, considering they're on the strip. There's usually a long wait so be prepared for that. If you don't want to wait, you can always go around to the side and use their cupcake atm. That's a fun experience. It's a cute little place. The staff is nice and you can get samples of the ice cream. Everything is pretty sweet, but not in a bad way. You may want to get a drink to go with the cupcakes since they have a generous amount of icing on them.
Hands down the best ice cream in Vegas!!! Definitely suggest getting the 4 scoop sampler since there is tons of great flavors.
AMAZINGLY DELICIOUS! Such unique flavors that blew me away. Highly recommend! The workers are incredibly sweet and nice.

Pretty darn good. I have had this place on my bookmarks for awhile. I got a bit lost trying to find the place because I asked the concierge where BOUCHON was and I failed to mention the Bakery. I got sent to the restaurant. It's actually located near the Phantom of Opera show. Right behind the escalators. The french macarons are 3.50 a pop. Well worth it. It's not the best I've had but well worth it. I got the pistachio and chocolate flavors. I loved the pistachio ones. The chocolate ones were okay, very moist and brownie like. I also got the TKO cookie. Eh, didn't really like it. But the macarons are yummy! I need to try more flavors and get out of my comfort zone of just buying pistachio and chocolate.

The donuts here are unique and tasty, but I am not crazy for them. I like to take friends who visit Vegas here because they have donuts like the Creme brÃ»lÃ©e and pop tart donuts, which you can't just find anywhere, but you won't find a regular glazed here. If you like really sweet donuts, this place is for you. If you like simpler donuts, you might want to find a different place.

UPDATE: I visited Milk bar again and had a better experience. It still seems too expensive but I had the crack pie soft serve with corn flake crunchies this time and it was really yummy!! I also sampled the cereal milk soft serve. It was definitely different than last time. Tasted a lot better! ---- I was really excited to try this. I have watched the chef's table episode about this place and thought it looked so good. Unfortunately it just didn't live up to the hype. The cereal milk soft serve was too cereal-y if that makes sense. I think it should be more subtle. This was the biggest disappointment. I didn't like it very much. Besides that, I DID really like the crack pie and we went back for another the next day. I'm bummed their prices are so high. $6 for a small soft serve? $6.50 for one slice of crack pie? I bake and I know these ingredients are not pricey or extremely difficult to make. The prices need to come down.

Food fairly good for Italian bakery. My taste buds may be spoiled by the tastes from Boston, New York, and Italy though. Large variety of pastries and gelatos, also have some hot foods. Good amount of seating but bit loud to really have easy conversation. Service fast and efficient. They should wear hair nets though.
Super yummy! The staff is beyond nice. We are in for a short visit from Houston and so glad we found this place on yelp.

So many great flavor options there is no way to leave this place without wanting to come back again! Great ice cream, really patient and friendly staff! Hard decision but I went with a peanut butter chip, coconut milkshake! Absolutely delish!! Vote me in for the mayor of the republic

Can a bakery be sexy? You bet your sweet buttercream it can! I ventured in here one night after a dinner date with my husband, and I fell in love. The Victorian style furniture, the soft candlelight, the decadent desserts...It's all quite romantic. We split a lovely pear tart and a huuuuge slice of chocolate cake with curry chocolate frosting. My husband also had an espresso that he quite enjoyed. I love that they are open late so I can appease both my sweet tooth and my inner night owl. Everything was great and I absolutely don't mind paying $6 for a large slice of delicious gourmet cake. We'll be back for sure!
Great ice cream stop after dinner in the area. All of enjoyed our deserts. Select anything as you can't go wrong here as I have been a regular, especially while attending GCU

Fun, unique desserts if a bit pricey. One night after visiting Secret Pizza we tried the B'Day Milkquake ($10) - this was the better of the items we sampled. It's their Cereal Milk soft serve with birthday cake mixers stirred in. Easily feeds two. This alone will bring me back. On a later visit, we also tried single servings of their birthday cake soft serve ($6) and while good, seemed pricey for what you got and just didn't compare to the B'Day Milkquake. Seating can be a challenge late night (they don't have their own dedicated space) and if you need a sugar fix after visiting Secret Pizza, make sure you pay attention to closing times as Milk Bar closes first.

Yup, I got lost finding this place and I work at he spa, lol. So again, under the escalators, closest to the parking garage entrance, located where the Box Office is. In other words, once you hit the casino level, make a u turn. It's a small tiny shop...that I found funny because there was 9 workers that I counted...hmmm I'm giving them 4 stars because I got what I came for, monster size macaroons. The peanut butter jelly macaroon had me squirming in my chair with big bug eyes because I thought I bit into pure deliciousness. I'm starting to drool again. Not as many flavors as I thought, but I made the best choice, for me. I tried also the pistachio macaroon and a dark chocolate flaky pastry. None disappointed me, yum. It is a bit pricey, do hit them up when you got the sweet tooth.

It was very delicious, if it's your first time definitely get the cookie cup because the marshmallow goes very well with the macaron, the flavors I would suggest is the captain crunch and fruity pebbles. Those two flavors were delicious and true to their names. So if you don't like those cereals you can avoid those flavor too.

Sweet Republic. It's a place that has been reviewed by tons of different newspapers and magazines. I had to go for a taste. I arrived last evening at the Ice Cream joint. My GPS was slightly off, so for those of you looking to go in the future, just go North on 92nd from Shea. It will be right there. There were a few people in the establishment, but it took less than two minutes for me to be the next in line. Let me tell you, these desserts looked fantastic. The first thing that you see when you get in their ordering line is the Sorbet cabinet. Here is where you will find their delicious sorbets, ranging from exotic fruits to more simple flavors. I, however, was not here for the sorbet. I was here for their ice cream. One of the most amazing things about this place is the innovative flavors they have. Most people prefer to get the Sweet and Salty Caramel Flavor, but I was in the mood for something more adventurous. I ended up getting two scoops, mainly because of the price. One scoop is $2.95, and two scoops is $4.25... At least I can slightly justify paying for the two scoops, so that's what I chose. I chose two of their very fun flavors. The first was their Honey Blue Cheese. Now, for those of you who just got turned off when you saw the flavor, fear not. This ice cream does not taste like the blue cheese that goes on salads. This is a much more creamy, subtle flavor. It tastes like honey, with a little bit of salt. Extremely delicious. I will certainly be having this flavor when I return. The second flavor was, admittedly, much more of a challenge. I got a flavor called White Roses. Can you guess what it tastes like? That's right. Imagine, if you will, smelling a bouquet of roses. Now, imagine biting into it. That is exactly what you will get with this flavor. Now, I suggest that you try it, just to have the experience of tasting it, but I would be weary on purchasing a scoop of it. It's extremely strong, and I was unable to finish it. All in all, it was a great experience. Helpful staff, lots of flavors, and an experience unlike anything other. I fully recommend this ice cream joint to all dessert connoisseurs and sweet tooths alike!

I've been here several times and I've enjoyed some of their desserts, especially the oatmeal cookies! They're very friendly and the service is great! The dessert are very hearty which is nice considering most places serve very tiny portions when it comes to dessert. I am however not pleased with their macaroons as they all taste the same and have a stale taste to them. The Tiramisu is delicious! As are most of their cakes! They have their own small parking area so you can run in and out whenever you have a sweet craving!
