Such good ice cream. Such good donuts. Such nice people. I think the rest of reviews speak the praises already so I'll keep it brief!

It's like I went into The Secret Garden and discovered beautiful, tasty and decadent delights that were made just for my princess palate! This bakery and cafe is BEAUTIFUL! When you enter you're met with a lovely Shabby Chic decor and a comfortable, but lovely, cafe to sit and relax and think pretty thoughts. Then you go further in and the lovely bakery items behind glass tempt with the sheer prettiness of it all. The cakes, and cupcakes and pastries were absolutely amazing! I had a mini cake that was a Sage cake with Prickly Pear Agave and Fresh Cream. Impressive, right?!!! The taste was beyond this world. The cake was light and moist, the frosting was also light and not too sweet. Impressive. I paired it with a Peach Mint ice tea and sat down on the lovely antique sofa, browsed through table books they supplied and was in my own world of Cafe and Bakery decadence and I don't know if it can be surpassed! I really urge anyone reading this to take a ride to Butterwood Cake Consortium in Lawrenceville on Butler St. and you can thank me later!!!
If you have a sweet tooth and are looking for a huge selection of delicious desserts, definately go check out this unique bakery!!!

Took MLB to the airport and figured I could use a meal before heading home and this was almost nearly on the way... Not much space between the doors and the pastry case which is great planning in my book; way convenient to get an orange macaron while deciding on snacks. According to legend this is ground zero, the home of the provencal trailer park motif seen and loved by all. Half a Croque Monsieur plus tomato fennel soup and icy water sounded about right. Usually not a fan of the red soup but it's got fennel...! which fixed everything up nicely thank you very much. Hot vermilion soup abounding with flavor, texture, and substance - not the feeble stuff of childhood. My sandwich was superb! a healthy smear of spicy dijon zip complementing the subtle dignity of gruyere on thin sliced hams nestled in a flakey buttery toasted croissant. Yea for a ham sammich!

Handel's Ice Cream is AMAZING!!!! It has to be some of the best ice cream I've ever had!!! Their customer service is great, and they have so many selections of ice cream flavors!!! I highly recommend Handel's to anyone and everyone wanting amazing ice cream!!!

I grew up eating Handel's in Youngstown, OH and tonight was just like being home on a summer night! The Black Cherry and Chocolate Pecan haven't changed from my childhood. The boyfriend had cake batter and he said it was too sweet & he has a HUGE sweet tooth. The only down side is that there was no napkins outside to clean up the ice cream drips. What I don't think people understand who have left 2 or less stars. Where Handel's was started it was about socializing with the neighborhood. You sat on the curb or leaned on cars trying to finish your ice cream before it ran down your arm. So don't worry about the fact there is no indoor seat and instead start a conversation with the person next to you.

This place is just the cutest and I don't know how anyone wouldn't love it! I didn't get to stay when I went in yesterday, unfortunately, but I was able to snag a piece of their blueberry elderflower cake as I tagged along with a friend who was picking up a birthday cake for her boyfriend. I actually saved half of it for later which was a great idea, since the piece was rather large AND it was a lovely treat to look forward to. Amazing flavor and very moist cake. The icing is ...wowee. This would be a great place for some afternoon tea and dessert or a date night! Great music, lovely little patio, and awesome antique furnishings. I can't wait to try out some more delightful treats! The service was also very friendly.

Not a big place but doesn't need to be. The flavors are artisan and creative. Doesn't have the creamy texture of normal ice cream, but still tastes great. Just a few of the memorable flavors my friends and I have had: lucky charms, thai iced tea, black sesame, cinnamon toast, peach sorbet...All wonderful. Flavors vary all the time. Staff friendly. Lines can get like traffic though because everyone wants to taste everything.
Amazing selection of ice cream. Their hurricanes and sundaes have all been delicious. $2 Tuesdays for a scoop is great to try their flavors.

These donuts are like crack! We loved the creme brÃ»lÃ©e donut. It's the best by far. It wasn't to sweet. The birthday cake donut was TO SWEET. The stuffed big papa- was tasty, but big enough to feed a family of 4. The strawberry and cream tasty like a strawberry ice cream bar.

We have ordered several cakes from here. I will tell you each one is delicious. We did have some issues with our last order and the greatest thing about Chris is her customer service. She personally responds to each and every email and we emailed back-and-forth a few times and I told her how much my family loves her cakes and it is a tradition in our home to get birthday cakes from her and when I told her how we felt about the last cake she immediately fixed it. Now don't get me wrong the cake was delicious the cookie dough was phenomenal there was just a couple of issues and she fixed it... I love this place I recommend this place to everyone I think Chris and her staff are the absolute best and I wouldn't go anywhere else for my cakes.

When I first got to Chambana freshman year, I hit up my alumni uncle and aunt for advice. Of all the things they told me, all I remember now is them saying to go to Jarling's. It all made sense after the first time I went. Jarling's (or C-Cup as my friends and I call it) is a place to take anyone visiting you on campus, or any freshman who wants to go to Cold Stone. The snowstorms (think DQ's Blizzards) are fantastic, but I always go for 2 dips of either chocolate/lemon or chocolate/orange (recommended to me by an employee). Just remember that regardless of what you get, eat it FAST...or else you'll have a cup of delicious flavored milk. The biggest shame is that they're not open year round, but I always set my goal to go there as soon as they opened for the season, carrying as many clueless Cold Stone aficionados as possible with me.

How have I never reviewed Amelie's? The salted caramel brownie is one of the best things in Charlotte. I was so sad when I found out that I was gluten intolerant...and then they started making a GF salted caramel brownie! I thought they must have given me the wrong one, because I could not tell the difference. The Amelie's in NODA stays busy, but I have never had to wait too long at the Pineville-Matthews location.

I really wanted to like this place since I'm a big fan of his show. I got a lobster tail, cannoli and eclair was about $17 ish. Ordering process was a bit different than some bakeries. The Lobster tail was ok kind of tasted stale but the filling was good. Eclair and cannoli both tasted stale with no flavor, both the fillings were like tooth paste and dry like it had too much corn starch instead of a custard taste. I'm still a fan just probably came on Very bad day of baked goods.

To be honest, I have had wayyyyyy better donuts. Although the donuts here are cute, they are also on the dry side. Wish I had a picture, but I'll my pics got deleted on my old phone. If you decide to get a donut here, I would say the maple bacon is my favorite.

First time going to Jack Frost. The counter lady was very nice and helpful. This was early in the morning and she was still adding fresh warm donuts to the display case as I was trying to decide which ones I wanted to try. No stuffed cream/jelly/custard here everything is on the top of the donut l

I wasn't sure what to expect honestly, but I was in for a great surprise!! I ordered an upside down milk tea with custard. It was so delicious. We also ordered taiyaki with custard, cheese, and Nutella. The cheese was by far the winner!! I'd say it's like a fish shaped grilled cheese. I can't even rave enough about it. It was so simple but so good. I would definitely recommend this place. The stage is friendly. The place is bright and clean. Not a lot of seating so definitely good for take out.

Rainbow buttermilk frozen yogurt: super tart, strong sour flavors, pretty overbearing had to fight it with my tastebuds to eat it all, wouldn't recommend if you like sweeter flavors Rocket pop: less sour still was wondering how theyd get the sorbet creamy but I don't think it played out well. wouldn't really recommend it Wild berry lavender: finally something calming and relaxing to the younger much needed was the best in the trio we got and we saved it for last so we could end the night in a happy note instead of sour haha Gooey butter cake: always gonna be my favorite can't go wrong w a sweet cakes ice cream especially with the salty cones Almond brittle: little too sweet for me but a nice second if gooey butter cake isn't available but you want the same vibe The staff is nice and the ice cream is smooth
I will pay just for the smell alone again. Anyhoo the staff was very patient while we slobbered over every flavor and our checkout was fast and easy

Absolutely fantastic. Even if everything behind the glass does not appeal to you, it is all done with care and professionalism. Susan Detering is not only highly qualified in technique across different regions of the country, pressure systems, how they affect dough, what types of dough need more or less kneading, etc...but she is a genuinely nice person who is heavily invested in her community and product. I had the ham and gruyere croissant and bought a pain au chocolate for later. Great quality and flavor. Do yourself a favor and go early while everything is warm!

I tried their salted caramel French soda and the spinach leek soup. Both were delicious and the soup was exactly what you would expect: creamy, and comforting. I'm doing a week without gluten and went there to see what options they had ( I knew they would) as far as treats go. I got their coconut macaroons and they were so yum! A little too sweet for me but that's fine because I was satisfied with just one. Amelie's is off the chain.

I have been dying to come here and finally made it! I had the cereal milk soft serve with cornflake crunch, my cousin had the bday soft serve with rainbow sprinkles and hot fudge, and my husband had a strawberry corn milkquake. The cornflakes on mine were so tasty; they were heavy and slightly salty which I liked. The cereal milk soft serve could have been sweeter... I kinda wished I had gotten the crack pie soft serve. The bday soft serve was absolutely amazing and the milkquake was great as well... they tossed an entire corn cookie in there! I also grabbed one of the cookies with chocolate chips, marshmallow, cornflakes, and oats... it was just okay, but I still enjoyed it. My mom and husband weren't very impressed. The only thing that was a bit disappointing was the price of the shakes; my husband's was $10 and was an average size. However, I do not mind paying that much for a novelty treat. The cookies were a steal at $3 IMO!

Disclaimer: I am a huge macaron fan. Now that that is out of the air, I LOVE their macarons! These are probably the best macarons I've tasted so far. The only other places I've had them are Vanilla Bakeshop in Santa Monica and Europane in Pasadena. I'm going off on a quest to search for macarons better than these in LA. Bring it! I bought the set of flavors here, and it was totally worth it to try all the flavors! Now I know which ones are my favorite...and they have to be Raspberry, Vanilla Bean, and Coffee. I think these flavors are more fragrant and they coffee has a deep earthy coffee taste to it, just how a coffee flavor should be. The lemon and orange were a little too sweet for me, and I just somehow don't like the citrus flavored macarons as much. And I never had a thing for chocolate flavored anything, so take my opinions with my preferences in mind. The shells are very delicate, as they crack quite easily, but the crunch had just enough soft chew too, and on top of the cream or ganache inside, it was heavenly! I also tried the carrot cake cookie and it was okay. I think the carrot cake could have been more moist. The cream cheese filling was good though. =) There was also a really cute sweets stand next to this stand. Oh, and Bouchon Bakery is not a store. It's literally like a little stand! Downstairs by the casinos and the Phantom of the Opera Theater is where you'll find it. =) And make sure you get there before they close if you want to buy anything. My mom was saying we should go there right before our POTO show started for some dessert after dinner, but I thought that was a huge mistake and made us go in the afternoon before we went outlet shopping and dinner. THANK GOD. It was closed when we came back to watch our show. [Phantom of the Opera was amazing too! But that's beside the point... :)] If you're a macaron fan, definitely try theirs. Overpriced, but you'll forget about that once you try it. =D

Okay I am Dripps regular now and I have to go with 5 stars. Be it their ice cream or tea they are incredible. Not only do they boast of Instagram worthy pics but they are unbeatable in the taste wise too. They are sisters from Pokitrition and must say they know what works. Eat at Pokitrition and get 20% off at dripps. I have tried their thunder, Oreo, minions icecreams and each one is different from the other and totally good. Their rose milk latte is my fav, the Flavors are so good and it's definitely for the rose lovers. Overall a must place, though their price range is over the top, it's definitely worth it.

Had my favorite, a scoop of Key Lime ice cream, complete with graham crumbles. It's delicious and fresh. Everyone ordered outside. (Cones are not available right now.) The order comes out in a bag with your scoops in cup containers. Very efficient and friendly. In Ohio City.

I normally try to avoid dairy, but after eating across the street at Federal Pizza (and having tried Churn at Devoured a few weeks ago), I dragged my husband into this quaint little ice cream parlor. By quaint, I mean small, but it is also full to the brim with every sweet piece of candy my childhood nostalgia could remember. While I managed to restrain myself from emptying my bank account on Necco wafers, plastic army men, caramels, rice krispie treats, and local art, I was there for ice cream, and that's exactly what I got. It was a tough choice between a strawberry shortcake sundae and a salted caramel freezie, but in the end I was directed towards the strawberry sundae. It was super creamy, the strawberries were fresh, the whole thing was really flavorful, and there was enough to share (but who does that? Get your own ice cream!), however - and this is my ONLY complaint - I was a little disappointed that the shortcake part of the strawberry shortcake sundae was actually shortbread cookies...not a soft fluffy piece of cake. Alas, my pain didn't last for long thanks to the wonderful ambiance and delicious noms, and I will definitely return when I find myself up in this area again!

Completely a fan of this place!!! Everyone is complaining about the wait but we got in and out in less than 10 minutes and we went on a wednesday afternoon!!! For sure worth the wait! The lobster tails are mind blowing!! Cannolis delicious and the cupcakes YUM!!! I would for sure go back and I had been waiting awhile to try some of the cake boss goodies and it turned out to be everything I expected and more! Stop with the bad reviews about the wait because on the show there is always a wait as well!!!

Had the mint chocolate chip today, very fresh tasting mint, I would have preferred a little more chocolate. I still prefer the Salty Carmel, and have discovered that they sell their ice cream at Whole Foods so I can get some back home ;)

Items Selected: Sausage and Pepperoni Pizza Amaretto Lobster Tail Sfogliatelle Cannoli Lemon Biscotti, Slivered Almond Cookie, Pignoli, Nut Horn, Turtle Cookie, Helen's Date Nut Bar, Raspberry Thumbprint Located at 12101 Mayfield Road, just a few hundred yards from Corbo's and the rest of Cleveland's Little Italy, Presti's Bakery has long been a favorite of neighbors, tourists and Case Western Reserve University students, the family-run space originally founded in 1903 most certainly having withstood tough times, yet still doing great business. Sizable in its selections as well as its seating options, a lack of the latter admittedly a problem at its nearby competitor, entry to Presti's sees diners confronted by nearly one hundred selections both sweet and savory, everything from Pizza and Pasta served as early as 6am with Pastries rolling out all day to replete diminishing favorites. Using an old-school ticketing system, many diners unaware and thus delayed in placing their order at the counter as they are redirected to the red device on a poll, it was after a bit of perusal that most composed an order by way of ever-patient servers, a total of eleven pieces comprised mostly of cookies delivered in boxes and paper trays at the end of a $16 tip and tax inclusive assortment. Approaching 10:30am, essentially lunch hour taking the day's plan as a whole, dining began with a flimsy slice of square Pizza that strongly resembled something from a Highschool cafeteria, even after rewarming, all but a few bites discarded before progressing quickly to the pre-filled Cannoli, the Mascarpone filling smooth and sweet, but the shell already besieged by sogginess. Happy to again see Sfogliatelle, small bits of Fruit giving this iteration a leg up on Corbo's despite a shell that was not quite as springy and shattering, best bites of the meal were found in the lightly Almond scented Lobster Tail piped full of Cream filling, the Date Bar and Pine Nut Pignoli also highly praiseworthy while the Nut Horn and Slivered Almond Cookie each begged for something more than water to combat a texture that was more dry and stale than nutty and crumbly.

Great breakfast! Got a butter croissant and a chocolate croissant for my boyfriend. Both were flaky and soft. The beignets were AMAZING. We split a chocolate and a berry, and both were great. Fluffy, fresh, taaaasty. The chocolate was quite heavy, so maybe better as an afternoon snack than a breakfast, but great with a cup of coffee. I wanted to go back the next day and try the bread pudding, but didn't make it. I will definitelly be trying the Napa one next time I am there since it's closer to me than Vegas.
Quick service great section of doughnuts. Was worth the short drive to find. Parking is cheap across the street from the shop. 1.00 per hour
Long lines... it's not even a pleasant experience... get in and get out...! For a donut...??? No thanks..!

Ambiance There are two different stores in one. One area is strictly for cupcakes. The other area is strictly for ice cream. There is a small amount of seating inside in the cupcake part of the store. The ice cream area does not have any seating. However, there are tables outside where one can sit and eat when available. In addition, there is a 24 hour ATM cupcake dispenser outside. Pretty cool item to have if one wants cupcakes. Food Living in the Bay Area, the ice cream is not available in the Palo Alto store. Their sundae where the cupcake and ice cream go together is amazing. Their cupcakes are always super moist and feel like they are freshly baked. Topping that with some good ice cream makes it that much better. Service This place gets pretty packed for ice cream. It can feel slow at times due to the fact that there can be a lot of people in line. Overall, the staff is friendly and the service is good once we are at the front.
We almost overlooked this due to location, but so glad we didnt!! great ice cream and wonderful customer service!!! Plan to come back when in the area again!!

I love ice cream places that serve unique flavors. This was it. And they serve them in Chinese take-out cartons with a fortune cookie! They had flavors like Trix, banana pudding, lucky charms, etc. but their flavors are rotating so you might not see the same that I did! Go here. There are tables and chairs outside.

This was our first visit. We had some pastries and ' cafe capuchoin' . They were pretty decent. Nice place to catch up with freinds. There were many people with their laptops, kinda like starbucks environment. It is decorated with vintage stuff. Will definitely comeback!

I've loved the show so I visited the last two times I was in Vegas. The service is always great! The store is clean and decorated in a bright, warm manner. I had cannoli last time. It was fabulous. This time, my friend enjoyed a rainbow slice and I enjoyed this delectable display of sweetness. I was only able to eat half. It was topped with apple pie, with the pumpkin pie in the middle and pecan pie as base. Then, there are white cake slices in between. It's heaven in dessert form. The pumpkin was creamy perfection. The pecan pie was excellent. And the apple pie just added the extra touch of sweetness! Of course, the white cake was fantastic. You must stop in when you're in Vegas!

5 stars is for cupcakes and ice cream only.... Red velvet cupcake = Yummy and Pecan ice cream = Yummy.... soo delicious! Service, I'd give 3.5 stars--Have to agree with another reviewer, the outside tables are dirty... Also in the evening I saw a super long line... I would never wait more than 5 mins for this place however, I went around lunch time... no line... enjoyed my snacks and enjoyed watching customers' reactions to the cupcake ATM... Oh, there's an idea to skip the line if you just want a cupcake.. use the ATM! Otherwise, come back when the line's not too long if you can and try the ice cream! delicious.

They have the BEST macaroons ever! Pistachio is my all time favorite! Not too sweet, soft, a little chewy, and perfect every time! I can't wait to go back in January and try their others flavors! I'm buying a bunch and taking them home :)
my vietnamese coffee was DELISH but my niece's strawberry was PERFECT. parking (on saturday night) was terrible so be prepared to walk a little from the surrounding neighborhood.

The donuts itself are phenomenal. The fancy ones look great, but personally, I think it takes away from the donut itself. Such as the s'mores, it looks really appealing but the flavor of s'mores isn't there. One would think they would mix marshmallow fluff and graham cracker crumbs with the whipped topping.... false assumption. I have the same issue with the strawberry cream, if I were blind I would not know it had "strawberries" in it. Hands down, I'd go back for the simple and classic donuts. As far as I know, best donut shop around!

Cool vibe, good coffees and the macaroons are amazing, as are the caramel brownies. However, do NOT buy the cake if you are actually looking for a delicious cake. I ordered the strawberry cream cake which sounds and looks amazing - truly a piece of art, but it's surely not meant to actually be eaten. It's 90% fondant / stiff pastry cream stuff, with zero taste but LOTS of fat. Little channels were dug out and the smallest amount of cake possible was inserted. On top, another stiff greasy fondant pile /swirl topped it off. The ONLY thing strawberry about this 'cake' was a single strawberry, dipped in some glossy gelatinous substance, placed on top, way out of reach of the cake. And it was ~$6.

Yet another disappointment on my yelp list for this winter break. I don't know if it was because I came at 9PM for macarons but they were not the best as my friend had promised. I did the buy 5 get 1 free deal for the large ones (the smaller ones would've only cost a dollar less which made me ??? oh well) and got eggnog, salted caramel, pistachio, chocolate, and raspberry. Out of all the flavors, salted caramel was definitely the best, then pistachio, chocolate, raspberry, and eggnog. All of the macarons were too crunchy for my liking. The shells were slightly dried out and didn't have the chewiness I like biting into. And the flavors themselves weren't that vibrant. I didn't feel like I got the pure taste of each flavor in the macarons sadly. Honestly such a let down but what saved the trip to Bouchon for me was the chocolate almond croissant. I never thought I could like a croissant so much, but this one hit the spot. Even though it took me a full 5 days to finish the croissant, I thoroughly enjoyed every chocolatey bite and correct me if I'm wrong but I think there was also a spread of coconut in between the flakey buttery layers. The croissant didn't go stale and tasted a million times better lightly toasted in the convection oven. So definitely come here for the chocolate almond croissant. Maybe swing by earlier in the day for fresher macarons? But my past macaron experiences have been much better than Bouchon (they tasted way better and lasted a lot longer) so take caution before you shell out about $3 a cookie.

I was looking to try some boba in the area, and I thought that I would stop by here. The store is clean and the workers are super friendly + knowledgeable! I had a sample of the strawberry jasmine tea, which was really delicious but way too sweet for me. I ordered a jasmine milk tea with boba at a level of 25% sugar. I was disappointed that they didn't offer 0% sugar, but I learned that the drinks were premade so they're unable to adjust the sweetness level below a certain threshold for certain drinks (I think the coffee drinks are the only ones that can be adjusted down to 0% sugar). Presumably because the milk tea was premade, my drink came out really fast! My drink was okay, I'm just not a fan of sugar in my tea, which is why I docked my review to 3 stars. I would rather go to another shop for boba, but I would come back to try the ice cream!

Was in Sloans about a week ago. Laura was very patient, she talked to me about every single ice cream, spoke about the fudge like it was her passion. She knows her stuff and has a lot of positive energy. Her attitude was so amazing I wanted to let her manager know, I asked Laura if she could get her manager, and when she went to check if she was there she said her manager said that "she was not clocked in and busy." As a former business owner/manager I see that as a lack in work ethic on the managers end. I felt a little more than disappointed when the manager refused to talk to me about a great employee. However, I will not give this post less than 5 stars because of the managers unwillingness to talk to a customer. Laura was a great help, I don't really use yelp, but figured she deserves the recognition!

The Butterwood Bake ambiance was soothing and cute. No strong lights makes it sort of romantic too. That is not why I ended up there. The reason was the cakes and they delivered - peach custard was almost naughty, so creamy and delicious. The pear cake was a pleasant surprise - I did not expect a burst of flavor that I got. I felt in love with it and I wanted the feeling to last longer but, all I got now is a nice memory so I will have to go back to get more of the same. A confirm a few previous reviews saying that "the girl at counter" was nice.
Amazing ice cream and the waffle cones are the best! The ice cream was so creamy and delicious.

Churn offers plenty of menu options that all sound amazing. All the ice cream samples I tried were delicious but the flavors didn't particularly stand out to me the day I went. I ordered a cookie and ice cream sandwich and it was a bit much, I should've just ordered a single scoop, which was still huge. A bit pricey but I think it's worth splurging for some delicious ice cream with huge portions, maybe worth sharing with someone else though.

Decided to try them again! Well I didn't think it could get much worse but it definitely did. Decided to get some French macaroons, a cupcake, and a croissant. The macaroon was the worst texture. You can tell they have no clue what they are doing when it comes to them. The cupcake was dry and crumbly with little to no flavor. My croissant was BURNT! Terrible experience and customer service. Will not be back.

I love sugar. I love butter. I don't like when sugar and butter are overused in my desserts. The crack pie, crack pie soft serve, birthday truffles, and compost cookie had too much of the above, which was really disappointing. I threw away those desserts after 2 bites. The cereal milk soft serve with cornflakes was delicious though! Surprised by the comments about overly salty corn flakes. I also REALLY enjoyed the blueberry cream cookie. The corn cookie was yum too. I'll be back for the cereal milk soft serve and blueberry cream cookies!

It's ok if you like soft serve and enormous amounts of it. I am not a huge soft serve fan and I find the flavour of Paige's very bland. So I t tastes like cold sweet and that's about it. The atmosphere is great and it's worth a trip come here once just for that. I don't think it is worth a second trip though.

I was there at the grand opening at 9. got there around 8:00am and was one of the first 25 people . They had UNLV cheerleaders to cheer and had a great opening. The bread was nice and fresh. Respect for the managers to have crowd control and not let it look like a Hong Kong protest inside with people grabbing bread off the trays before they hit the shelf. They handled that pretty well. I got everything I could on my tray. two mugs and the yardstick for the first 100 customers. The above review is 5 stars worthy for the morning. the reason why I put a one star is for people who are curious and for the managers to look at how they did cause they care about the business and need customer feedback. I went back there at night because I gave most of the bread pastries away to my coworkers since we had a birthday celebration. I did not have a chance to try the matcha custard bread, milk pudding bun, the croquette bun. etc. I went back hoping there was still more at night. instead it was mostly subpar items like muffins and the egg tarts. None of the premium items I saw in the morning or mentioned above or the ones you see in the morning review posts. It was just pumping out the same bread and put it in three different places. I saw the berry tart like in three different shelves and muffins that anyone can go get at Starbucks. It was just selling bread at that point for profit since there was a demand there, but also because they probably ran out of ingredients for the other items. Here is the reason where they screwed up. Since the morning. it was pretty chaotic with all the excitement. I forgot to ask if the free yardstick was refillable or not. I heard the regional divisional manager say this is the first of its kind for Las Vegas since it has Vegas themes on the free items. I could not hear if he said "free" refills or " no refills for the yardstick. I went back at night to ask and clarify. I asked three employees and they did not know. Till I asked the lady at the drink section kindly if it was free refill or not. The cashier next to her heard me and said in an angry tone. NO REFILL. then mumbled to her coworker " they brought it up in the meeting." the one I asked kindly went to her manager and asked and she came back and told me no without yelling No REFILL like the other cashier did. I accepted it since i wasnt sure due to all the noise in the morning. The one star is for the rude cashier at the front. All it takes is one thing to ruin the whole experience. the customers are the driving force for the business, but if they have cashiers not able to handle the customers, then people reading should be aware to expect it. Bread was perfect, grand opening was perfect. Ask a question and get an angry response from another employee and I am willing to spend the time to write this one star review. Do yourself a favor. Dont go there at night and grab the leftover inventory. Wait till the hype goes down and they train their employees to be nice and courteous to the customers.

Oh Jeni's ice cream I love you so, founded in Columbus, Ohio and several locations across the country. The Charlotte location is in the hip South end neighborhood which is filled with variety of restaurants, shops, Apt's & condos. This is one of the smallest Jeni's I've visited & they have Jeni's standards plus a few limited edition flavors. My Dad enjoyed the summer favorite Strawberry Buttermilk, my Mom milkiest chocolate & me went for a double of Texas Sheet Cake and Darkest Chocolate. Jeni's Ice Cream is always a wonderful treat during my travels don't miss it!

Ok, I love this place. I've been in several times pre-covid and ordered pickup a few times mid-covid (not *personally* mid-covid, I wouldn't do that!) and I have to say, they are ON IT! They've been great with safety protocols and pick up options. And there are soooooo many amazing baked goods to chose from. I always go a little overboard and end up getting enough for like at least 8 people but...that's a good thing, right? My coworkers aren't mad about it. My top two go-tos are probably the salted brownie and the ham and gruyere croissant but literally everything is sublime. They also have great coffee! And the service has always been super friendly and helpful. Some of the best customer service I've ever received anywhere. Overall: 12/10 Seriously, go see what I'm spazzing out about. You'll love it.
Why are you wasting time reading these reviews? Just come already and order whatever catches your eye...it will be amazing!

This place will always be famous, it sucks they aren't open all year around. They should have it open with limited staff. Overall, this is an iconic custard place in Champaign and although I'm not huge on custard, it's still very good.

Hold the phone! How have I not known about Sweet Republic until now?! This place is top notch when it comes to sweet treats! I pretty much sampled every ice cream when I dropped by here and every flavor was unique! I mean c'mon... Basil-lime? Jalapeno-avocado? Seriously, they were all delicious and I will be back to try more (I actually can't wait)!

The best in the Burg. Peanut butter is my favorite, but Amaretto is a close second. Amaretto taste like maraschino cherry meets almond torte! Peanut butter is made with the real stuff! So many options for you to ponder over while you wait in-line. You may change your mind a few times while you wait!

4.5 to be precise. It's good to know that this place pays true respect to its own state's title of "Dairyland"!! Nestled right in the heart of downtown, it's a perfect spot for everyone be it college or corporate! The ice cream options are quite the handful and extremely fun as they mostly stay away from the bog standard usual's (Vanilla, Chocolate etc). Take your sweet time to read the descriptionS carefully coz many of them are delightful concoctions with interesting flavor twists! I tried their Strawberry Cheesecake and Zanzibar and man o man both rocked! It was soo nice to have a "cheesecake" ice cream with LOTS of cheesecake in it! The strawberry flavor was nice and not overly sweet and complimented the cheesecake bites. The Zanzibar was a medley of chocolate flavors and the result was this very rich but not dense chocolate taste with a hint of brownie after taste to it. Texture of both ice cream was pleasantly gooey which I much rather prefer than hard or custardy Ala yogurt. My only critique I'd say would be the presence of icy crystals in both the ice creams. They weren't that many but do mar the otherwise exquisite experience. All in all, please do give this place a try if you, like me, have an ENORMOUS sweet tooth!!!

BEST ICE CREAM in Cleveland! I haven't had a single bad experience with their ice cream. They rotate their selection, and I've had the good fortune of trying most of the flavors they offer. My favorite: black sesame -- very good black sesame flavor! Their dark chocolate ice cream is the best chocolate ice cream I've ever had. I also enjoyed their Thai tea ice cream and avocado ice cream! Even their durian flavor ice cream was amazing! Every once in a while, they offer ramen, which is an added bonus! Think about it - RAMEN & ICE CREAM! How awesome is that?! The owners are some of the coolest people you'll encounter here in Cleveland! They greet you and offer samples of everything! They're also very responsive to Facebook messages to their business page. I love this place and their ice cream is seriously addicting! :D
Creamy and delicious. Sometimes there is a great water park nearby. Highly recommend for families.

Seriously? Am I really seeing this? I have reached PMS nirvana. This Francophile has found sweet gastronomic heaven. My dear friend/fellow food/shoe/book junkie and I popped our Amelie's cherry(tart) late on Friday night and were pleasantly surprised by the high energy, efficiency of the staff (they kept that line mooooving!), funky decor and sinful eye candy. We had ourselves a little sampling and here's the good, the bad and the ugly: Good: Creme Puffs filled with rich, sweet, thick custard. No wimpy whipped cream here. My toes curled. The Salted Caramel Brownie. If I'd been w/anyone other than her, they would've been gotten stabbed in the hand w/my fork had they tried to sample this gooey confection. There is close to 1/4 inch of caramel atop this chewey brownie and the addition of a pinch of salt saves this from being too sweet. The Tea Cakes are very moist. The raspberry has a stronger flavor than the lemon. The line moves quickly. The bad: Okay, it really wasn't bad, but my hubby and I tried the Petit Gateau and, while the gnache was rich and smooth (just how I like my men, lol) the cake was actually pretty dry. The line moves so fast, you may not have a chance to see all the goodies. I like to weigh my options; calories are precious and I can't waste'em on so-so snacks. Lotsa empty trays. No matter how fast they work, they can't keep up w/demand so it seems like we may have missed some good options. The Ugly: The near cat-fight over the last eclairs and the creepy mannequin that literally leans over your shoulder as you wait in line. I'm a Leo, I like my space and crazy as it sounds, that thing was giving me the heebies. Overall, an instant favorite and a reason to haul our tushies down to Charlotte more often.

Wow. There's a reason this guy is the Cake Boss. My girlfriend and me went to Carlo's Bake Shop after attending a show and was surprised to see that the line was minimal, probably because of how late it was. Typically there a long line out the door of folks waiting to experience fine baked good. I had the California Cheesecake which was one of the best cheesecakes I have ever had. My girlfriend stocked up on snacks for the remainder of the trip and purchased a strawberry cheesecake, a couple different types of cupcakes and some amazing cookies! Everything was full of flavor, aesthetically pleasing, fairly priced for Vegas, and the customer service was top notch. I will be making a return journey for my more cheesecake when I return to Vegas!

Old school custard. You can't live here without trying it. In grad school, I lived a couple of blocks away, and I only went here a couple of times. What was I thinking? Skip your forgettable entrees and come here instead. Delicious!

I've come to the conclusion that I'm not a huge macaroon person but I had to check out Bouchon because of the rave reviews on Yelp and since I had time to kill... I was hoping to try one of their carrot cake cookies but unfortunately they were out by 2pm :( Not to worry, they had plenty of their famous macaroons beautifully lined up. I was buying them for me and my sister and her friend so I decided not to get any crazy flavors they may not like. I got a vanilla for myself, one coffee, and one chocolate. They were HUGE. yelp.com/user_local_phot¦ Holy moly. I had more fun taking the picture than eating it I think. No, but they were good. The cookies had a crunch to them while still keeping an airy texture to them. The filling wasn't overly sweet and each had their own distinct flavor. They weren't cheap, I think $3.50 ish for one but heyyy these are some seriously awesome macaroons for the macaroon enthusiasts so check em out. You won't be disappointed! YELP 365: 175/365

Stopped into Churn when we saw a carrot cake ice cream that they posted about. Just had to have it and not disappointed. Such a cute place with friendly service. This is only available for the month of April, but they bring in other seasonal flavors along with a regular menu of ice cream. Lots of retro candy too!

I have been chasing their s'mores cookies, brownies and cakes for what seem to be an eternity. But finally I got some. It's not what I wanted but it's something. So I got the s'mores cake, and a tres Leche cake. My friend loves the tres Leche. And I like the s'mores. It's very moist and heavenly. I can't say their customer service was 5 stars. They were very short wirh their answers both times. So I didn't try to push it or overly chatty. First time. It was packed in there. 2nd time. It was the first Wednesday at they opened in the evening. And it seem like there were a private event going on at the same time.. So I felt a bit rushed. All in all. I would love to come back and get the s'mores cookies, and more cakes

Since the reviews were good and we were craving a banana split, we drove from 20 minutes away to enjoy some good desert. We arrived at 9:30, which seems like plenty of time to order and eat before the 10pm closing time. We waited for 20 minutes for them to make the split. After having served the 2 groups that had ordered after us, we started to watch the 3 workers behind the counter to see if they were making our split. This is when we noticed they were standing there chatting (not working) about their social lives. Not a huge deal to be served after but when they finally made our split, what they presented us with was a Banana Split in 4 different containers for us to take with us. WHAT???? When I inquired why it was package to go, I was informed that since they close at 10 and dont get paid to stay after. Keep in mind it was still 9:50. Since, we are in a hotel on vacation, I could not drive the 20 minutes back and eat it out of 4 containers in my room. I expressed that they should have told us when we ordering, it would be "To Go" so we could have decided if we wanted to continue with our order. NOT GOOD CUSTOMER SERVICE at all.... I am so sorry that, I, the customer, inconvienced them. Proceed with caution after 9:30!!!!

I get to Vegas about once each year and we always stay downtown. I had seen Donut Bar on Instagram one day when I was getting excited about my trip. I decided to follow them for a while, and after dreaming about their donuts for months, we mad it in. This place does not disappoint! The service was helpful and friendly. Come hungry. The donuts are massive! My hubby got the CrÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e, a yeast donut and I had a cake donut called, a buttermilk it was covered with some type of chocolate ganache. My husband decided to order. Nitro cold brew coffee. Everything was delicious! It's not cheap food at all but, everything was so well made and delicious it's worth the expense. My donut was crispy on the outside, light and cakey on the inside and the chocolate was the exact right amount of sweet. My husband's was just like CrÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e. It had s nice crack on the outside and delicious vanilla custard inside. You could even see the Vanilla bean speckles. There is a small sitting area outside with adirondack chairs. This is a must visit and lives up to the Instagram photos. Totally worth the check in.

The baguettes are good and they'll have a food item or 2 I can eat. The drinks and coffee are nice plus they stay open 24/7. When I say 24/7, like remember the snow storm the last couple of years, well d@mn it, they were open. They should get 5 stars just for that!

Staff was very friendly. The items at the bakery weren't any better than I could get at a local shop. Be prepared to wait. The line goes out the door because of the name recognition. The bakery isn't any better than an average run of the mill place. It's definitely not worth the long wait in line.

You bad dirty donut bar, you had me with your ginormous big poppa filled strawberry tart and cake batter donut not to mention your filthy minds when you created the birthday filled oreo donut concoction you guys need a spanking because these donuts are banging baby! LOLZ their nutella filled donut and triple choc threat definitely has a home in my belly too bwahah. Thanks to UberEats you dropped by right before closing at noon Yas that hanger life! #thebestdonutsintheworld it must be because it's on the box lmfaoooo!

Always good! Would highly recommend, they provide a quality product, with great customer service and pay attention to detail! No matter which location I go to, and I'm inclined to go to several! Mitchell's ROCKS! Thank you Mitchell's!

Went with my brother and my niece tonight. Holy crap. I've never seen an ice cream place so packed before. That being said, there was a lot of confusion to just how many lines there were. Anyway, we eventually got our ice cream and it was well worth the wait. A little pricey but will probably be back once COVID goes away.
The BEST ever! My family used to get these donuts from original location 50+ years ago and they are still great.

What kind of person doesn't love Honey Hut? Admittedly, I'm biased. I'm a Parma native who lived smack dab in the middle between the Parma and Cleveland locations. I grew up with Honey Hut, which is why it doesn't bother me that there's no indoor seating or exceptionally fancy stuff done with the ice cream. Don't misunderstand, it's still the best ice cream in Ohio. My personal favorite is the Mint Chocolate Chip in a waffle cone. Generally, I prefer the Cleveland location since I never run into anyone I know from high school there and they open sooner and close later, both seasonally and daily. It's an absolute must on any visit to Cleveland... or just running errands on a summer day.

First time at Jenni's, ordered 1/2 scoop of the rosÃ© sorbert and the coffee with cream and sugar in a cup ($6). I really enjoyed both flavors I didn't get to try their cones. I like the rosÃ© sorbert over the coffee flavor more. They have no restrooms but they have plenty of outdoor seating. The building is super cute and there is a mural around the corner from the ice cream shop. It's in a really nice gentrified area of Charlotte with a lot of other restaurants and shops nearby. I parked maybe a block away and paid $5 there is also street parking. Last Sunday when the temperature was really hot- on a winter day the line was out the door. Make sure you get there early if you don't want to wait a long time. The workers were pleasant. They do have free stickers if you have a little one or just like to collect stickers.

I missed the Milk Bar Yelp event and was surprised by the low ratings when this business opened, so I had to check it out myself. I have very mixed feelings about how to rate this place because some of the reviews are nitpicky as hell (but they bring up a lot of valid points), but the product is pretty good. Worth the Strip price-hike though? Debatable. LOCATION: Inside the Cosmo, easily accessible from the parking garage. Walkup counter, no dedicated seating, Chandelier Bar has couches and Eggslut has counter seating nearby. Other locations are walkup only, so this shouldn't be an issue. But a lot of people dislike it. PRICING: Compared to NYC locations, prices are a bit higher (+75c per cookie, +$1 for Crack Pie Slice, +$1.50 soft serve, +$3 for greatest hits combo, etc.). Similarly, their Milk Quakes are $12 compared to other alcoholic shake options nearby that are $15. But the other place has larger portions and great presentation, too. SERVICE: Fine. No complaints. My order was taken by friendly staff. I waited on one of my items for a few minutes and a staff member asked what I was waiting on, noticed it had been forgotten, and made it immediately. PRODUCT: Sampled a little bit of everything with the Greatest Hits Combo ($19). There are also mixes, cookbooks, tote bags, scarves, and such available for gifting. Cereal Milk Soft Serve- other reviews say the flavor is bland and portion is small, but I could barely eat half of it. I'm not a corn flake fan but the texture was appreciated and enhanced the flavor, which had a nice pinch of saltiness to it like you really get at the bottom of a bowl. Compost Cookie- #nocrunchycookies! This had the perfect texture of soft and chewy, but not falling apart. Interesting combination of flavors but I can't really say I liked it. Maybe I'll try other cookie flavors in the future, but the NYC price is a lot more appealing. Birthday Truffles- I couldn't decide if I liked this. Nice hint of bday cake flavor but really sweet. Only ate one of the pack of three and that was enough. This might be fun for gifting though. Crack Pie- It's like pecan pie without the pecans and I like that it isn't too sweet but I'm not about to get addicted. As others have said, the slice is tiny. For the price, it should be deeper/taller. It's a nice little treat but the cardboard sleeve packaging preventing you from seeing the portion size is a bit deceptive. Birthday Cake!- Okay, full disclosure, I got the cake free through an IG promo. The 6" regularly retails for $56. The portion claims to feed 8-12, and I'd say that's accurate. It's fairly tasty and not too sweet, and I like how the crumbles add texture. The "naked" decoration style also keeps the ratio of cake to frosting more even, and the multiple layers are both pretty and help to distribute the frosting. Would I eat it again? Probably. Would I pay nearly $60 for this cake? Probably not. Unclear why the crack pie is available whole or sliced but their self-proclaimed "fan favorite" cake is not. In short, it's A-OK. It's exciting that we have a Milk Bar location on the West coast and I'm glad I tried it, but even if I happen to be at the Cosmo, it's not a must-go place for me. Even if there isn't a line.

Hype little ice cream spot. Definitely a vibe, throwback cereal interior gives you that nostalgia. My friend got the bowl, Cosmo & Wanda--fruit loops and captain crunch all berries with almond milk and ice cream haha, she loaded up, that was actually legit though because the almond milk almost made it sweeter if you can imagine that. Perfect Combo I went with a shake and got Mucha Lucha it was the perfect little mix basically a hella sweet horchata milkshake, perfect cinnamon sugar balance. We both enjoyed it so much. They were very considerate when helping move the line as quick as they could, paying attention to detail. I think we had to switch something last minute but they were great with communicating to us and quick to make fixes and pivot. They were definitely using gloves and all that so it felt very clean and just well run. Lots of great smiles from the staff and we loved that, we felt very comfortable and happy to be there.

heard so much about it. decided to check it out. went late around 10pm. saw so many tips about salted caramel brownie..definitely worth it! coffee is fresh and not bitter. definitely wanna come back and try their food menu :)

Such wonderful ice cream!! The texture is joyously creamy and the flavors are rich and encompass the standards and many creative ones -- like orange blossom (outstanding!) and honey graham -- all at excellent prices. The staff is patient and friendly. There's plenty of outdoor seating; there's no indoor seating as this is a large ice cream stand, but much of the seating is under an awning. My only complaint is that oddly -- although like other places I've seen around Cleveland -- it looks like only a few flavors can be used for milkshakes (and I keep forgetting to ask why that is), which is too bad as many of the other flavors would make incredible milkshakes.

Yum! So good! I got this recommendation from a blog on pinterest and it was worth it! Its a small little shop with a lot of different ice cream options and a bunch of candy. They make their own marshmallow creme which is mostly why I wanted to go there. Its my favorite ice cream topping. We got the smores sundae to share and it was huge and really good. She put a big scoop of marshmallow creme on it and the torched it. I usually like it more hot and melted like a syrup but this was good too. The service was great. They have a little back patio we sat on and ate our ice cream. Good spot if you are in the area!

All I can say about this place is... you must try a chocolate covered strawberry! They are huge and juicy and delicious! The baked goods look amazing and taste like a little slice of heaven. They have bakers next door baking to fill up the yummy treats for the store. You can't go wrong with the deliciousness from here!

I don't get the hype. Came in after walking by a few other places Bc people rave about this ice cream. My gf had a chocolate cone and I had the berry crumble something or other. She didn't even finish hers, and mine was good but not great...And $13 for 2 single scoops of ice cream? Thanks, but no.

We stayed at the air bnb above this bakery and just had to try it. It's in a charming neighborhood in Champaign just a block off of Prospect Ave and across the street from Southside Elementary School. There's a small parking lot and plenty of street parking available. Inside you will find an adorable bakery and cafe. We went in around 9am on a Friday and the place was ours. There's seating available if you would like to enjoy your treats in house. We ordered carry out to share with some friends and family. 2 cinnamon rolls, 2 tomato and herb quiche, 2 bagels and cream cheese. I split a quiche and one of the jug ge cinnamon rolls with my husband. They were both well made and the cinnamon roll was delicious! I wish they had a few more savory breakfast items but their traffic might be lighter on weekdays..? They had some baked desserts that looked amazing and some unique drinks you won't find just anywhere like a brown sugar and fig latte. I also noticed hand made marshmallows! They sell specialty food items and gifts as well. This place is really cute and seems to have a little bit of everything. No matter who you are and what you're looking for Hopscotch has something for everyone. Stop in and check it out for yourself!

Pretty disappointed in these donuts. I'm a huge donut person. I went here thinking that it was going to be the same as the location in San Diego, but not even close. These didn't taste fresh or nearly as good. Huge let down would not recommend

I had super high expectations when I came to place. I tried their Captain Crunch ice cream & I bought a dozen of cupcakes (~$40). And I was really... let down? Yes, everything was good but it didn't give me the WOW FACTOR that I was looking for in places like this. Overall, moist & yummy cupcakes plus yummy ice cream? Delicious combination, but way too overpriced in my opinion.

AmÃ©lie's is my homespun love story! By far my favorite coffee shop ever! The minute I stepped inside I thought I had been transported to a chic cafÃ© in the middle of France. It is impossible not to fall in love with the decor and cozy atmosphere. With more than ample seating it is the perfect spot to have a drink, prop open a book or your laptop, and have a wonderful time. You could pick any one item off of the menu and you would not be disappointed! Service has always been exemplary and even when the line is out the door I've never waited too long to get my order. Among my favorite drinks are the French press coffee, salted caramel brownie cafÃ© mocha, and the blueberry lemonade. As for treats, try the napolean, any of the tarts or macarons, the mini mousse cups, and the petit fours!

My mother and I went in to get a wedding cake ordered for my wedding for the 4th of July weekend and Shenel was amazing. I had been nervous about this process and Shenel, the pastry chef, made this experience so great and easy. I was pleasantly surprised how smooth the process went. Shenel put me at ease stating she would actually be the one who will make my cake. I could not be more grateful for her help and cannot wait to see how everything turns out. THANK YOU SO MUCH SHENEL!! -Sonny
Ommmgee the best ice cream store in Phoenix!!! I got the Leslie Knope with carrot cake ice cream and it was BOMB!! We will be back!!

Macarons here are ok. Neither delicious nor disgusting. But certainly not worth the price or the trip from California. I've definitely have had better. I wouldn't recommend this place to friends or family though.
Delicious milkshake that made a hot day so much better! Prices were kinda high, but she did put about 5 scoops of ice cream. Would recommend if you're in the area! :)
Coffee and pastries are always FRESH!!! Trust me once you they're"Melange" or "Madison" brewed coffee, you'll be BACK!! They offer much more....

Ordered a 6" cake, lobster tails, and cannolis. I don't know if I'd spend so much on a cake again, it was good but probably not gonna be something I'll need to have again. Lobster tails were ok. But the cannolis are very good. Even the next day still delicious.
One of the best ice cream shops in Cleveland and the surrounding areas. The always have vegan options.

I was very disappointed, I came in on two different days on my trip to Vegas to try the Cannolis and both days they were out of them. How can you not have cannolis? Anyway we bought a few lobster tails, tarts and Italian napoleons and they were tasty. Items didn't have prices so at the end we paid quite a bit for a few treats.

I was excited to try this place from all the reviews and the magazine recommendation. Another overrated place that I have tried out here in the phoenix area. Ordered the strawberry ice cream cone and the specialty drink with the vietnamese coffee ice cream and expresso. The strawberry ice cream was not even near the best I've had like how the magazine suggested and the drink was WAY too bitter. I wanted to toss the drink out the window
So good. The coconut ice cream was loaded with coconut flakes. Small scoop was huge! Staff was very friendly.

Nothing to get excited about. Overpriced ice cream with little flavor. I paid $5 Reese's Blizzard that's flavorless and tastes old. Will not return nor recommend . I see the reviews are either 5 stars or 1 star. You're first or last, huh?
This place is so good I literally proposed to my wife here. 'Nuff said (proceeds to then drop the mic and walks away)...

Very cute location! Very aesthetic. They have ice cream and boba options. Seemed a little pricey for what the ice cream was - $6 for vanilla soft serve blended with a cereal and 1 topping. I had Cinnamon Toast Crunch with honey drizzle. It comes in a cup or cone at no additional cost.

Dichotomy What?!? What is that? How do you pronounce it? I don't know, but what I do know is that this was my favorite out of all the flavors they had out (for sample) I tried a couple and I was wowwed. It was sweet and had a hint of saltiness. I thought I wasn't a big fan of mixing sweet and salty but I guess I was wrong. They have a whole variety full of flavors but that one was the one that stuck with me. I live in NYC (I was in Cleveland for a friend's wedding last weekend) I wished I could have gotten more bags of popcorn but thank goodness to technology, I can order bags of popcorn from their website. My only question is, how big are the bags. They have a 12ct bag box for $33. I guess I'll order it and update the size one day.

After reading all the great reviews, went today, and everything was great. The selection was the best I've ever seen in Cleveland. We live less then a mile from this great donut shop and had never stopped. Won't be driving by anymore.

This place has the best donuts I've ever had in my life! I got the birthday cake and lemon donuts, which were the biggest donuts I have seen! They normally come out with donut cones at 12 p.m so I was ablw to wait for them and they came straight right out the oven which was nice.
I went for both the cupcake and ice cream. Wonderful taste to both and fresh. The cost is the only issue I had with the items you get. 2 cupcakes and two uce creams and two cookies were around $26

I really loved this little ice cream spot. Tucked away in a cool art area of Phoenix. Great artisan ice cream made in small batches. They are open late which is really nice when you get a late night craving for high quality ice cream. I had the fat elvis flavor with the dounghnut. The combination was outrageously delicious. I would definitely go back. The list of flavors had at least six I wanted to try. Highly recommended!!!!

Old fashioned, hand dipped ice cream will forever be a bringer of joy. My first official job was at an old school ice cream shoppe in York, PA, where I worked for four years along with other jobs until my studies conflicted with my work schedule. It was the best job I have ever had. This job taught me the value of a dollar, and how having a passion for service results in more money and a feeling of self-fulfillment. My parents liked it because they had a never ending supply of ice cream in their freezer. "Don't come home unless you have a hot fudge sundae." Yes, Dad. So many great things have already been said about Churn, so I will just reiterate what has already been said. Churn rocks! Grab one of their awesome delicacies and enjoy them on their patio seating in the rear of the building. I particularly love the S'mores sundae--it's huge, the graham crackers are fresh, and the butane torched marshmallow is its cherry on top, so to speak. It sucks there's only valet, but I'm glad there's parking nonetheless. The service was exceptionally friendly, and the gentleman behind the counter told me I could sample anything I wanted. I refrained as I thought, "What would Larry David do?" 5 stars for a top quality product and great service!
Tastiness abounds. Tried the pretzel single scoop cone. Friendly staff Attached to restaurants and stores with shared patios

Sweet Jesus, I miss honey lavender ice cream from Vancouver. I never thought I'd find such a flavor in Phoenix of all places but lo and behold - Sweet Republic has it! Oh my, my tummy and heart were very satisfied with that delicious, perfectly smooth scoop of honey lavender ice cream. Since then, I've been back multiple times and never been disappointed with their flavors, including the espresso chip, kulfi, matcha, strawberry buttermilk, and Madagascar vanilla. My friends and I can't stop coming back here! They've got other really cool flavors too - watermelon sorbet, peaberry espresso, strawberry balsamic, you name it. They've also got the traditional vanilla, chocolate, salted caramel, etc. Get it in a cup, cone, or as an ice cream sandwich. And if you're feeling adventurous they serve ice cream sundaes too. This place is sure to please for people of all ages! Yum yum yum, I'll be back - that's for sure.

Wooooooooow. The peanut butter and butter pecan were TO DIE FOR! I know there are so many reviews but I had to write another one! The ice cream is amazing because it's homemade. Amazing. Stop reading, go have CHURN!

I've heard great things about this place and for a good reason. First, the owner (who I forgot his name--my apologies!!!) was amazing. He was super friendly, and patient (willingly to deal with my awe of his menagerie of donuts.) If you like--love donuts, this is the spot for you. I was surprised it wasn't busier, because this business is definitely a force to be reckoned with in the Downtown scene. I will even go so far as to say it's better than Pinkbox. So if you're craving something to satisfy that sweet tooth, look no further. Also, can we talk about the milks they have on tap? Innovative, creative, and fun! I will be back and with friends ;)

Milk Bar goodies are my go-to gift for birthday celebrations and sometimes a special treat for myself. I love their gluten free b-day cake truffles and cornflake cookies. Bomb treats, awesome service! Recently I bought a birthday cake for a friend's birthday and being the space cadet I am-- I didn't think to refridgerate it so it melted before the actual birthday. I called Milk Bar and the manager Michelle was understanding enough to help replace it in time before the event free of charge. I am truly blown away by her customer service and she didn't make me feel like an idiot -- which honestly lol, yeah totally a ditz move on my part. People put your cake in the fridge!

I was excited to visit today! My sister took me to a location in National City, CA so I was happy when this location opened. I already knew what I was going to have and I picked up a couple extra sweet goodies. The coffee is so good I will definitely be returning.

I won't say much as, well, it's all been said. Here's what I have observed: - expect a line (but it moves pretty quickly, and if you're with friends anyways, well, it doesn't really matter) - try as many flavors as you like! (so delicious and rich AND they use metal sample spoons, which they wash and reuse *heart*) - they have a variety of cones, pretzel being one I hadn't seen before - one scoop is large and you can split it between two flavors - indulge and enjoy!

Can't say enough good things about this new little place. Friendly owners, wonderful ice cream, great location at Third Space! Ended up getting the donut filled with Fat Elvis ice cream. So delicious! Please stop by and support this novel (haha) little spot. I can't wait to go back and try more flavors!

We had high expectations for this place. By 10am, they only had a very small selection left - none of the ones that the place is known for were available. My regular coffee did not taste good at all. Very nice service and a pretty back patio but nothing to write home about.
Great ice cream flavors and the s'mores are the perfect topping! The owner was very nice and friendly when serving my boyfriend and I. Whenever we visit Scottsdale again we will be sure to stop in!

I was first introduced to Milk Bar after trying out their truffles in a gift box and loved the whole concept and packaging. The truffles were a little too sweet for me, so I was hoping the cereal soft serve would be better - and it was! The soft serve tastes EXACTLY like what you would imagine cereal milk in ice cream form would taste like. It wasn't overly sweet, and I liked that the cereal topping (extra $1) provided a nice crunch which complemented the soft, creamy ice cream. I do wish that the cereal topping was less salty. I don't know what they do to it, but it would taste so much better if they left it plain and simple - crunchy, corn flakes. Don't salt the cereal guys! I cannot give this place a full 4 stars simply because of the price. Paying $7 for a very small soft serve is simply CRAZY and not worth it.

Milk Bar is pretty hype, just one of those places that you'll either really like or you won't. It's novelty food with a trendy price tag, but if you're in the Cosmo and looking for a sweet treat, it's a pretty in-your-face option to at least try, right? I've been to the one in NYC two years ago and was hoping that this would be a slightly different experience, but it's the same stuff, which is great if you enjoy it. Cornflake crunch is so salty that we scooped ice cream off around it. Cereal milk one just tastes like salty cereal milk ice cream. Fruity cereal was more palatable but certainly not worth $7.50 (one topping) plus tax. Their crack pie just isn't appealing at all to me, but they have plenty of other cookie options, so maybe you'll find one you like while searching for something to satisfy your sweet tooth.

I was at Mitchell's ice cream on West 25th when I saw too young teenagers or that taking 6 ice cream cones outside sitting them on the table photographing them and then right in front of a homeless man how asked about them through all six in the garbage without even tasted one of them they were also employees of Mitchell's ice cream
No skim milk. Overpriced.

In this area, there are quite a few coffee shops. I have been to this shop 3 times and the product and place itself is great but the customer service is poor...no greetings or smiles from the baristas. I normally leave a tip regardless but they should give some effort.
Love this place but man the employees are just dreadful.... Sorbet are delicious as always.

Oh. My. Gosh. This was the most delicious thing I've ever tasted. I got the doughmelt with the chocolate cherry pistachio ice cream and it was heaven. The three other people I was with tried different ice cream flavors with their melts and everyone was in love! We will definitely be back. The only downside is that they're not located closer to me!
One of my daughters favorite ice cream places! I love the piÃ±a colada Boba! Everything is delicious

I just came back from Vegas after spending my St. Patrick's Day birthday there. I was given a free cupcake at Sprinkles. It was a good thing it was free or I would have said something. The cake tasted like it had been baked a week ago. Dry as could be. The icing!!!! 3/4 hard as a rock icing and 1/4 cake. Then the price. $5.00 for a little bitty cupcake? I could make over a dozen for less then that and the cake would be moist and the icing would be creamy. From the reviews it looks like I'm the only one that feels this way. My son bought a cupcake and said his was terrible as well. No more Sprinkles for me.
So bummed but this place is definitely not open. It is surrounded by caution tape and it's boarded up!
Yummy! Enjoyed a delicious hot chai tea latte and breakfast croissant sandwich. The croissant was light and delicious. I also bought a pound of their cookies. Yummy!

I came here twice. The first day of my vacation then the last day :) the people that helped me were friendly and patient. I'm glad because it took some time for me to decide what flavor of macarons I wanted. I paid for the "buy 5 get one free" macaron deal they had. My favorite was either the caramel or vanilla. They are also larger than the usual macaron I'm used to, so that was also a plus.

I can't believe I haven't reviewed this location but this place is amazing -- come here and enjoy. This is their flagship location and I love this one because you can walk up and down the Ohio City shops and the cute neighborhood area while you're enjoying your treat, or they also had indoor tables (no outdoor dining, at least not this summer). Their staff are very friendly and when this place gets long lines during warm weather, they handle it like pros and get people through so you're enjoying your ice cream desires in no time. Their prices are very reasonable, and at this location you can rent out the second floor for a private party. Their rainbow sprinkles are awesome and plentiful. What they're great at are the fun flavors they think of. Anything that you see that has chunks in it (e.g. cookies and cream) has the perfect amount, very generous. I think the best part is that even the vanilla flavor in the ice cream itself is good. Their strawberry rhubarb crisp flavor in the summer (usually coming out in June) has a cult following amongst my friends, and rightly so. Rightly so.
Been at Villani's multiple times. Never disappointed in terms of quality, quantity, and service. Try anything you will enjoy it.

Fatty Daddy's Almost Famous Cookie Cup-Pistachio & Fruity Pebbles ice cream with almond cookie & Toasted Marshmallow (Seared in front of you) Two Words- LOVED IT!!! Pretty good selection.....next time chocolate chip & coffee with toasted marshmallow & almond topping definitely will be back!
HOLY MOLY this ice cream is amazing! I'm kind of an ice cream snob and this is one of my all time favorites. It tasted fresh, flavorful, and smooth but also filling.

Based on the plethora of 5 star reviews, I really wanted to be blown away. What I got was a solid homemade ice cream experience. Better than Dairy Queen, but not the finest ice cream I have ever had. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing? (Butter Pecan sundae). Regardless, it's solid.

Love the unique flavors at Jenni's really try stepping out of your comfort zone because the brown butter almond brittle is one of the best flavors on the menu! The good thing is you can get half scoops and try as many flavors as you want! But always get the gooey butter cake it is amazing!!

Thumbs down. Highly overrated! Went there with my date and had a piece of cake. It took very long to be served and when we got our cake I was very disappointed. The cake was *very dry* like stale bread on the bottom, like it had been sitting out for a long time on the plate or something, despite being told it was freshly cut. And the overall quality of the cake was sub-par/ not a treat to enjoy. Also, because of the other reviews raving about this spot as a cake spot, I was very disappointed in the selection of cakes, only a handful (4 or 5) to choose from. One slice will set you back about $7-8 dollars (with a tip.. $6.50 each) which is fine if it tasted good. But no. Cake should not be dry flavorless bread. Don't serve stale stuff. It leaves a bad taste in your customer's mouth (literally -- no one likes to be ripped off). Underwhelming experience. Also, a suggestion for an actual menu either on paper or posted somewhere, so customers can get an idea of the types of beverages the place offers would help. Needs improvements in quality of service, selections, and quality of the products.

Whether you are first time visiting the UW-Madison or repeated visitors, enjoy scoops of the UW-Madison home-made ice cream is a must. There are three locations: Memorial Union, Union South, and Babcock Dairy Store at 1605 Linden Drive, Madison, WI 53706. Each place has different hours, so be sure you double check before heading over. The Memorial Union store has more flavors including new flavors they are piloting. All three locations carry popular flavors. All flavors are decent, pick what you like. Orange Custard Chocolate Chip is a unique flavor that you won't find elsewhere and has been around for more than 30 years. Good portion with reasonable price. Great quality ice cream. For example, someone I knew had three large scoops all at once one time, did not feel any discomfort from lactose intolerance. The staff were courteous and efficient. The store well organized. There were ice cream drips near the payment area, the staff there did not seem to notice. Would be great to pay attention on payment areas to ensure cleanness, which makes making payments easier. Two drawback is that you are not able to sample it as COVID restrictions is still on. Unlike some specialty ice cream stores, you are not able to get one scoop with 2-3 different flavors. Seems like the Memorial Union location also have shortened hours during wintertime where it opens at 2pm on weekdays.

Cute place with lots of treats; I'm a big fan of DC Cupcakes so I had to try Sprinkles to see if they were just as good or better.....oh and to see the Cupcake ATM lol¼ I chose the Chocolate Marshmallow cupcake....it was yum, taste like a "ho-ho"...id eat it again and try their other flavors with no issues...Sprinkles is comparable to DC Cupcakes taste wise but they are a little pricier...hence the 4 stars.

UPDATE: They now have Vietnamese Coffee as an ice cream flavor. Was it good? oh hell yah! If you know what I'm talking about it, you know what is up. In case you don't, you should try some coffee the next time you are at a Vietnamese restaurant. Vietnamese coffee is basically strong black coffee plus condensed milk.
I love this place. Never had the ice cream but always getting there seasonal samplers cute fun and yummy.

If you like your matcha super sweet, steer clear from the Green matcha and try the Hojicha. The green matcha has that authentic bitter taste to it. It's sweet but not super sweet. It's very balanced. If you love super sweet matcha, get the float. The latte enhances the sweetness. Honestly, cannot go wrong with anything here. I usually get the swirl cone - matcha & hojicha. Best of both world.

This place is so stinking cute it's a small spot and I decided to get a soft serve which is what there know for, and it was good I would say it literally tasted like left over milk from the bottom of fruity pebbles or Frosted Flakes, but frozen and I made a mistake on getting chocolate chips with it definitely would recommend the cereal crunch instead it pairs way better. It was pricey though for two soft serves it was $14 so about $7 each ice cream with out the cone. It was good but not that good maybe if it was cheaper I would consider getting ice cream again but I'm not much of a cereal person to begin with so I might have to pass.
The macaroni and chocolate croissant were okay... nothing special. The cappuccino was lacking in flavor.

Wow, the reviews did not lie about this place! I drove from Tempe to stop at this gem after a particularly disheartening afternoon. It was empty at 4 pm to my luck so the girl at the counter gave me a few samples and said to take my time as she described the flavors and combinations with such passion! A connoisseur just like me! I was without a doubt made to feel better by her benevolence as well as the incredible flavors of the S'mores ice cream sundae I indulged in. I paired it with chocolate and peanut butter (but probably should have gone with the vanilla that she recommended due to chocolate overload). I'm not a fan of marshmallows, but it seems they make them there (or have a magical vendor) and let me tell you...it was delicious as was the entire concoction! That definitely turned my frown upside down. I also took a pint to go like a fat kid.

This place is always busy, the line is well worth it. I'm not a big fan of the cannoli, but the Lobster tails are delicious. Carlos bakery has a website we're you can actually have your favorite dessert shipped to your home.
The cupcakes are sinfully good. I tried the the peanut butter and it was one of the best cupcakes I have tried. We will definitely visit again when we are on the Strip.

hot summer night need a sweet dessert to cap the weekend, what i ate: - coffee ice cream: cool and refreshing. like haagan daaz but more expensive cause it's sprinkles. - red velvet cupcake: delicious as always pros: - cupcake ATM! no need to wait in line - ice cream AND cupcakes - friendly servers - cute menus (really designed well IMO) cons: - always a wait for the hype - no inside seating. when it's 90degrees at night, you want AC. would i go again? probably not, as i'm not a native.
Best Softserve in the burgh hands down the cookies are hot! You must try the chocolate chip cookie sundae.

Confusing place for a 1st timer. I went in a little after 7:30 and it had a steady flow of customers that seemed to be regulars. It is a nice atmosphere for sure to sit and read or spend some time working away from the office. The staff was not welcoming or warm but rather snobby and pretentious. Having said that I still ordered a slice of quiche and 2 macaroons which was a little over $10. The macaroons were delicious but the quiche was very plain.

Thanks guys, for the warm welcome and the delicious creamy ice cream. First timers here, and the guys were patient, helpful, welcoming, and friendly.
