Cheat meal wasted. I have this pet peeve. I absolutely hate it when a place is highly rated on my beloved Yelp or even culturally in general, only to find out that it was for novelty over actual superiority. It's like someone hooking you up with someone sexy and you get all excited because they look good in the pictures but you meet them in person and they have no personality. That's donut bar. I waited like months to try this place because I try to eat healthy most of the time. I drooled over the photos of the "strawberry poppa tart" the "creme brÃ»lÃ©e donut" etc I walked in and saw that "Brad fritter" and got one of those too on good faith even though I don't even like apple in baked goods. Because this place has a lot of stars, so its GOTTA BE GOOD. Right?? And after an extra strenuous workout to prep for the big day, I finally got to try all of the donuts I had been pining over. And none of them rocked my world. Not one. I get there and the shop is cute, clean, very nice displays and an absolutely wonderful staff. To my surprise the donuts are even waaaaaaay bigger than pictures communicate. My a*s was EXCITED! I got a strawberry poppa tart, creme brÃ»lÃ©e donut, Brad fritter, Nutella glaze, and birthday cake glaze, and not a single one of them was worthy of more than 2 stars. They are big and fluffy but they catered more to having giant donuts, than delicious ones. Something about the actual donut bodies themselves were just plain and boring and they topped them with glazes & toppings that will get you all exited but are ultimately lackluster as well. Except the candied bacon on the Brad fritter. Best part of the whole donut box was that bacon. That wound up being my breakfast. Do yourself a favor, and head on over to "Master Donuts" on the eastside or "RONALDS DONUTS" in China town! Theyre the "change yo lyfe" type of good donuts. Trust.
Our family favorite! Love the red velvet and carrot cakes. Kids love the lemon bars and cookies. Paul and Amanda are wonderful, warm and friendly. So glad they have come to Concord!

Somewhat hard to find as there is minimal signage in the hotel that helps. 15 minute wait total (not bad) which I was prepared for and the staff was nice and answered questions about pricing (since there was none posted). You had to ask for the cannoli because there weren't any in the front case. They tasted good. The pastry was crisp-fragrant with vanilla and the cream rich with pops of chocolate chips. I thought the cream puffs were just ok. We have a New York style bakery were I'm from and their cream puffs are so delicious so I naturally compared the two and was a bit let down. $10 got me a cannoli, cream puff and coffee. I'm glad I visited because I was a fan of the family show. I may try some other things if I come back.

I thought the bakery was in Paris, not the Venetian! Finding Bouchon Bakery took quite some effort but the search was well worth it indeed. I visited the bakery in Napa earlier this year and knew I had to make a stop at the Vegas location. The bakery is a small kiosk-like place behind the escalator across of the Phantom of the Opera theater (FYI Phantom is leaving Vegas soon so the show here will change). This time, I only picked up a couple of coffee macarons vs. the bazillion I got in Napa. I also grabbed a strawberry croissant, a nutter butter cookie and a vanilla latte. EVERYTHING was good. Although my sweets were supposed to last for the duration of the long road trip out of Vegas, they were just too good not to eat and were simply gone too soon.
Really enjoyed the Netflix & Chill flavor and the coconut macaron. This is on the pricier side for ice cream, and hard to find since it's tucked away almost in an alley off Miller Road.

Delicious almond croissants and lattes! The only detracting factor is that since it's located on the casino floor, there's second hand smoke everywhere (alas, Vegas). Take the deliciousness back to your room to enjoy in a smoke free environment.

The donuts here are to die for!! Wow! I couldn't believe how amazing and different they were. And the coffee...wow!!! Do yourself a favor and head down here! You won't regret it. the staff is super sweet, helpful and full of spirit!!! Best donut shop in Vegas!

All in all, everything is overpriced. The ice cream was good and the quality was great, but I honestly wouldn't pay that much for a cup of soft serve ice cream. I got the milk cereal soft serve which basically tasted like corn flakes soaked in milk for 10 minutes, which might taste bad or good depending on your opinions on corn flakes itself. Despite the high price, I can't say I'm surprised because it is such an aesthetically pleasing food and on top of that it's located in Vegas. Overall, good quality ice cream, but would not spend money on it every time.

My husband and I love Ninety's for a sweet treat. It is definitely indulgent if you get a yum-ee bun, but so worth it! The bun is like a donut and they warm it with your ice cream inside. I'm not sure how the bun is so warm and the ice cream is still so cold, but it's amazing! My husband gets the Oreo milkshake, and he loves it! Everything at Ninety's is just a little extra special. Also, the dark chocolate hazelnut ice cream is so good. Like, heavenly good.

The donuts here are good; they're dense, unlike a lot of other donut places. You can really tell thy put effort in making them. However, the creme brulee donut was very disappointing. The hype did not match the quality. I think people were just excited about the cracking noise rather than its taste. However, the other donuts were great!
This place was so delicious. We got a shake and their donut sammy (warmed donut, filled with ice cream). I just about died and went to heaven.

Crepes de Luxe consistently knocks it out of the park. To me the savory crepes taste just like the ones of Paris food carts. The line is ridiculously divided yes - however I get the wait time is because each is cooked fresh. Now as for the "rudeness" really I think it's just to keep the line moving! I mean think about it if you are talking on ur phone during the wait fine but at the top of the counter, at Mecca, IN the end zone just order - you aren't supposed to make the chef your new best friend! Honestly the King, the lemon, the dark chocolate strawberry or the Nutella & banana are all fabulous. Savory wise I've only had one and it was ok just not as good as the sweets to me. I start every market day waiting in this line - I know they are worth it -- and to me that's all that matters.
Best bakery in NC ! Gets really packed so seating is almost impossible. I always have to get mines to go. Best Creme BrÃ»lÃ©e I've ever had! Beautifully decorated.

Love this place! As a family, we probably visit once a week. The team is fantastic and welcoming, the location is clean and adorable, the baked goods are delicious and the ice cream is great. No reason to go anywhere else!!

We tried this ice cream shoppe on a whim. It was within 2 minutes of where we were so we tried it. From what I read online, there were great reviews and I was excited to indulge and try it. My boyfriend got the strawberry sorbet on a waffle cone and I opted to try their almost famous cookie cup. They allow to choose 2 scoops of a flavor they offer, then you choose your macaroon flavor, and finally they toast a marshmallow right on top. I'm not one to finish an ice cream dish or dessert but I finished every drop of this cookie cup, it was delicious and I highly recommend this place!! It was fun to order and I would certainly come back again soon! The girls there are really nice and were super helpful in their menu explanations etc. love it!

Review based on Sprinkles' invite-only Sneak Peek event on Wednesday, March 19th! I received an e-mail from Sprinkles last week inviting me and a guest for a taste prior to their grand opening. The tasting involved complimentary cupcakes (2) and ice cream. Very exciting! We arrived approximately 15-20 minutes before the event (2PM-4PM) and there was already quite the line. We were checked off a list and given cupcake and ice cream menus. The event was pretty organized as they allowed a certain amount of people in at one time as to not overcrowd the intimate shop. The boutique is adorable! Bright colors, their script logo, Sprinkles dots, and treats galore. On the left side of their space is the counter to order cupcakes and beverages. The cupcakes are displayed to your right, flavors labeled with wooden blocks. There were also doggie cupcakes ($2.50) and their "store" where you can purchase shirts ($25-40), onesies ($25), cupcake mixes ($14), and a crazy adorable miniature toy replica of a Sprinkles boutique ($16)! On the other side of their boutique is the ice cream counter. There are also two entrances. On the exterior wall, facing O'Sheas, is the very cool Cupcake ATM that is open 24 hours! My guest, Christina, and I bought opted for the Salty Caramel ice cream (one scoop, $3.75) in a Red Velvet waffle cone ($1). I really wanted to try the Coffee Fudge Almond, but they didn't have any! The Salty Caramel was really sweet and much too salty; it was difficult to eat. The Red Velvet cone was delicious! Soft, crunchy, and great flavor. It's a must with your ice cream! We shared four cupcakes ($3.75/each): Chocolate Coconut (Belgian dark chocolate with coconut cream cheese frosting), Ginger Lemon (Spiced ginger cake with lemon cream cheese frosting), Red Velvet, and Strawberry. By the way, I love the wooden utensils with "Sprinkles" etched in their handles! We took these home to enjoy since there are only 4-5 seats and a small table facing outside. The cupcakes were all very moist, but didn't have spectacular flavor. Strawberry was our favorite with the best cake flavor and frosting. Yummy and not overly sweet. I didn't care for the chocolate, ginger, or red velvet cakes. The ginger flavor was just okay and it was difficult to detect lemon in the frosting. The chocolate and red velvet didn't taste like much. I did like the coconut frosting very much. I've had prior experience with Sprinkles cupcakes and they're not my favorite, however, there are certain flavors that I really enjoy. The Strawberry was wonderful and I loved the German Chocolate offered last Fall. FYI: Sprinkles is located next to Brooklyn Bowl, near the High Roller. They're open Sunday thru Wednesday 10AM-12AM and Thursday thru Saturday 10AM-1AM. There is a schedule for their cupcake and ice cream flavors, so if you're looking for something in particular, view their website before your visit!

Vegas is not Vegas without our Sunday brunch at Bouchon! We travel at least 3-4 times a year to Vegas and this place does not disappoint! It's our absolute favorite place for food! Everything is top notch and we always have great service!!! The chicken and waffles are like no other! Chef Keller does an amazing lemon brine with the roast chicken! The waffles are cooked with chives and bacon bits. My absolute favorite is the savory chasseur sauce!!! We always have fresh delicious oysters and several rounds of mimosas! Cant say enough great things about this place! if you haven't tried it, you are truly missing out!
The smell of the fresh waffle cones hits you the first step inside, instant childish smile ensues. Great flavors. Can't wait to go ab
The ice cream and bubble waffles are great!! My only complaint is one of the workers poor attitude.

It is definitely worth trying. We really enjoyed the drinks we got. The Kinoka Mochi Shokupan was alright. But the lattes were creamy, rich, not overly sweet and delicious! Also the powder room was so cute and clean!

Talk about Ice Cream. Used to live in central Phoenix and it's one of my favorites. Now when in the area and it's warm out always enjoy some fresh ice cream. Look forward to my next visit. P.S the S'mores is amazing.

This is for the store next to the gift shop. Major operational screw up made a quick pick up turn into a 20- 30 minute wait for nothing. There was a couple of irate customers who did not receive receipts or their orders and held up the line. The staff could have just remade them the order and let the line move on. Instead they wasted so much time arguing and a big crowd was waiting. I was waiting for my ham and cheese croissant to be warmed so had no choice but to wait. And at the end, my croissant wasn't even warmed! Even if the food is good I will not come here again and ensure such bad service. They should fire the operations manager for the poor job.

As a frequent guest at the Venetian/Palazzo, we always try to squeeze in a stop to Carlos Bakery for a Lobster Tail and coffee. While all of the pastries/desserts look so deliciously tempting, the Lobster Tail is our favorite, ever since we first had it on an NCL cruise I must say that I find a surprising lack of good, friendly service at this Grand Canal Shops location. We usually go there mid-morning after the early morning rush is done. While the counter attendants are quick to serve us, it seems as though they are just going thru the motions and can't wait to return to their chatting with their behind-the-counter coworkers. We always order coffees and ask for cream - I don't understand why there's no cream or half & half at the sugar/mixing counter like their competition? Or, at least have those small disposable containers of cream available at the register. They keep the cream in a fridge under the coffee brewer, and even if I request to pour my own cream, they always insist on pouring it behind the counter. Everyone has their own preference as to how much cream they want - these servers either pour way too much or not enough and we always need to ask for a coffee redo or more cream. The workers then react as if I'm the one that messed up the coffee in the first place or as if I'm asking for too much. On our last visit 11/28/17, when I asked for more cream, the guy told me that they ran out. ????? Too bad, we love the products, but in Vegas there's many other options.

I am a huge fan, and a converted popcorn lover. Before encountering Campbell's at a Yelp event, I thought I didn't like popcorn. As I came to learn on Campbell's factory tour (which was awesome!), the reason I like Campbell's and not other popcorns is because of the type of corn kernel they use. Apparently the kind they use has less of the kernel shell that gets stuck in your teeth, which was the whole reason I always hated popcorn. Obviously, the tour was very informative. It was also fun. We made chocolate dipped caramel corn balls, and the tour price included a voucher to spend in the gift shop! I am so addicted to their treats now that I keep trying to come up with reasons to buy bags of popcorn as gifts for people so I have an excuse to visit the store.
Great atmosphere and great tasting ice cream that offers waffle cone option at a reasonable price. Staff is very friendly and professional.

Love Bouchon! Picked up a chocolate eclair, ham & cheese baguette (heated up on their panini press, yum!), "club" sandwich (also on a baguette, w/ avocado, bacon, sun-dried tomatoes - deeelicious) and 2 macarons - lemon and chocolate. Loved the lemon, which was tart, light and refreshing. The chocolate one was very rich - I had actually ordered raspberry but was given chocolate...didn't discover it until after we left. Be sure to check your bags before you leave the counter! Our goodies totaled up to $30 even - pricey, but a nice once-in-a-while splurge. The bakery is hidden behind some escalators, in front of the Phantom Theatre. No tables or seats, so either head to the food court or to the Coffee Bean on the second floor - not the one right above the bakery (tables are right in front of the counter), but the one around the corner and on the way to the self-parking lot. You'll find 4 or 5 tables that are hidden away from the counter, so you can eat your goodies without feeling embarrassed about being a total squatter.

I loved the whole vibe of this place. The street it is on is bumpin, right next to the ferris wheel. There is loud music outside which made the whole scene outside super cool. We all got ice cream instead of the cupcakes, and my strawberry shortcake ice cream was freakin amazing. It had fresh strawberries and the crunch from the shortcake was too good. One of my friends got the red velvet with the velvet cone. It was good, but I would recommend the strawberry shortcake ice cream. It made me forget all of the money I lost in Vegas. The lady helping us out was super nice and helpful. I DEFINITELY recommend this place!

Seriously good ice cream! On the weekends, this place gets pretty busy. Probably because everyone knows that their ice cream is a great end to the week! There's a wide range of unique flavors to choose from. Some of my favorites are banana cream pie, coffee chocolate chip, apple pie, and coconut caramel delight. I recommend getting the four scoop sampler because you can mix and match hundreds of combinations! Then, if you want some for later, you can get your favorite flavors in a pint or quart!

Super friendly staff and yummy treats! I had the brownie sundae (can't recall the actual name). The hot fudge in it was delicious. The brownie was not that great on its own, but perfect for crumbling up into your ice cream. The sundae is $10 and big for how sweet and rich the flavors are; you're better off splitting it with friends. I will definitely return here next time I'm in Vegas.

Very expensive and the taste is mediocre at best. The Cupcake ATM is a neat little idea, but that's about all Sprinkles Cupcakes has going for it. The cupcakes don't have a unique taste and the frosting is boring and overly sweet. Skip this place and find somewhere else.

Yummy yummy. Super nice staff. Ordered the birthday cake donut. After trying my family members choices, mine was by far the best. Fluffy donut with an Oreo inside. Had the cold brew which woke me up right away. Happy we found this place on yelp. #memories :)

This is some top quality Ice Cream! The flavors and ingredients are so different yet something for everyone, and you can just tell the ingredients are fresh. I tried the FrosÃ© and the Lavender berry something - I cant remember. But both were AMAZING! Depending on the time you go, there can be a long line but we only waiting about 8 min.

I wish they opened another 85 bakery here in Vegas. They don't always have every bread out. Some breads don't get cooked all the way. When I order my coffee a certain way they do it wrong. U ask for boba and they hardly put any boba on ur drink. The fact also that this location gets really packed badlyyy and hardly ever find parking. I have a handicap placard due to my disability & people who are not disabled & no handicap placard on their cars park on handicap spots. This just makes me sooo mad.... They need to put signs also to be a 15-20min parking ONLYYYY for people who are just buying something fast & leave. I love 85 degrees but I wish they opened another location here in Vegas.

Superb artisan ice cream....with rocky road being my favorite. The staff is always very nice and friendly and the prices are reasonable. Sweet republic has an array of flavors to choose from and also make their own waffle cones and marshmallows. On tops of that, they have freshly baked chocolate chip cookies and a small assortment of candies.
Such a great experience here! My ice cream, macaron, and marshmallow were so tasty! Best that I've had! I can't wait to come back! Definitely recommend!

wasnt up to the hype or the line. actually not a fan of the smell or taste if the "buckwheat" crepe. you may like it but it had a weird smell. hard to eat out of the "fancy cute" box they provide. i ordered the CBC or chicken and bacon crepe. my two friends also ordered .. so 3 total crepes. after i paid she proceeded to tell me they were out of chicken... i said well had i known that i woildnt have ordered ..and paid for CBC which has a main ingredient CHICKEN lol. anyway she looked dismayed when i said well can you just cancel mine and just make the other two that my friends ordered.. well she seemed annoyed so swapped out some other meat and then my friends were served their crepes in about 10 minutes while i waited for literally 20 minutes for mine to get done all while my friends waited you do what you want this will not be a stand i ever buy from again . my visit was saturday in sept 2021

The cake was dry I'm sorry I would not recommend this bakery for a sweet craving. I'm not sure if it is because they have the cake sitting out all day or if they bake it a day prior, BUT the cake was DRY. No moisture at all. I found this place on TikTok. Came here excitingly ready to eat sweets! I ordered 6 different desserts and they all had the same texture. NO MOISTURE :( The black sesame cake was the worse. My fork couldn't even cut through it. Sorry but this was a NO for me.

We have heard so much about this place and we had to check it out! The location was perfect. Plenty of off street parking spaces. Walking distance to restaurants and shops. So many options of ice cream with reasonable prices. We tried Gooey Buttercake, Brambleberry and Goat cheese with red cherries. So good!! We'll definitely go back and try everything!

Wow!! This is one of the best soft serve ice cream & Yogurt location in Las Vegas! Handel's Homemade Ice Cream & Yogurt was on my "to-visit" list and I finally had a chance to stop by over the weekend on a Sunday afternoon! Handel's Homemade Ice Cream & Yogurt is located off of the 215/Tropicana, a few blocks away. It's within a relatively large shopping plaza with spacious amount of parking. Handel's Homemade Ice Cream & Yogurt's is outside. There are a variety of benches available for seating though! Handel's ice cream has a ton of soft served ice cream flavors, milkshakes, sherbets, brownies and much more! It wasn't too long of a wait. There was two other parties in-front of ours. After reviewing the menu we had ordered the following 1) 4 Scoop Sample - Apple Delight, Cinnamon, Salty Caramel Truffle, Birthday Cake 2) 1 Scoop of Chocolate 3) Blondie with Vanilla ice cream/Whip Cream. The customer service team was super friendly. They were all adhering to the current health safety measures, wearing face masks, gloves, and social distancing. The 4 scoop sample was awesome!! The Apple Delight had almost like a apple cinnamon swirl in the middle. It reminded me of a slice of apple pie. The Cinnamon was super good and flavorful. The Salty Caramel Truffle was my favorite. The caramel flavor was delightful and the truffles added in it gave it a crunch with all of the salty, caramel flavors! The Birthday cake was good. It didn't have a yellow cake flavor, but more of a sprinkles flavor profile. The Blondie was warm, and the vanilla ice cream was a perfect match! Handel's had topped a ton of ice cream and whip cream on it! The sweet treat was delicious! Handel's wasn't too expensive for all of the goodies we had ordered, approximately $17.00. The team here is awesome! I'd highly recommend going to Handel's Homemade Ice Cream & Yogurt if you haven't been to it yet!

I've had milk bar shipped to Washington and the cakes are delicious. I thought they would be even better fresh from the bakery, so I bought one during my trip to Las Vegas. It was terrible, nothing like the Milk Bar I've had before. The cake was very dry and the truffles on top were hard as a rock. So disappointed, since I have been such a fan.
Rude female employee asked her a question she spoke to me like I am not intelligent and as I was talking she turned her back on me and walked away.

$3.50 for the red velvet cupcake which was so moist and tasty. I was mostly impressed with the frosting and the fact that it wasn't ultra sweet like most places but creamy just the way I like it. No line on a weekday afternoon although there was some confusion as to how and where to order. Limited bar stool seating also made it hard to enjoy my new sweet.

love pages so much. It's always busy, but the line usually goes pretty fast and gives you enough time to decide what you want haha. I think it's very fair pricing, but it's cash only. I believe there is an ATM on site

I have been following Ice Cream Social since they started as online only business in 2020. I absolutely loved the story behind the shop and their stance on social justice. The owner, Katrina, donates the money from her weekly ice cream sales to organizations in the local community fighting for social and racial equity. Not only is the story amazing, but the ice cream is beyond delicious! It's made from scratch in Madison. They frequently switch out their unique flavors and all the ice cream is gluten free (not that you can tell). So far, I've only tried the monster cookie ice cream. It was absolutely amazing- m&ms and cookie dough in every bite. The ice cream base is so creamy and delicious on its own as well. I can't wait to go back and try more flavors! The shop itself is SO cute! If you've followed Ice Cream Social on Instagram, you know Katrina put her heart and soul into every detail. She hand stained the ice cream bar, designed the sign, picked out all the different paints (possibly painted the shop too) and more. The shop has accent colors of dark blues, yellows, corals, pinks, and whites. It's such a cute combination of colors and works perfectly with all the LED signs and hanging pendant lights. Their official opening date is on Friday, March 11th. You NEED to check it out!
Love love love Sprinkles! A "must go" stop for any cupcake lover. They have 2 gluten free options, red velvet and lemon blueberry. Both are AMAZING! Be sure to check out the cupcake ATM!

Good ice cream, a lil' bit different with some spicy kick to if if you want to try something new. Good fluff cottony softness, decent flavor. But if I judge by the classic staple flavors it really doesn't compare to other homemade ice cream places I've been. Still really good, not great.

I can't say enough good things about this place. The ice cream is amazing and homemade, and the couple that owns the place is so personable and sweet to every customer that comes in. It's in a really cute part of Phoenix as well. Can't wait to go back to Phx so I can get this ice cream again! So so good!!

What's so great about the soft serve? It doesn't doesn't like anything . The corn flakes taste like salty butter and the (milk cereal) soft serve doesn't take like anything. I was expecting something like milk & cereal from Afters in Long Beach. Stars for customer service though! I asked for birthday candles for the cake truffles (it's my husband's birthday) I purchased and the cashier handed me some! Thank you :)

I have been here several times now, and I have to say this place is pretty darn good. I feel like Jeni's takes the place as top ice cream place in Charlotte. Even in February there is a line out the door for ice cream. What I like about Jeni's is that they don't have the standard chocolate, vanilla, cookies and cream...etc. Jeni's has flavors like goat cheese and cherries, which I have not had the guts to try yet. But don't worry they have other more traditional flavors for those who are not as adventurous. Definitely recommend this place for a sweet treat, but if it is this busy in the winter I can't imagine how long the line will be in the summer time!
Great service and great ice cream. The staff explained the process and were very passionate about the ice crean they create. Definitely coming back.

Venue: Amelie's French Bakery Decor: Unique, almost hippy(ish) if that's even a word. It's just different Service: Cool, somewhat works fast as a team Environment: Small groups, couples, friends meeting, solo venturing to get work done or to relax Food: Pastries (from what I saw), cakes, bread, soups, breakfast sandwiches Prices: Very affordable, not expensive Huge Pros: 24 hours Operating Debbie Downers: It can be very crowded in somewhat a decent size space. Conclusion: I am a fan of their Chai Latte. Very good stuff. I like the place. Really like that it is 24 hours, that's pretty cool. It's a glorified Starbucks Overall: It's in a quiet section not too far from Uptown charlotte. It's a nice laid back kind of venue. The service can be better but other than that, It is a place I would not mind people to hang out, relax or get work done. Grade: B

Hot and gross feeling in their building as the sun set. It was cooler outside. They really should run the AC more. The line was long, unorganized, and not moving so we went to Ghirardelli instead for ice cream.
Wonderful Custard! Customize your own "snowstorm" or soft serve. Usually pretty busy and parking sucks.

After all the hype of watching Cake Boss (which I know is a different location) we were expecting a lot more from Carlo's Bake Shop in the Venetian. The look is authentic and the glass kitchen a nice touch but the items we tried were just ok. The Peanut Butter & Jelly cookies could be made better in the average kitchen, certainly my homemade cookies beat these hands down. The best thing we had was the vanilla slice (like a mille feuille, can't remember what they called it) the pastry cream was good and the puff pastry thin and well defined. Too many option in Vegas for this to be more than a novelty stop.

$14 for this cup of sundae was well worth it! This location is pretty clean although I couldn't hangout inside to indulge in it. Go sit at the fountain and enjoy your goodies and people watch! Wherever there's a Ghirardelli, I am there!

Worth the extra calories! Hands down the best pastries outside of France. Flaky and delicious chocolate almond croissants, a moist and doughy take on the classic cinnamon bun, and strawberry danish that was sublime! Tasty, not greasy. The coffee is fine, but the pastries are where it's at. Avoid long lines at breakfast and stock up for your stay by buying in bulk.

Absolutely by far the BEST ice cream I've ever had. It is so mouth watering creamy and flavorful. Tons of delicious flavors. I'm not normally an ice cream person and I got 3 scoops it was SO good! I recommend this place as a must for desert or treat!!! Yumtown!!

If you are rich ass bastard and staying at the Venetian you are one lucky ass fat ass. Come down your fancy elevator and eat Bouchon everyday. Then go back up stars and watch porn in your room. Viva Las Vegas

When it comes to NE Ohio Ice Cream Mitchell's Homemade Ice Cream should be on everyone's list for top ice cream in the area. In my opinion, there is nothing else like Mitchell's. With over two dozen flavors, fully stocked at all times, it's almost impossible to leave and not find something you like. Although every "famous" ice cream shop has a "signature" ice cream, I'm not familiar that Mitchell's does. Every single time I've been here I've tried a different flavor and every single time I had nothing bad to say about it. If it's either the brownie sundae, milkshake or traditional ice cream cone, you will not be disappointed with that this place has to offer. The coolest part is being able to look behind the glass windows and see the daily operations of ice cream making. Grab some ice cream and watch the employees make it fresh right in front of you. You will not be disappointed

Just like in NYC, you get the same quality soft serve. And unlike NYC, it's always hot in LV. David Chang you genius of a man. I'd happily slurp your leftover bowl of cereals milk. Wait a minute. Isn't this what it is?

sometimes I think about buying a plane ticket just to get some lemon custard..and rescue my secondary stash of shoes from my parents' basement. During the fall, they do a seasonal Pumpkin Pie snowstorm which is making me salivate right now just thinking about it. a funny thing about this place is that it closes down in the winter and they sell xmas trees in the parking lot.

nom!!! we just checked in and first thing we got was .... macarons at bouchon bakery!! =) yes, they are expensive at $3.50 a piece but they are also 2x the size of your regular macarons. these are palm sized!! =) it's as if two macarons merged and formed voltron-macaron! got pistachio and coffee -- both have great chewy shell, tepid to the touch (so not hard and frigid) and delicious lightly sweetened fillings. =) i think i may favor these over 'lettes! will have to grab more on our way out!! *edit -- got more!!! we had 2 butter crossiants, the vanilla macaron and chocolate macaron. SO DELICIOUS that we made an extra trip back for this. ;) Favorite macaron was the VANILLA.

Milk and cereal ice cream with corn flakes is a must try if you enjoy your milk after a bowl of cereal. It was divine. To be honest, my wife and I purchased a pail of cookies, and they weren't that great. I think you'd be ok to skip out on the cookies they sell here.

I love boutique ice cream shops, and heard great things about this one. Ordered the Salted Caramel and Honey Lavender. Now, I am no ice cream addict, but I have tried these 2 flavors from the most popular ice cream shops on the West Coast, and overall I was impressed with the Honey Lavender. The herbal flavor isn't for everyone, but it's a great flavor if you want to be adventurous. Sadly the Salted Caramel was way too salty for me. It almost tasted a little smokey/burnt in my opinion. That said, I would definitely go back and try some other flavors.

Amazing! Our family happened upon this wonderful little place and we were not disappointed! Sampled many flavors and we settled on strawberry, Cookie Monster, cherry cheesecake and Fat Elvis (peanut butter, banana and bacon!) So good! Can't wait to go back. Too bad we live 1400 miles away!

This Mitchell's is really cool because of its unique entrance (see pics) and the ability to see the ice cream being made in the factory on site. The icrecream is always good and you can't go wrong with a sundae either. Watch out for seasonal flavors too! I really like the carmelized chocolate in the summer. It's a hit it miss with service- sometimes you get a nice person, sometimes you don't. Usually you get a good portion, but sometimes you don't. Parking can be tricky at this location, so you might find it best to walk BUT there is some street parking and a large paid parking lot in that back.

We came here for dessert after dinner. Sooo many options. We got the carrot cake and it was a bit on the dry side(we did come late in the evening afterall). Apple crumb cake was also a bit on the dry side. The Nutella cookie was Ok, but a bit hard, then again it may be intended to be that way. Will try to come by earlier in the day next time.

You might think you know what good cake is. But until you have tried Carlo's Bakery cakes you are dead wrong. The best cake. Moist dense and full of flavor. And don't get me started on the texture of the cream in the lobster tails. It's worth the trip to the second floor in the Venetian Grand Canal Shoppes.

Holy moly. We've lived here 7 years and I am utterly without excuse that it wasn't until today that I had their bread. This, even after my best friend raves about the goods he and his daughter get on a semi-regular basis. Well, one excuse, I guess, is that I bake for my family's needs, for the most part - wheat and rye-based sourdoughs, pastries, and baguettes as well. My neighbors and friends have asked me to go pro with an artisanal bakery (...and I explain that as a former French chef and restaurateur, I'm done). Forget all that. That's merely context to say, I love good bread. No, GREAT bread. I can't believe how wonderful today's baguette was. Depth of flavor went on forever, a perfect mix of salt and sugar fermentation in the crumb, and slash work leaving imposing grins on the loaf that rose like waves and seized at the height of perfection. It takes serious skill to achieve the balance they have, between a crusty but not too-crusty (as in, break a tooth, which yes, I recently did, and it was on my own 15% rye levain, a bÃ¢tard. I'd like to blame an old tooth, but I fear it was a less than skillful bake ) crust, a crumb that tears so satisfyingly before yielding, holes that are evenly and beautifully distributed.... I could go on forever. Probably the best baguette I've ever had, and that's not easy for me to admit. I can't wait to try all they have.

At last, a matcha cafe in Charlotte! It's a superb cute cafe with delicious organic matcha! The staffs were friendly and gave lots of free samples! Not complaining! Lol! They are known for their Maiko Special which has a bit of everything from Hawaii. I got the match swirled with kokuto (brown sugar) Maiko Special & it was delicious!! Hint: You eat the soft-serve ice cream first then mix everything underneath!!

It wasn't until I had something I disliked at Amelie's that I was prompted to write a review. There are probably millions of Amelie's raving fans out there. I have been gorging to this 24/7 gem since 2009 and I love giving new friends their first "Amelie's experience." I went a few days and witnessed- the first "sale" item I had ever seen there- BOGO raspberry cream puffs. Of course I had to try this. I have tried most the menu here and this was the first time I was ever disappointed. Amelie's is quality and fresh ingredients- consistently. You must try the salted caramel brownie - that goes without saying. Their soup is divine as are their sandwiches both breakfast and their more lunch/dinner options. This place oddly enough is the calmest during the day and morning. Around 7pm this is when the line goes out the door to past 2am. Three years of eating here and I just witnessed their first misstep. If I ever move from Charlotte I will dream every night about Amelie's and it would be my first stop on every trip back.

I love how the bakery is convenient. The products are so good. I especially go here for the macarons!! They are huge and all the flavors are delicious. If you buy 5 macarons you get 1 free!! We also tried their eclairs which was also so good.

I was looking forward to trying this place after reading so many reviews and blog posts but the server made me feel like she hated her job and rushed me. As it was my first time being here, I did want to taste test a few flavors before committing to a purchase. The server gave off an annoyed and unkind demeanor. With that being said, I ordered the salted peanut butter but I really wanted to try the frosÃ¨. (The server told me the flavors were the same in the other section but it wasn't because that's where the frosÃ¨ was and I didn't see it). I will be returning because I REALLY wanna try the frosÃ¨, hopefully I get a different server.

I went in for the memories. I used to love their bakery while I was studying in China. The one in Las Vegas was impressive. I could find the familiarity in taste. Wide selection of buns and rolls and pastries. I enjoyed their rose cheese bun best.

Very VERY delicious ice cream. The workers were friendly. I found the place to be a little pricey but the ice cream really was that good. It's a small shop but there's seating out back that is shaded and relatively cool.

Warning! If you are a tourist and it's June 2022, you're going to have a tough time navigating in this area. There is a lot of construction that starts at the freeway and continues down into the neighborhood where this place is. It's in the downtown area. I'm sure they have great donuts but we couldn't find a way to get there. Literally, every route our very good routing system told us to take, we ran into another "construction obstruction." If you want to go, I'd call them for directions.

The ice cream is always amazing and the staff they usually have on is great except for whoever picked up the phone today. I wanted to pick up some ice cream but before driving 35 minutes to get there I thought I'd give them a call to see if I could do a pick up or at least to see if the flavor I wanted was in stock. they were out on my last trip so I don't want to make an hour long round trip for nothing. "We're not taking pickup orders I don't have the staff" CLICK I get your busy and all but you hung up before I could even ask another question. Why do you pick up the phone in the first place if you're gonna hang up on customers?
I'll start by saying Umm WOW!!! Amazing interior design!! Amazing teas Amazing macaroons and fruit pasteries....& May I add the best quiche I've ever had!!! Extremely happy I found this in DT!!!

Will definitely have to try Rewind again! I ordered the Matcha Americano and it hit the spot. Just a nice, refreshing drink where I could customize the sweetness. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Love, love, love that they are able to cater to vegans. There were four ice cream flavors. They also offered plant based milks. They do allow plant based milk subs for certain drinks at an additional cost. Tasted their blueberry cardamom ice cream which was delicious. Their cones and creations look amazing! Would definitely recommend trying.
First time here. ..3 bites in here and I pull a half red half white hair out of my mouth. Utterly disgusted. Ugh. What a waste. AND they don't have regular cones. Ugh. Disappointment
Super small bakery but they serve delicious chocolate cannolis & their coffee is great too! We will definitely be back in the future to try some more pastries!

So happy to have ran into this location while visiting Vegas. We have this bakery back home in San Diego so I was so glad to have found one . I called my order ahead of time and picked it up the same day .

Probably the greatest ice cream spot- definitely in Pittsburgh, maybe the US? The atmosphere is what makes Page stand out - the location tucked under a rail bridge, the excessive signage, the old fashioned building and lights, the lines wrapping around the parking lot. The ice cream selection is immense and can be a bit hit or miss, but generally delicious. Special flavors are usually winners. The fresh blueberry soft serve is soooo good! I've never had anything like it before and was blown away by how fresh it was! If you're feeling decadent, the specialty sundaes are intense and delicious. The cinnamon roll one is my favorite.

I had heard a lot of hype- the birthday cake was overpriced and completely dry. After letting it thaw, it was even worse. I also tried the French toast flavored ice cream. The cashier pointed to the French toast ice cream picture, I paid, and what came out had no toppings on it. That was frustrating, but worse was the taste. It was like salted butter ice cream. I ended up taking 2 bites, and literally throwing it away at the pink counter. You'd be better going to ANY other dessert place around.

I've never been disappointed leaving here. The options are a plenty, something for every sweet tooth fix. Very eclectic frequented by almost everyone. Admittedly I'm not crazy about the chocolate croissants as everyone else is. I love to salted caramel brownie, German chocolate brownie, and honey buns
This is seriously the best ice cream I have ever had! The Fat Elvis and the Milk and Cookies. To die for! Great atmosphere. You won't regret going.

I've watched, and loved, every episode of Cake Boss and I really, REALLY wanted to be blown away by this place... but it just didn't live up to the expectations I had in mind. We got two cream puffs - they were the best thing we ordered and they really were good; a cannoli - the filling had a strange not-quite-smooth/not-quite-gritty texture but a pretty good flavor to it and the shell tasted like it had been deep fried in old grease; a chocolate cupcake with vanilla buttercream frosting - not bad... but not great, either; and a lobster tail (what I was most anticipating after hearing the stories about them on the show) - I'm torn on the lobster tail... the pastry is amazing, super crispy and nicely browned with a nice flavor... but the filling just tastes 'off' - the vanilla has too much of a punch and tastes artificial. I'm sure their ingredients are of great quality but they just didn't work well together today.
If you don't mind standing in line for an hour because of lack of organization and then eating subpar bake goods, this place is for you.

Dripps is a deeeelight! Ever since I saw their sign go up with the words soft serve + tea, I've been so excited and anxiously waiting for them to launch. I was hoping they would specialize in Asian drink teas and boba as we don't have anything like that in this particular corner of Chandler, and to my pleasant surprise, they do! I popped by during their grand opening night where they were offering Buy One Get One on all ice cream and drinks. It was a bit of a wait but well worth it. I decided to get two drinks to try, and it was so hard choosing as ALL the drinks sound and look amazing. Got the Strawberry Matcha latte and Rose Milk Tea. Both so good, with the Rose Milk Tea being floral and sweet (best when mixed) and the Strawberry Matcha having delicious fresh strawberry purÃ©e at the bottom. Can't wait to try their other concoctions like Matcha Cold Brew and Roasted Green Tea Hojicha latte! Their decor is *aesthetic* af and there are plenty of spots to get a good snap of your pretty drinks and cones. I especially love the tropical wallpaper and hexagonal marble tile in their kitchen area!! So pretty. Can't wait to come back and try the soft serve - I saw on insta that they have extended their BOGO deal for a few more days (show that you're following them on social media to redeem!) so I might have to go back and get a cone! (Summer's over and so is my theoretical summer bod lol)
If you are in Pittsburgh you MUST go here! Lines are long but they move fast. Delicious ice cream.

I absolutely LOVED this place! My boyfriend and I are die hard donut addicts and we couldn't believe that this place was close to our home! The service is always so nice and attentive. It's a small little place but it's super cool!
The service guy need take a rest. Looked so tired and voice is so low. Too long line.

I am originally from Akron, so thought we had the only beloved Mary Coyle's on earth. Imagine my surprise when I moved to Phoenix and discovered the sister store and a place beloved just as much here. My grandmother took me to Mary Coyle's as a child and it was always a special outing. As an older adult, I still return to my childhood favorites--a root-beer float or hot fudge sundae with whipped cream. This is my favorite ice cream place in the Valley of the Sun or if in Akron at Highland Square. What a lucky girl to have had them both!
Nom nom nom - we always stop here for treats. Cookies are just the right amount of chewy and the flavors are unique. Cake truffles are yummy, too. And the people working there are always nice.

My absolute go-to for ice cream and sundaes when I'm in the area! My personal preference is the "Fat Elvis" which I recommend ordering with one scoop of chocolate and one scoop of peanut butter ice cream. If you're not into sundaes, don't worry! Churn also rotates out some flavors seasonally, and there's always the staples (chocolate, vanilla, peanut butter, etc.) and you can always get a cone with toppings. One thing to note is that there is very little indoor seating (maybe one table), but there are tables out back, and there's usually at least a small line unless you come at an odd time. Worth it though!

I'm not sure if I've ever been to a Mitchell's. I like this location because you can walk around Ohio City and then go get ice cream. There is a train that goes around the room above you. There are also party rooms upstairs, but they were reserved. We got a double scoop. 1: Caramel sea salt: It's soft, at first, thought we were gonna get extra because of the softness, but then he put some back. 2: Pralines & Cream: this was amazing. The combination of the two was great. Overall Impression: I'd go back. I wouldn't wait in line for +15 minutes, but I'd go back.

If you're at the Cosmopolitan hotel and youre looking for a sweet treat, you need to stop by Milk. Their soft serve is incredibly delicious- not too sweet. They are a little pricey for such a small portion, but that's to be expected. I didn't get a chance to try out their other items on the menu... at one point, I was tempted to buy their cookies to bring home since I was only in Vegas for vacation. But if I do return to Vegas in the near future, I'll definitely be back.

This was one of my planned stops while in Vegas...SO GLAD I stopped in! The menu of donuts...omg...seriously, how does one decide between lemon cheesecake, Meyer lemon blueberry and triple threat chocolate? You DON'T! You get them all! Not to mention the other delicious, creative flavors, like the donut with an OREO in the middle. Be still my heart! The coffee drinks were fabulous, the staff were so friendly and the bathroom, well, I'll leave it as a secret and just tell you to check it out! Will be back before I leave this town. GO. SEE. ENJOY!

Finally got a chance to try out the ever so popular Milk Bar at the Cosmopolitan. Tucked away on the second floor of the fancy food court/shopping area, lies the uniquely decorated storefront. Reminiscence of a mom and pop bake shop with a colorful hand written menu proudly displayed up top. The goodies are in full presentation behind glass as well as shiny soft serve machines in the back. For my first experience I opted for; 1. Compost Cookie: My favorite of the bunch! The perfect amount of chew with a mixture of salty and sweet flavors from pretzels, potato chips, graham crackers, coffee, oats, and butterscotch. I can totally tell why this is their best selling cookie, even at 4 dollars a pop. Will definitely revisit; 2. Milk Bar/Crack Pie: Not knowing what to expect, I was greeted with a thin pie/cookie concoction which was scrumptious, but overly sweet for my liking. Slightly gooey and nicely chewy with sweet and salty finish. My favorite part has to be the oat cookie crust; 3. Birthday Cake Truffles: Sadly, I can not say I enjoyed this truffle ball much at all. Ultimately, a super sweet and dense cake pop. Just not my thing. Will I return? Probably after a winning run at the craps table so I can try a slice of $14.00 birthday cake that everyone seems to rave about. I have really high expectations when paying 14 bucks for a slice a cake, and would hate to be disappointed.

I tried the chocolate coconut cupcake. It was moist and just ok. It cost $3.75 plus additional .30 to eat inside. Even though it had a lot of coconut shreds at the top I could barely taste the coconut. The frosting was too sweet & it over powered the coconut shreds.

I should have known what I was getting into when they didn't have peanut butter as a topping choice. The ice cream is just OK. It's not amazing and it's not bad. Getting fancy with flavors doesn't mean they are good. If you are just visiting the area, I would try somewhere else.

This place has really good ice cream! They use real fruits and make it in front of you! They give you a lot too! The atmosphere is really nice with a weird Japan/Hip vibe to it! It's super cute! They also have board/card games available to kill time and have a good time!

Some of the best ice cream we've ever had nationwide and at prices that we hadn't seen in years! After a trip to the West Side Market, my wife and I swung by Mitchell's on a warm summer Saturday afternoon at 12pm, which seemed like the perfect timing. The ice cream shop had just opened 30 minutes prior and there weren't many people inside, so we took our time exploring the menu and flavors. From the moment people spot Mitchell's you can tell it's just different. For one, the outside looks like the entrance to a movie theater. Once customers make their way in, they're greeted by a huge glass window straight ahead where you can see into their ice cream making facility. However, what customers really need to focus on is the writing and menu on the glass window, which is not only written in a light white, but incredibly hard to see. I won't dock them any stars for that snafu, but maybe making it a bit darker would have helped, however I get that they want to showcase the factory behind the glass. Anyway, we surveyed the flavors at the ordering counter and the options. We tend to make the mistake of over-ordering, but also what to try as much as we can, so what better option than the Taster's Duo, which is supposed to be a single scoop of 2 different flavors. After being enlightened by the very helpful employees there about their most popular and favorite flavors, my wife ordered the Strawberry Rhubard and Fresh Peach on a sugar cone, while I ordered the Toasted Pistachio and Caramel Fudge Brownie, with the latter supposedly being their most in demand flavor. The verdict? EXCELLENT. The ice cream wasn't too soft and had very good texture to it. The flavors were really good and we loved each and every bite. The Strawberry Rhubard and Fresh Peach were fruity, but savory. The Toasted Pistachio and Caramel Fudge Brownie were sweet, but not overpowering. The Caramel Fudge Brownie had large chunks of brownie inside of the ice cream, which I loved. Overall, the ice cream was delicious and perfect. What was even better was how generous the scoops were. We ordered the Taster's Duo, which was supposed to be 2 half scoops, but when we received our cones, the ice cream was overloaded. It looked like they had given us 2 gigantic single scoops of each flavor we ordered. In addition, the Taster's Duo was just $3.95, which is unheard of these days for ice cream from a shop. I guess we felt we really got our money's worth too because we basically got 2 scoops instead of one. We loved the price point here, but we loved the flavors, serving size and delicious ice cream even more.

The absolute worst customer service. I tried to make a phone order and apparently because she was "too busy," she felt my order must not have been important. The lady on the phone was snarky and rude. Told me to go to their website, and the website said to call for what's available." It's clear they don't want you to call them. Absolute worst service I've ever received. Plenty of other local bakeries that would take my business. I am just astonished by the lack of professionalism and the horrid customer service. WILL NEVER RECOMMEND OR RETURN.
Such a fun vibe with a million options and can't beat prices ! No place to sit if that's what you're looking for
Cutest little cafe! Whimsical and fun with delicious coffee and tea. They also have out of this world desserts! Must go to when visiting Charlotte!
Toasted Coconut Sorbet was absolutely light and refreshing with every bite. Only drawback about this place was the wait. it was under 30 min but haha who likes to wait?!

Soooooooo disappointed in the cupcakes I bought last night. Bought 4 large and 2 mini about $20+. Ate the mini's on the way to the car, they were fine. Although I had to remove some of the frosting, even on the small ones it is pretty sweet. Got the big one's out for dessert tonight and could NOT finish a whole cupcake. They were so dry I was shocked. And the frosting to cake ratio was for me off. To SWEET! Or maybe it was the dry flavorless cake that was the problem. I thought this product was baked on sight!? Needless to say for the price I wont be going back!

After I found out that there was a Sprinkles Cupcakes in Las Vegas I HAD to visit the OG of cupcakes. After dinner across the street at Caesars Palace I dragged my Husband across the street and down the block to Sprinkles. There really is no easy way to get there and it's a long walk. It's located in the Linq Promenade and definitely not visible from Las Vegas Blvd as the Yelp map shows. After walking more than halfway down the Linq Promenade (located on your way to the Ferris Wheel) I spotted Sprinkles Cupcakes with its giant lighted sign. I was surprised to see that they weren't busy around 7:00pm on a Saturday so it was nice having some time to browse and not have to stand in a line. The employees were nice and the shop was organized and clean. There are a few seats inside to eat your cupcakes but we chose to take ours and go. I got the Peanut Butter Chocolate Cupcake which was good and I was glad to see it wasn't filled inside. The cupcake had good peanut butter flavor and the chocolate frosting was tasty. I love cupcakes, but couldn't finish this one because it was super sweet. The cupcake itself was a good size, but there was a TON of frosting! My Husband got the Maple Bacon Cupcake and he thought his was OK (he's not a big fan of cupcakes in the first place) and he couldn't finish all his either. I would come back to Sprinkles Cupcakes the next time I'm in Las Vegas because I really like cupcakes. Otherwise I would pass because I've had better cupcakes back home in California.

We heard when traveling to Cleveland you HAD to go to Jack Frost for amazing donuts. We were not disappointed. The cake donuts and crullers were delicious. The only down size was that we unintentionally went on national donut day so the pickings were slim when we got there but we we got was delicious.

Calling all ice-cream lovers in AZ! Wonder what homemade icecream tastes like? Look no further because I found the spot for you! :) Wonderful service and very friendly people! They have such fun delicious flavors like Taro and Unicorn Poop and Birthday Cake! The cool part is that you can create it your way! Like if you want it into a boba float, in a cup, cone, Hawaiian shaved ice style, all those options are available! They also have Japanese drinks and very cool combinations to give you inspiration! Honestly I want to go again! Such a cute place! Perfect for this Arizona weather I fell in love with this place!

Must hit place in Charlotte and doesn't hurt that it's located by all things cool in Noda! Open 24 hours, there's never an off-time (although there are many ON times, with a line reaching into separate rooms). You'll know you're in the right spot right away, with all the creative artwork and antique pieces, I've heard it feels just like France (although I will verify AFTER my future visit!) The restaurant is made up of 3 rooms with an eclectic array of chairs and tables. Free wifi, and water too and you'll find outlets along the walls for the necessary charge [NOTE: I discovered the back room gets the best reception during my visit!] You'll walk in and immediately be greeted by a glass counter filled with goodies: pastries and sweet treats. But that's not all that Amelie offers! They've got a breakfast and lunch menu filled with sandwiches, quiche and coffee/teas. I recommend the turkey and brie sandwich, it's served on a baguette with a seedy raspberry jam. I've tried an assortment of treats and much say I need to keep trying! The Napoleon was too messy and tricky to eat: you really need to let it heat up but it falls apart really easily. I also tried a fruit (maybe orange) and tarragon macaron recently that was just ok on flavor although great texture. The downside is that Amelie's is pretty pricy when it comes to their bakery, so you can't go too crazy without the bill going crazy. I'll keep returning until I find the perfect combination, you really can't get over the atmosphere!

I have been going to this cafe since it has been opened for almost half year. The people are kind and bubble teas are good. However, what made me happy was their coffee. Their coffee is just so good compared to other coffee (especially when u try espresso). Also, their waffles are unique too. Unlike other waffles in champaign, their waffles are really sweet without any syrup. If anyone wants to try at their shop, i recommend you to try their waffles and coffee.

My first visit to Jarling's was on a Saturday night after a great meal at Thara Thai, also located in Champaign. I'd actually driven past here on a previous occasion while in the Champaign area, but did not stop by. I did some research for dessert options in the area, and Jarling's seemed to be very popular. Going to Jarling's, I knew I wanted to get a snowstorm (similar to Culver's concrete mixer, DQ's blizzard). I also wanted to try their famous 'cold fudge,' which is hot fudge, but it's cold, and does not melt the custard (explanation given to me by a girl working there). Anyways, I decided to go with the Tortoise snowstorm. At first, the girl gave me the tortoise sundae, which i should have started eating, but I gave it back instead. I guess she was confused because I asked what cold fudge was, and cold fudge usually comes on the sundaes, but whatever. It was quickly corrected to a Tortoise snow storm. I also ordered a teddy cup of the cake batter ice cream. A teddy cup at Jarling's is a dip (equvalent to a scoop) with 6 teddy grahams and a cherry. A dip would have been 1.75, but the T cup was 2.25. Not really worth it in my opinion. I was a bit confused by my snowstorm, to be honest. It said it was vanilla custard, although it came out looking like chocolate. The tortoise is supposed to feature cold fudge, almonds, and butterscotch. When the incorrect tortoise sundae was brought out, it was vanilla custard with a fudge topping. For my snowstorm, it was a different color, so I was confused. I also did not taste any butterscotch, which I was really looking forward to. I went here with my bro, and he ordered the same teddy cup, as well as a Macaroon snowstorm. I had a bit of his, and it was much better than mine. I think they may have mixed up my order, but either way, the custard was still very good. The cake batter custard was nothing special, to be honest. No pieces of cake batter, or any sprinkles.They have a weekly special of flavors, along with their regular (see their new updated website). Just a side note, we came here at 845 on a Saturday night, and it was pretty crowded inside. There are multiple benches inside, as well as a drivethru. We decided to order and head to my car, which was parked in one of the angle spots. While eating, 2 wonderlake fire dept trucks pulled on both sides of us. A girl who got out of one of the trucks decided to open her car door on my exterior, and didn't even bother to check anything. Not sure I'd want her responding to a fire of mine (nothing against jarling's, but it did happen there). 15 dollars for our 4 dishes. I'm not sure if I will be getting a snowstorm or a sundae on my next trip, but I will be back! I think I should have gone with something coconut, PB, or chocolate chip based next time. I'll be honest, I was disappointed in my Tortoise, but I will go back because I love dessert, and I'd prefer this place over DQ, any frozen yogurt place, or McD. I'd actually put it on par with Culver's, but I love local business, and I'd like to see if my experience coudl be improved.

I liked it, but there are a lot of other ice cream places I'd rather go. Yes, there is a uniqueness with the creation process and some of the different mix-ins, but it only satisfied my craving for ice cream. The ice cream didn't speak to me and I like it when my ice cream speaks to me.

I've been going here since the soft opening and all I can say it's ok. The bakery is a hit or miss depending on the day you visit. It is limited with the breads they have and every time I come here and most things run out very fast. I'm a big fan of fruit tarts and the berry one they have here is ok. The last time I came here, I was impressed with the Fresh Strawberry Milk Tea because whenever I see this at other places I am hesitant to try it. I'm afraid it might taste like Nesquik! LOL. Surprisingly, this drink hit the taste buds on the right spot. It included strawberry bits which is a bonus. The rest of their milk teas honestly just taste like half and half milk, which I am not a fan of. Also, a drink I usually get and love is their iced sea salt coffee! I would recommend this for any coffee lovers, it's not too strong-- it's just the perfect everyday iced coffee with a kick of sea salt creme. If it's a hot day, I recommend to try the iced grapefruit green tea! This place deserves a 3 star.

OH MY YUMMY I have a strong appreciation for many things in life and one of them is cupcakes. Sprinkles needs to expand west and get some more locations near me! Or maybe it's best they stay in Vegas so I have an excuse to go back! There is such a great variety here. All of their ingredients are pronounceable it almost makes me want to endorse the place as healthy! This is only my second visit and I "only" got two this time but they were both wonderful. I ate them too fast I forgot to take pictures (no, not both at the same time)! I ordered the triple cinnamon or double something or other, it tasted like a snickerdoodle spice cake with cinnamon frosting. The second was the "sprinkles" flavor which I believe is just their vanilla cake with white frosting and rainbow sprinkles. Both hit the spot. The place is always packed it seems, but the servers stay happy and always seem to be smiling. It's open late and there is an ice cream bar attached that is also quite tasty! A place I will definitely make a point to visit every time I come to Vegas.
Cashew brittle, almond brittle, bacon brittle! Go now, before it's too late!
Walked down after a dinner in town tonight on a Wednesday at 7 since website said it is open until 8 and was disappointed it was closed ... not cool ...

I am big fan of Donuts and believe me I have been to palaces where they have amazing donuts. This is by far one of the best donuts place I have been too. It is like hidden gem in downtown. Place opens (on Sundays) at 8am (pst). You will find line forming from 7:30am. 8am store opens and some one comes out from store and counts how many kids they have in line with their family at that time...Chef and his assistance comes out with plate of freshly made donuts for kids and gives them each. Assistance hand over balloon to kids. Then they start serving you. You get in the shop and welcomed with smile and amazing smell of fresh donuts, cream and coffee. They take time to serve you, answer your questions and get your order ready. By the time you get to cashier, your order is ready! Place is clean, great happy environment, awesome service and amazing donuts. MUST VISIT THIS PLACE AND HAVE DONUTS....

Small, local business with high-quality ice cream and a friendly staff! The flavors are constantly changing, so it's always fun to go and try new things. And they are generous with their free samples to ensure you pick one that is just right. Does it get any better? Actually, yes.... You can choose to smush your ice cream between warm, fresh cookies, waffles or churros. Last night I went for the butterfinger and brownie batter flavors between chocolate chip cookies, and as usual, I was not disappointed. Give it a go!
The best bakery in town. My daughter watched the shows and she couldn't wait to try it!!!
Cute setup and delicious ice cream! Perfect place to go on a sunny afternoon! Their take out boxes and fortune cookies only add to the charm of the old house in downtown phoenix.
They had a lot of different and unique options, it put a fun spin on getting ice cream! I highly recommend the milkshakes.

Only thing is ice cream is good for is pictures. If you care about taste I wouldn't come here. I don't know how this place has good reviews unless the people who tasted this ice cream came here during the pandemic and didn't realize they lost their taste yet. Drove 15 minutes here and was so disappointed. Ice cream taste like someone went to the dollar store bought the cheapest vanilla ice cream they could find, added a bunch of unnecessary food colorings which gave the ice cream a metal aftertaste and dumped a bunch of sugar in it. Taste like something I would give a bunch of two year olds at a kids birthday party but that's only if I didn't like the kids. But I love kids so I would never do that. I'm the type of person where even if I don't like my food I'll finish it so it won't go to waste but I happily threw it out after the second bite.

I am a fan of Cake Boss we always watch it, so when I saw they had a Carlos Bakery here my daughter and I had to come! There was a big line it took us about 35 min to get thru it. It seems very limited to what to choose from. Lots of cookies and some cakes we chose a little cheese cake, a reg cannoli and a cream puff all tasted good I also bought two fondant cookies for my other kids. The staff dies move real slow I would think with a line out the door and don't they would be hustling their butts off. I saw three people leave the line tired from waiting. I was actually able to meet Buddy later that night I saw him and his wife at the Plazzio Hotel and I did get a picture with him. It was late and I thought he would have been a lot more friendlier to my daughter and me but I have to admit I was a little disappointed because he seems a lot different on TV. Will I be back?...... Maybe if there wasn't a line I would but I have to say meeting him and having him not too happy left a little sour in my mind (considering I told him the story of us getting stuck in the hotel elevator at 1:30am just to come meet him!!!) ...... I would like to just think he could have smiled? Take it for what it's worth!

This place is banging, as the kids say. Today marks my second trip in as many days. I'd be lying if I said I "needed" ice cream today, but I needed not to pass this place without stopping. The flavors are creative and delicious. Although I sampled the chocolate Guinness, the rosemary chocolate and the real mint chip (made with local mint! Actually minty!), I went with the salted butter caramel for the second day running. If I lived in the area I would run the risk of being a regular. But since I don't, I will highly tout the delights of this local chain. Pass by at your peril of missing a highlight-of-the-day treat!
Salted Caramel Brownies and French Macaroons :)...They are a bit pricey...hence the 4 stars.
This is the real deal. Handel's ice cream is the best!
Good pastries but can be on the pricey side. There are no seats so plan on taking your dessert back to your hotel or walk and eat.

After tonight's carry out order consisting of 2 orders of char siu pork ramen we call it the best ramen in town. Excellent pork ramen and they nailed the broth. The added bonus of their house made spices and chile oil put it over the top. The egg is lightly poached so the yolk oozes into the broth. SFG! We couldn't get a picture good enough to give it justice so you'll have to look at other photos if you need to. Excellent customer service as well. Only caveat is they run out quick so call ahead to reserve your bowl of greatness! You can add extra meat and totally worth it. Second time in and we called ahead to reserve our order not knowing what time we'd be in. Found out what makes their noodles so amazing. They get them in fresh from a place in Hawaii! A guy whose mastered the art of making ramen noodles. Order an extra bowl for the next day. It will taste as good!

I've had the opportunity to know this brand and have had their Ice Cream samples at Food Festivals I've attended. The place is cute and bright, very fun looking atmosphere. One person taking orders, filling orders and checking out orders. Quit a line was forming. As we waited, we looked over the flavors offered. Fortunately as we waited, another employee came out and took my order. The young man was very nice. My friend and I shared a 2 scoop cup with Salted Butter Carmel and Brownie Swirl. The ice cream tasted heavenly, sweet and creamy. My only thoughts are, I wished they had more traditional flavors. I would definitely be back to try the ice cream sundae and milk shakes. Atmosphere: bright and fun looking. Service: good. Ice Cream: excellent
Great croissants with some crazy flavors, clean place and super affordable, you need to try the ice cream samiches
I had super high expectations after watching her Chef's Table episode and I was kinda disappointed :-/ Crack Pie is really good but super rich, one to share is all you need. Also veeeeeery pricey

Beautiful and unique ambiance for coffee, sandwiches, and pastries. Went there around lunch on a Thursday and it was pretty busy; but we were served pretty promptly. Our sandwiches were delicious & so was the coffee and chai tea. Lots of seating as well. Will be returning!

Best ice cream in Phoenix with unique and constantly changing flavors...and two of the sweetest people that own the shop! I feel like family every time I go in. They have only been open for a little over 3 months and I have been here about 5 times! I love bringing out of town visitors here and my boyfriend asks every single week if we can take a walk over to Novel. Highly recommend!
Walked in and greeted warmly as the last time! Dessert is amazing every time. Love coming back and this time brought my hubby. Clean and ample parking
I stopped by around 11 pm they only had one flavor available . The soft serve was terrible and expensive! . Mc Donald's ice scream tasted better than this !

Do not buy the bag of cookies that sells for $22. They are not fresh and not worth the money. Mine tasted like they were at least 3 days old if not more. i went there because of a recommendation on the apple pie. Since they were out of apple pies, I bought the cookies. Overall, I was not impressed. The meringue with hazelnut was horrible too.

The service was great, but the actual desserts are mediocre. I sampled the famous milk ice cream that tasted like day old Frosted Flakes, which just wasn't very good. So, I ended up just jumping in and ordered the vanilla cake with sprinkles in it. Another, sad disappointment. The reviews posted on here are true. I was shocked when I read them, that is why I still tried this place. I had to discover that the rumors were to bad to be true.

Food 4.5/5: I got the Georgia peach ice custard with cold fudge. There are many topping options, but I decided to keep it simple. Temperature was just right, resulting in custard that was soft and smooth, yet still refreshingly cool. Sticky sweetness of chocolate juxtaposed nicely with the mild fruity sweetness of peach. Service 4/5: Because we went during an off-hour, the line was nonexistent and wait time was brief (5 PM on Sunday). Service was polite and cordial. Ambiance 4/5: Clean, minimalist take on the old school ice cream parlor. The shaded outdoor seating was a great place to enjoy the custard on a hot, carefree Sunday evening.

Mood- my sweet tooth Upon entering was quickly greeted. The staff was so friendly. Menus are posted on podiums as you enter. They have decadent candy delights on the right, and everything from ice cream to coffee on the left at the counter. There is plenty of seating from tables to counter style with tall chairs. Ordered the sea salt Carmel hot cocoa, and a banana split sundae style. Neither disappointed at all. Would def recommend - also you get a complimentary chocolate when you order something. Location is Linq promenade- parking is either garages or lots

Turned to Yelp to find a dessert option while in Phoenix and was not disappointed by Novel Ice Cream. We were intrigued by the Leslie Knope (ice cream sandwich made on mini waffles), which was every bit as good as it sounds. We arrived around 8:30 PM on a Saturday and street parked because the nearby lot was full. There was a short line outside of the shop that was a bit slow-moving, but the level of individual attention we were given inside explained the brief wait. When it was our turn, the owner himself waited on us. When he learned it was our first time, he explained the shop's background, walked us through all of the flavors, and encouraged free samples. I wish I hadn't come straight from dinner --- I would have loved to order the Indecision, which allows you to get scoops of multiple different flavors. BF and I split a double scoop with Fat Elvis and bourbon caramel toffee crunch and it was phenomenal. I was nicely surprised at how affordable it was, too --- we ordered 3 different things to be split amongst 3 couples and the total was under $15. Wish I lived closer --- there'd be a lot of donut-ice cream sandwiches in my future.
It's an "OK" place, just for the sake of changing the Starbucks flavor. i got the fried cheese toast, took them like 10 minutes to heat it. the cafe mocha was not that great.

Omgosh...the staff was so friendly! It was nice to see how much of Park & Recreation Fans they were..Leslie Knope Ice Cream! Tried about 5 of their homemade flavored ice cream and each were so yummy. It was in a fun corner alongside a coffee/bar, hair salon, and tattoo place. Yup, but the place had a pretty cool outdoor hangout with lights. Come try!

This place is five stars dominant all the way. Fresh delicious ice cream the way it's meant to be. Just don't kid yourself when going here. It's not for anyone watching their caloric intake. That being said, it's awesome. My favorite is the chocolate raspberry truffle. I highly recommend it and every other flavor in the place!
Wow! The most amazing Cream stuff doughnut I've ever had, actually the first I've ever had!!! Delish!!
The best donuts you will ever eat. A little piece of heaven! I recommend Jack Frost to everyone!!!

My friend and I did a preorder of a dozen donuts. We got everything from the vegan creme brulee to the huge butter beer donut. We were so excited to try them when we got back to her place! Some donuts were really good like the blueberry cheesecake, vegan red donut, Boston cream etc. But some were either super dry or super disappointing (like the butter beer one :( very cute looking but not enough butterscotch flavor). The chai latte was decent but super small for a "medium" I would come back for certain ones but wouldn't get any of the original cake donuts since the they seem to always be dry.

I'm not a huge ice cream fan but when I have a craving this is the place I go. Friendly staff and great tasting ice cream. A little over priced but I believe it's worth the few extra dollars. Also I wish they had better sitting options, however I understand why they don't. It is an extremely small place. Parking isn't great either. Other than that it is a pretty nice place to hang with some friends.
Blue cheese w/ honey is the best ice cream in the whole entire world (and I've had ice cream all over the world!) So stop whatever you are doing and go now!

Best ice cream shop ever! Adorable building with a awesome paint job might I add. Great staff who knows how to take jokes and are genuinely very cool, down to earth people. Awesome creative flavors... And I love all the cereal ones, really brings you back to your childhood. They put it in a Chinese carry out box and to top it all off, literally, they put a fortune cookie on top .You can't just get that anywhere else! If I lived closer I would be there every day! ....tip: dip your fortune cookie in the ice cream... You will literally melt ;) lol

The last time we were in Vegas and I noticed Milk Bar, I almost lost it. I read about them in multiple magazines and couldn't wait to try their treats out for myself. Being that we were there to celebrate my husband's birthday, I figured it was the perfect excuse to buy the birthday cake truffles. You can purchase them either in store (3 truffles to a pack) or online. Make sure that you have somewhere cold to store them if you aren't planning to eat them right away though as they require refrigeration. Because I bought them the day before as a surprise, I also got myself cereal milk soft serve to enjoy then and there with a corn flake crunch topping. It was not at all what I was expecting.
