I swear I think I saw their pastries on the train ride in the Hunger Games.

My daughter and I came here after having dinner at the new downtown Ingos , the ice cream is off the charts! Suck a cool place too. The people are so nice and explain everything! I had an Irish car bomb car cream and my daughter had the Cookie Monster. Highly recommend
Delicious, fast service, the macaron was perfectly cooked and the ice cream is incredible. A must visit in Charlotte. I would definitely go back.
Up there with the best ice cream I've ever had. Highly recommend the peanut butter fudge sundae - HUGE portion and they do not skimp on the toppings. Will definitely be back!

My family and I were so trill to see the cake boss bakery in Las Vegas until we had their pasties . My sis and I had the cannoli, the cream tasted grainy and chalky and of course they were soggy. My husband had the napoleon the custard was pure corn starch, it needed vanilla flavor or milk or something! My niece had the cheesecake and that was actually good, because of the cheesecake I'm giving them one star. Changes are I will never come back again.

Quick, friendly, and extremely organized! There were many treats to select. They had a glass wall in which you can watch the busy bakers. There were plenty of staff members working hard and quickly serving guest. Thanks for a great Experience.
First time, won't be the last time! Great location, fun decor, super yummy donuts, plus chocolate milk if you're not feeling coffee with your confectionaries! Thanks Donut Bar, I'll be back!
Fresh food, great atmosphere, Excellent pastries!

Good donuts! My favorite was Butterfinger. I think they're more known for their yeast donuts, so definitely check those out! We got cake batter, which was tasty. Parking across the street was $3.00 for an hour. We did 15 mins for $0.75. We went at 10 AM on a Sunday (MLK weekend) and they were already sold out of French toast donut

I wish I could give Bouchon Bakery a better review, especially after our ecstatic meal at Bouchon the night before, but it sorta sucked. I like the cute little stand hidden away from everything else (just enter the Venetian and keep walking back and back from the casino floor), not a fan of the lack of seating (the food court is just upstairs and down a hallway a bit though). We had vanilla and pistachio macarons and some other small pastry. Macarons were hard on the outside and the filling was cloying- they'd been sitting for too long, perhaps? Big, which is nice, but ugh, CHEWY. Not a word I want with my lighter than air cookies. Two stars because I have hopes and I really did enjoy Bouchon. And the other pastries looked like they could be OK or even good.

You scream! I scream! We all scream for Handel's ice cream! Handel's makes the best ice cream on this side of the strip! I frequent here a lot during the summer but noticed I never reviewed them. Today being hot and humid required a lovely melting cone of chocolate pecan one of my favorite flavors. Handel's has been around since 1945 and makes their ice cream fresh in the store and they hail from Ohio. They have cones, cups, sandwiches, and pops so get your ice cream the way you want it. You can also order pints to go of your fav flavors. Even with Covid19 still on the prowl, this location is all about being outside with social distancing! The service is always friendly from the young kids who work here which makes it an even more desirable place to return to. If you haven't been here yet, what are you waiting for???
These donuts were built for show, not taste. They are beautifully made and come with a high price tag, but the taste left me a little disappointed. I do love the cheap and tasty coffee.

So, I'm sitting here like usual at Amelie's waiting forever on a sandwich that I ordered 15+min ago and there was no line (ironically) when I got here. Anything I've ever gotten here is golden! Pastries, sandwiches, soups, coffees whatever...it's all been delicious! But, I just can't bring myself to give more than three stars because I have to believe that their process for preparing food orders is just too inefficient and can be faster than it is. The phrase good things come to those who wait is an understatement. If your in a rush or really hungry, bring a book or friends or consider somewhere else. If you have the time, get prepared for good food and pastries.

With all the hype on how good the butter pecan ice-cream is, we gave it a try. It tasted just like cheap store bought ice-cream. What a disappointment!!! The cookie was the only item that tasted any good.

Batch Bakehouse is baking with magic I think... Corey D took me here as the last stop in Madison before I hopped on a plane back to Denver. I saw a dark chocolate and peanut butter loaf that I absolutely knew Sir Nicholas would love so I decided to purchase it and take it home with me. I carted a box of baked goods through security, stepped onto the plane and gingerly places it in the overhead (I was sitting in the first row, otherwise I would have put it under my seat.) Through all of this travel the loaf remained in perfect condition. I brought it home to Sir Nicholas and Little Man E would both took bites and make various sounds of approval. In Nick's case it was something like, "man, this is sooo good!" while Ephraim took a bite, giggled maniacally and took off down the hallway with as big a piece as he could hold. Trust me, after my bite I understood the desire to hoard it all for himself. And even after leaving it out overnight (still in the box, but otherwise unprotected, this cake remained soft, moist, and delicious. I also shared a chocolate/chocolate cookie with Corey that was mouthwatering and a piece of lemon cake that was perfect. I am very lucky that Batch is in Madison and not Denver. Otherwise I'd never be able to control my sweet tooth again!

Your Green Tea ice cream is amazing. It's one of the best in the US. I can really taste the matcha flavor. Please do not discontinue this flavor. You have no idea how difficult it is to find a good green tea ice cream.

My all time favorite! The Brecksville location has mint chocolate ice cream bars dipped in dark chocolate and nutty buddies that will makecyour socks roll up and down! They are so big i enjoy them over 2 days, they also have doggie ice cream so it is a great family treat for all of us!

This place is amazing! Crazy friendly staff that is fun and informative on all the ice cream. Everything I sampled was full of flavor and delicious. The store is a little small when it's packed but it didn't really bother me since they move so fast to get you in and out. There is a outdoor area with other shops around and usually have live bands on specific nights. Love love love!!!

Please visit this place! It's nestled in a corner off a busy street, so it's kind of easy to miss. Not only was the service amazing, the ice cream was too. We were actually the first customers of the day a couple days ago, as we got there exactly at noon when they opened. We saw two more people throughout the time it took for us to decide what we were getting, place our order, receive our order, and get back in the car to cool down, which was really only about 5-6 minutes. Seemed like a pretty popular spot. The cashier who helped us was extremely helpful, patient, and friendly. She let me try two flavors I was in between: the taro and honey lavender. Both of those flavors were delicious and fresh, but I couldn't pass up the Taro! My bf got the Elvis (peanut butter, banana, and bacon. Are you kidding?) flavor. They have what's called a Dough Melt which is a lightly glazed donut stuffed with an ice cream flavor and includes one topping of your choice like Fruity Pebbles, Reese's puffs, Cocoa Pebbles, Cinnamon Toast Crunch, sprinkles, etc. If you've ever been to Afters Ice Cream, it's similar to their "Milky Bun", but the Dough Melt from Novel was much better and fresher tasting. The price for two dough melts was $11.95, so a little less than $6 per dough melt, which is pretty reasonable for gourmet-tasting ice cream. I was glad they weren't overpriced like some of the other ice cream spots around. The lady preparing our Dough Melts was also really nice and patient. Another thing I noticed was how they were properly using gloves when handling food, and they both properly wore their masks. During these times, those things matter, and it just added to the overall great experience. We'll definitely be back when we're in Phoenix again!

The ice cream here is SOOO GOOD. The Fat Daddy cookie cup is BOMB. Would I come back? YES. Food: 5 must get cookie cup! Macaron with melted toasted marshmallow. So god. Service: 5 a little slow cause there was only one lady. But she was killing it. Price: $

I went to this place and it was amazing! I was only in line for 15 minutes and they had samples along the way! I had the strawberry short cake and was the best I've ever had! I would totally recommend this place.

Amazing. This place is cheap and the proportions are HUGE. It's definitely best to split a sundae because there so big. Unfortunately they don't have a seating area and the parking lot sucks but definitely worth it. The line was super long when i went on a Tuesday night but it went by pretty quickly. Wish I had know about this place sooner! It's great.

My wife and tried this place today and came out not impressed. We got a cannoli and pumpkin cheesecake. First off i think jack in the box has better cheesecake. And her cannoli was not good at all. And having been to the shop in new jersey i can say the flavors are not the same at both shops.

We stopped in yesterday after reading the amazing Yelp reviews and certainly weren't disappointed! This ice cream is just so yummy. My husband had the lemon sorbet (some of the best ever), I had the honey lavender (unique and so tasty) and our dog had a scoop of free vanilla ice cream (love that they are so pet friendly). The owners are so friendly and genuinely grateful for the business...we will definitely be back again and again!

Delicious ice cream combined with excellent service. The owners have done their research and are putting their all into this adorable little ice cream shop. They have a rotating menu with several unique flavors including sorbets. And if that's not enough you can add toppings or put your ice cream between a honey bun or on top of a waffle. When you come here you feel like you're helping the little guy and making the world a better place. Plus you get ice cream out of it so it's a win win!

The atmosphere is sold as French and cozy but then you get handed a boring white cup with lid and a boring plastic plate. The walls have neat lamps, chandeliers, curtains and art everywhere you look. Their chairs don't match (which I dig) but then you get a boring cup. Oh well. Guess who was looking forward to a bulky weird special cup? This girl The chai and chocolate croissant was good.
I love coming here... Or even in Rancho Cucamonga. This place satisfies the sweet tooth

CRACK PIE | Smaller than I thought it would be for $6. It was definitely good, but I don't think I'd buy it again and I don't think I'd have enjoyed it as much if my friend hadn't hyped it up for me. I'm afraid I can't justify the size for its price. It came in a envelope box, given at the register. CEREAL SHAKE | $10? (Not certain, because I didn't purchase it myself) Definitely a heavy drink with all the milk, but I couldn't stop drinking it. The cereal was perfectly crunchy throughout, even at the bottom of the cup. I'd get it again, but only to share with someone. (Shared with my boyfriend) EXPERIENCE | Small line when I went around midnight on a weekday, but it went by quick and we didn't wait long for the shake to come out. Cute photo op with a pink "milk" light stand in front, but it's low to the ground which might make it difficult to get an easy shot. Overall, I'd come back to try the other items but based on the price point, I'd prefer to make it an "experience" dessert by sharing with my boyfriend or friends to diffuse the cost. Originally wanted to give 3 stars but if I've enjoyed the experience or food enough to want to come back, it's at least a 4. Definitely recommend trying a variety of items to see if the price point is worth it in terms of quality, quantity, or experience.

Waited in line for freaking 40 minutes. I wanted to see what all the hype was about, uh no never again. Had the canollis, lobster roll & chocolate chip macadamia cookie. To say the least the cookie was the best part. Overpriced all the way around
Very good ice cream. They have unique flavors, as well as the standards that are tried and true. Friendly staff.

Dairy free flavors are really good BUT personally don't think they compare to the normal flavors. I got diary free cold brew with coconut AND a gooey cake batter on a waffle cone. Love that they use metal spoons and compostable containers!

I visited Dripps with my husband. The decor was super cute and I liked that they had a wall for the Instagram pictures. One of the employees helped us out by explaining the menu and helping us pick our options. My husband ended up getting one of their signature ones, cookies and cream. I ended up making my own shake with fruity pebbles. I loved the variety and how I could make my ice cream the way I wanted.

Everyone loved the cake!! Excited for the milk bar pie!! Staff was super kind and helpful and line was not to bad! Excited to go back They have lattes too so I'm definitely getting one of those next time!

Instagram worthy pictures. Milkshakes are good, if you are into super sweet food. Upgrading the cup for a picture is not worthy bc it crumples everywhere and you really can't eat it unless you have a super sweet tooth who is ok with licking icing on the side of your cup.
Finally tried bacon cinnamon roll it was amazing and totally worth the wait. Delicious donut flavors, amazing and friendly staff.

I was so excited to taste a piece of the rainbow cake with sprinkles topping, I paid $10 for a small slice. The cake looks beautiful unfortunately the taste of the cake was exceptional disappointing. Sad when a famous chef fails to deliver a quality product.

I'd kept hearing about how great Amelie's was and finally I had to see what the hype was all about. So I left work in South Park at 9:30 and drove to Amelie's in NoDA...and now I'm hooked. This place is extremely eclectic, with furniture from the ReStore in a Warehouse looking strip mall. Parking is great and there's even a patio for outside seating. But you're not going to Amelie's for the parking or the outside seating. The pasteries are to die for. I had a cup of coffee, a croissant, and some raspberry tart thing...for dinner. YUM! It killed my diet but I didn't care - even returning the next day to try something else. Now I'm intentionally finding a reason to go to NoDA just to go to Amelie's.

YUM! If you have never been to Jeni's you had better crawl out from under that rock you've been under LOL. Jeni's is the go-to place in Charlotte for ice cream. It is sooo good. Be warned, the line is almost always 20 people deep and snaked outside of the building. The line does move quickly and I've never waited longer than 10 minutes to get to the counter to order. My go to flavors are the gooey butter cake, salted peanut butter, and the brown butter almond brittle. Love their waffles cones - they are fresh and you can watch them make them in house! It can be a little bit pricey especially for pints but it is certainly a treat with flavors you won't find elsewhere!

Going into the place the people were nice and the line was long. But... Since they don't close till 12am wouldn't the amount of cupcakes be replenished? There were very few cupcakes left... The major issue would be that at checkout while paying I heard an employee ask if she should bring some out from stock. So there are more to choose from then 4 different ones... Then to my surprise the person, whom was asked if she should restock the shelf, replied with a "not yet". A few people in line who were in front of me and behind me were wondering why there were so few and though they seemed a but down about the lack of selection I was disappointed for the lack of customer service in the stocking side of things; which VITAL sales and the Las Vegas experience...

Red Velvet cupcakes are my kryptonite so obviously I had to check out Sprinkles as soon as I got to town... literally. Two Red Velvet cupcakes, and a mini Red Velvet later, I'm ready to give me review.... They were good, really good, but not the best. The regular sized ones were maybe a little dry (but not so dry as to stop me from eating a dozen more...) so if I'd paid for them (more on that in a minute) I may have been disappointed but probably not because it's still a dang good cupcake. The mini one I had, however, was bite sized perfection. If you're not a Red Velvet person, they have tons of other flavors which I should probably try sometime - I mean after all, I've never met a cupcake I didn't like. Beyond the traditional vanilla and chocolate, they bake up specialty flavors that vary depending on the day including Banana Peanut Butter (!), Chocolate Coconut, Cuban Coffee, Carrot, Strawberry, Cinnamon Sugar AND SO MANY MORE!!! Plus, they have seasonal ones like Pumpkin and for the month of May they are doing a special Margarita flavored cupcake. They sell the mini cupcakes for $2/each and the regular ones for $3.75 each. If you think that's too pricey sign up for the Sprinkles Perks program online (it's free) and just like that they will give you a FREE CUPCAKE! Then, they'll give you another one for your birthday. Just make sure to sign up for the program around when you'll be able to go because the free cupcakes do expire. If you're looking for something sweet and are a cupcake lover then you've got to check out Sprinkles. It's located on the Linq Promenade so it's not terribly convenient if you're staying anywhere other than Linq, Flamingo, or Caesars, but with that delicious cupcake waiting, it's definitely worth the walk! OH, and you can get Sprinkles cupcakes 24 hours a day with the only Cupcake ATM in existence - I think.
A little pricey but top notch and service is exceptional! Everyone's so friendly and helpful.
Somehow the birthday truffles tasted better in NYC. Still a close second. The milk and cereal soft serve was on point though and totally hit the spot of our 3 year craving.
Super delicious ice cream..... Worth the price. No wonder it was featured on the food network!!! Toffee banoffi is AWESOME!!!

Got "milked" for $20 and came up sour. Literally threw everything I bought in the garbage. Not sure who is handing the "awards" for this but....no! The experience was like waking up excited for the last bit of your favorite cereal and pouring some cold clumpy sour milk in the bowl. Yeah it's that great.

Love this place! Price is a bit high but its totally worth it! Locally owned, hand crafted, amazingness in a waffle bowl! Every time I go I always say I am going to try something new but just cant seem to keep myself away from the campfire s'more. My girlfriend always gets the turtle pecan and cant seem to get enough of it! Great staff to top it off! Highly recommend trying this place at least once! You wont be disappointed!
The lemon blackberry ice cream was excellent. Good staff, good service, good stuff. We be back to Oberweis again. You should check it out

I absolutely love the donut bar! By far my favorite place to get some donuts. They have a crazy amount of donuts that are all different assortment of colors & flavors. I am super pleased every time I come here. You always get greeted with smiles & lots of energy. Even on holidays they dress up & make you feel awesome for being there. They had a margarita donut on cinco de mayo & I wish they would bring it back! But the creme brÃ»lÃ©e donut is my all time fave! Always coming back to this place.

Had their amazing Halo Halo. My BF is Filipino and gave it a 5/5! It's a perfect balance of sweet and refreshing without being overly sweet. The owner explained how her jelly is her secret recipe and I'd vouch that it as well as the taro ice cream was delicious. The owners were so nice and welcoming it felt like we were at a family reunion! Def recommend!

I dont understand what the attraction is. It's definitely cute, but my cappuccino was cold and the cake was dense and not very good. My husband had chocolate cream pie that was literally pie crust with a very thin layer of chocolate. Not good.

I haven't actually been to this place, but Iris C. was nice enough to bring me back a macaron gift box. According to her, this is just a small kiosk so there wouldn't be that much to try anyway. But, back to the macarons. In my limited experience as a macaron connoisseur, they have all been bite-sized - no bigger than the size of a half dollar coin. These macarons are supersized! They seem like a novelty item. The bigger size does not take away from the consistency of having a crispy shell with a soft and chewy inside. How do these compare with Paulette's, which have become the standard for good macarons? The texture is definitely there, but the flavors still go to Paulette's. The flavors are limited to: chocolate, raspberry, orange, lemon, espresso, and vanilla - good, but not amazing. Make me a giant almond-flavored macaron and you will get your 5th star. Oh, these macarons are not cheap by the way. One big MoonPie-sized macaron will cost you around $3.50. I still can't get over their humorously large size.
This place is a hit or miss. My favorite is the cornflake cookies and crack pie. Everything else is either too salty or overwhelmingly sweet.

Without a doubt, cannolis are one of my favorite desserts ever. So after driving down the strip during a BUSY edc weekend, I notice buddy's picture at the venetian. My heart dropped. I have been wanting to try his cannolis for the longest time. My boyfriend and I even considered getting it shipped on the website just to try, but I knew deep down it wouldn't be the same. After the long weekend with little to no sleep, I begged my friends if we can stop by so I can live one of my many food dreams and eating that beautiful carlo's bakery cannoli. With two hours before the flight, we quickly walked through the canal shops where we waited in a not too long line. That was the first thing that made me happy. I HATE waiting. We weren't in line for very long, maybe about 20 minutes. It was finally my turn to order and there they were, the cannolis I've been waiting to try all weekend! Knowing I couldn't take them all the way back to California with me, especially in that horrible Vegas heat, I had to settle for two :( I also decided to get a few lobster tails and a piece of crumb cake because I was definitely eyeing those as well. Loved the cannoli and the crumb cake! Haven't tried the lobster tail just yet but judging from the other two, I'm pretty sure I will love it as well. I don't remember the girl's name who helped me but she was very nice and helpful! She was kind of short and had glasses. Made my experience just that better. I can't wait for my Vegas trip to get more!

Update- So pleased that this hidden gem has managed to stay open. While it is takeout only, on a nice day there is a patio in back where you can enjoy your desserts. As always, everything was beautifully made and delicious, though the selection was more limited than usual. Always vegan options, if that is your thing.

One of my favorite places to stop in Vegas for a sweet treat. Cupcakes are always moist with the perfect amount of frosting. My fave is the Red velvet (and I'm not a big choc cake fan & love the red velvet here). The cookies are solid too, but spend your money on the cupcakes is my advice. The ice cream is good, not Salt & Straw good, but above average and worth it if craving ice cream. The ice cream sandwich is a lot of food FYI! My hubby complains that cupcakes are overhyped cake & usually hates them, but even he found a soft spot in his heart for Sprinkles

Came to get a taste of the cereal flavored ice cream. The ice cream was pretty good, it wasn't toooo sweet or bland. It actually tasted like the milk at the end of a cereal bowl!!! If you're looking for a new, unique flavor of ice cream come try it! If not the crack pie cookie is amazingly delicious! You'll want to come back for more hence, the name! Warning! The crack pie cookie is super sweet but soooooo good!!!!! Where's the milk?

After a hugely disappointing visit to another big name Bakery on my visit to Vegas I was delighted to find that Bouchon have some delicious baked items. This is more of a kiosk than a store as it is really small with nowhere to sit so expect to take your items and have a Picnic somewhere. Strawberry Cupcake (yelp.com/biz_photos/bouc¦) - $4. Beautiful decoration, it was a shame to ruin it. Also filled with the same smooth Strawberry Frosting that topped it. The cake was moist and fresh. Not too sweet. Raspberry Macaron (yelp.com/biz_photos/bouc¦) - $3.25. Not your regular sized Macarons, these are on steroids! Seriously, they are the size of the palm of my hand. This wasn't quite so fresh by the time I got around to eating it (completely my fault) but still tasted great. Crisp outside, chewy center. A little too light on flavor for my liking. Other items found here include Pastries, Cookies, Mini Cakes, Tarts and Pudding cups as well as Drinks. *TIP* Dine at Bouchon restaurant , bring your receipt here and you will get 25% off of your purchase.

I was definitely expecting more from this place based off of the photos. The reviews were accurate, everything was subpar at best. Which is unfortunate, I tried the Red Velvet Milkshake, B-Day Cake slice, B-Day Cake Truffles, and Milk Pie. The only thing that was above average was the Milk Pie. The Cake slice was hard and not moist at all, and everything else was just...regular. I definitely will not be visiting this place again.
You won't find better custard for cheaper in the C-U. Always tastes good, always has excellent and speedy service. My favorite is when peach is the flavor of the week!

I love the fact that they do have gluten-free pastry options. Not much, but at least they are there. They have really good French macarons and coffee. I would visit more often, but they are a bit pricey. There are two downsides: You can see the employees making the food, and they didn'tt have hairnets or hats on, and they didn't use gloves; it's also hard to find a clean table.

This is the best ice cream shop in Phoenix! I absolutely love coming here. The ice cream is amazing! Very good and creamy. The staff is also very friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful! I cannot find a better ice cream shop in town! Thanks Mary Coyle!

First things first, the graphic body parts decor was very unsettling and immediately disturbed my stomach, but I pushed through and got their ice cream which was wayyy over priced...$8!! It was good the first 3 bites but nothing too special. The environment is very artsy and unique but not the best idea for an ice cream, drink, and food spot. I was getting more thrift/antique store vibes lol

Love love love masons ice cream! If ice cream isn't enough to get you to stop by - their fun artwork and love of dogs should be! They have such unique and fun flavors, and have amazon vegan flavors too. Don't let the lines in the summer deter you - it's worth it!

Do not walk out of here without trying the salty caramel brownie! All of the soups are good as well. Prices make me consider dropping my rating to 4 stars...but the 24 hour convenience trumps prices in this case!

ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!!! We started our morning with a walk to check out the area and found bliss. Neither my wife or I are big donut fans but The Donut Bar changed our minds. Beyond delicious and so light/fluffy despite the massive size of the Homer and Chocolate Euphoria. The perfect way to start your morning when exploring the city!!
Terrible. My friend and I both found small black hairs in our sandwiches. I have long brown hair and she has long blonde hair. Ewwww. Never going back.

OMG!! So yummy! Make sure you get there early!! The donuts are huge!! I got the grill cheese one the last time I went and it was so amazing. Along with the staff always upbeat and happy. And so many vegan options as well.
Seriously the BEST icecream parlor I've ever been to! Try the homemade macaroons with strawberry icecream. ....ridiculously amazing!
The coffee and pastries here are AWESOME!!! And the best part is -- you can get them of all hours of the day, and night ;)

Sweet republic - hands down, it is delicious and good. Get the toffee banofi - leave the place with a full belly, happy. :) Toffee Banofi - Delicious! Sometimes when I get sundaes, they either have too much syrup, ice cream, whipped cream, etc but it's perfect. All the little pieces in the sundae is just delicious. I love the little toppings on top, it's so good. I died and went to heaven. I give this place 4 stars because for $8, I thought the item would be bigger. However, it's a good size - not too much to cause diabetes or too little to leave me hungry. Plus, we shouldn't eat too much ice cream, we don't want to be part of the diabetes epidemic in US but it's soo hard when ice cream is a food we can die for -- we can stand in the middle of the road and eat ice cream in awe as the cars go by us. :) I went during the afternoon on Sunday. I came when it was slightly busy. The wait can be long if the line is long because there's only two people and they help each person at a time but they provide good service overall! :)

Page's is a Pittsburgh ICON. I've been eating their ice cream since before I could walk or talk. The creamy cones are synonymous with summer in Pittsburgh. During the summer, you can expect to wait to get your dessert from Page's, but it's always worth it. They have such a huge selection to choose from, most using their thick soft serve as a starting point. Personally, I find it refreshing from time to time to order just a vanilla soft serve cone. Get back to basics and really enjoy the extra cream that they stir into their mix. I do recommend the dirt sundae. It was my go-to growing up. What's better than finding a rock hard gummy worm nestled into your crunched up Oreo's?? Aside from ice cream, Page's also serves a small menu of hot food. I can remember stopping by during the day with my gramma to get a 35 cent cheeseburger. They are always made fresh on their grill inside next to the banana split station (odd combo, I know.) I was ALWAYs tempted to get the nacho's because you can see them from the ordering window, but always had stage fright going up to that little window. Page's has been around for decades, and it's clear that it will be around for decades longer. If you're looking for an authentic Pittsburgh experience, it always ends with a cone from Page's!

Thank the Lord for Fatty Daddy's. My family's dinner plans did not turn out as great as I was hoping for and figured lets try one last spot to save the night. Fatty Daddy's was the hero. This hidden gem offers great homemade ice cream selections, macaroons (yep, that's what I said), along with burnt marshmallow yumminess. For my treat, I ordered the cookie sundae (there may have been a name for it I can not remember). With it came two scoops, a macaroon, and marshmallow. For my ice cream scoops I rolled with Nutella and fruity pebbles. The Nutella tasted like a Wendy's chocolate frosty and the fruity pebbles tasted, well, like fruity pebbles. Both were so good. I went with the fruity pebbles macaroon that was so chewy and flavorful. As for the marshmallow, not sure if it is homemade but it sure tastes like it. The whole treat was a winner for sure. The establishment was very comfortable with inside and outside seating and the young lady who prepared our treats was very friendly. She offered free samples for all who asked. Overall, a great dessert stop and glad we made the visit.
Worth every penny this place is.. Had breakfast here.. Ordered Egg and ham, chocolate croissant and strawberry parfait .. Loved everything

So I must give a big UPS to my fellow Yelpers. Without you I would be parisienne macaroon-less and my oh my I adore my french macaroons. I used to work in a restaurant that made these delicate cookies as petit fours. I've been addicted ever since. Bouchon Bakery is in the Venetian right underneath the escalator (if coming from self parking) next to the Apothecary. They close early sometimes depending on how busy they are. The 1st time I tried to go here they were shutting down at 10pm to my dismay. The macaroons here are HUGE and the price tag is $3.59 a piece. I got the seven pack for (I'm embarrassed to say) $17.29 and a cappuchino to boot. My mama opted for their chai tea and the apple fritter croissant with almond creme. That croissant was delish and even though I'm not a huge croissant fan (after you've made them once its hard to eat that much butter knowingly) I snuck a bite or two of this. I haven't made it all the way through my box yet but so far the chocolate has been the best. The texture of the macaroons is right on point! But the macaroons will only last (at the most) a week after you buy them if you keep them in the refrigerator the entire time (warns the staff). I really wish they labeled the flavors in the box :(.

I was underwhelmed by my experience at Jeni's and so were my family members. First of all, the line is incredibly frustrating to wait in. It was hot and service was slow. I know scooping ice cream takes time, but for the time it took, it was not worth it. My husband and I both sampled several flavors and did not like many of them. My husband said that both chocolate flavors he tasted had bizarre aftertastes. I tried vanilla and honey and didn't taste any honey. I did end up getting cream puff flavor which was fine, but nothing to crave or rave about. The flavors have the illusion of being interesting, but are not great flavors. This, of course, is just my opinion. But I feel the appeal is in the boutique shop style and reputation rather than actual quality. We also felt it was far too overpriced for what you get. I much prefer Golden Cow Creamery down the road. I have no reason to revisit Jeni's again when there are better ice cream shops in Charlotte.
Maybe it was too hot outside to eat a cupcake, but I didn't care! Sprinkles is awesome. I try to go when in Vegas or LA and this Linq location was no different. The Cupcake ATM is so fun!
I love this place and ambiance. Peace of Mind...

First time at the new location. It's still an old fashion style ice cream parlor, but much smaller than the previous location. The ice cream is excellent and comes in many yummy flavors. Very generous portions. While there are other small ice cream shops in the area, this one is definitely more family frien

My son called here, looking for a job, after dropping off an application to work here. He liked this place, their food, having lots of fun memories with his friends and family over the years. The owner or manager? he spoke to was very rude and unprofessional to him, saying "if someone quits or I fire someone I'll let you know!"

This is a "summer in Cleveland staple." Their homemade ice creams are fantastic, I especially like the honey pecan. My dog also enjoys a kiddie dish with a plain scoop of vanilla :-) I frequent one of Honey Hut's locations several times a month. It's a nice cool treat every time.

Updating my review! Solid 5 stars! I found out that the valet is FREE (but you gotta tip) AND there is a little seating area out back! Totally didn't know about that! So now I can actually park my car and sit and enjoy my treats! woot woot!

You just cannot beat a good cupcake! I've been to Sprinkles in NYC previously, so I knew what I was walking into when we found this spot on the strip. What a fabulous little store front, I wish they all looked like this. Service was quick and curteous. Instead of just a regular red velvet, I opted for the sundae and was not disappointed. The ice cream was incredible, honestly wasn't expecting it to be that great. Vanilla really balanced nicely with the red velvet. This however was dinner. I wouldn't recommend going if you already ate- it's quite filling and after eating that you'll be feeling like the ultimate fattie. Be sure to take a nice long stroll down the strip when you finish :)

I came across this place while looking for places to eat before I got to Vegas. Their Instagram intrigued me, so I made it a point to stop here while I was in town. The staff was incredibly friendly and super helpful the entire time I was there. Their donuts are simply the best I've ever had. The flavors are impeccable, the dough is so soft & everything you'd want from a donut. I was a little bummed they only make the French toast and grilled cheese ones on the weekends, but I'll just have to make another trip.

Seriously not that great. You wain like half hour in line and then you feel rushed. The floor is dirty and the customer service is ok. The only thing we came back for are the lobster rolls (@ 5.95 each). Other than that none of the bread is worth the calories. Just selling the name at a crazy price.

The Donut Bar definitely exceeded my expectations! Every time I have attempted to come to the bar the donuts have been sold out. So I finally got up early enough to make it down and I am truly glad I did. I got the funfetti and vanilla bean donut and I have truly never had donuts so good and moist in my life. Not to mention those donuts plus the orange juice I got came to a total of $8.00 even. I was more than happy with the customer service from the waitress in my pictures and it was also very pleasant seeing the owner of the shop. I love being able to see owners actually come around to their shop, it provides an extra sense of intimacy in the shop that you do not typically get otherwise. I loved the Donutwill definitely be back!

What a magical treat this place is! I have had Somi Somi bookmarked for quite a while. Just a couple of locations and all far from where I live. I met a friend to try a new pizza place and Somi Somi was only two doors down so we stopped for dessert. So easy to find right off of Eastern Avenue. Somi Somi is a special Korean dessert that is known is Ah Boong. First you decide how you wish to eat your Somi Somi. I chose upside down Ah Boong. It is served in a fish shape waffle cone. Next you select a soft serve flavor. I chose Matcha. Then you choose a filling. I decided on Taro. Lastly you may also select a topping of cereal bites, coconut, strawberry etc. I have been back several times now and almost always order my dessert now with Ube soft serve, Nutella filling and a different topping each time. This is one of the most refreshing and tasty desserts I had all summer. Their soft serve is so creamy and packs plenty of flavor. The homemade waffle cone is soft and flavorful especially with Nutella. Warning, the servings are large so you can probably share one with whomever you are with. I look forward to returning again and again. I am pretty sure that I will be eating this delightful dessert in the winter too. Why not?

Delicious food. The breakfast sandwiches are a 10/10. Great atmosphere. Be careful not to come during peak hours because the line can be very long and you might have a hard time finding a seat, but it's worth it.
One of the best pieces of foccacia I've ever had in my life and good coffee. Everything else they offered looked equally delicious. YUM!

I first tried 85* Cafe in Irvine many moons ago. I grab some goodies whenever I visit California. The hype is still alive in Vegas even after being open for a few months. There's still long lines, chaos, panic, hoarding, and bread shortage. The choices are limited and lots of empty trays and shelves especially at night and weekends. There are more empty shelves than there is bread/ pastries. Everybody's grabbing whatever's being put before they even hit the shelves like it was going out of style. The pastries are delicious. My favorites are the green tea tale, mango tale, cheese dog, garlic cheese bread, bacon, ham and cheese, milk pudding bread, and iced lemon black tea. What I don't like: choco bun, mocha bread, sugar cream cheese brioche, and their cakes including the boba tea cake. They're dry and flavorless.
I had the cinnamon cupcake and chocolate chip cookie cupcake. Both were really good, though I thought the price was a bit steep. Service was good. Great location.

Amazing ice cream. The new addition of a hot drinks menu is fantastic! The affoggato is a must try. Fatty Daddys' new owner is really stepping up by providing more of a variety! Great little local spot!

I heard about this place on the Food Network, which highly recommends the Toffee Binoffi Sundae. Instead of getting the TB Sundae, I chose the oatmeal, chocolate chip, walnut cookie with 1/2 scoop of brown butter ice cream & 1/2 scoop almond butter crunch. Good combination! The only downfall was, the cookie tasted really salty. Other than that, it was good & I would try this place again.

The fancy deserts are not the only interesting item at Charlotte's only actual French bakery and cafe. The cast of characters that take up on both sides of the counter. You know right away quand vous entrez (when you enter) that someone has visited France and "gets it". It took a very long time for Charlotte to obtain a square of land from the city of Lyon. It's real French edible art without the 8 hour flight.

I'm definitely a minority, because I didn't find the ice cream to be particularly amazing. Plus the workers were so rushed that despite requesting a twist on my cinnamon bun sundae, I was given plain vanilla and realized it too late. The description says it comes with 2 cinnamon buns, but I received two halves of the outermost roll, so less than 1. Portions are still enormous but not worth the $4.50 or so, considering I could just pay for a cinnamon bun separately (it's good they sell pastries as well). I'll go back to try the interesting soft-serve flavors though.

Come early or you will miss out. Also if just stopping by. They have pickup parking in the back for 15 minutes. Come around 10 and most definitely you will miss out on their awesome selection. What can u ask for. Great donuts and friendly staff. Always out goto place for donuts.

I am a sucker for French macarons. I go to Bouchon every time I'm in Las Vegas, Yountville or Beverly Hills. No matter the wait, it's always worth it. Here's what I ordered: Grilled Cheese Sandwich - No, I didn't come here to buy a grilled cheese sandwich. I was just starving so I wanted something small to hold me over until dinner time... plus, I'll never turn away from a grilled cheese. Note: They have to "heat up" the oven and that took ten minutes. What I really liked most about their grilled cheese sandwich was that it wasn't greasy! What I didn't understand was why they call it a grilled cheese if it's not grilled, they put it in the oven to melt the cheese. Anyway, I enjoyed it nonetheless. French Macarons - Yes, this was what I came here for!! I'm drooling thinking about Macarons as I write this. The Macarons here are bigger than the average size Macarons you buy anywhere else. I always get the Pistachio because it's my absolute favorite flavor. I also got the chocolate, vanilla, and their seasonal flavor; blueberry cheesecake. They're so light, fluffy and perfect. I was in macaron heaven!

Don't get me wrong, the donuts WERE GOOD... but they weren't exceptional or phenomenal (to me). If you enjoy cake-batter like heavy donuts, then these will be right up your alley. But if you're more into fluffy doughy donuts, then these are not for you. My boyfriend and I landed in Vegas on a Saturday morning and headed straight to Donut Bar at 8am hoping for some fresh donuts. We got there around 830AM & there was no line when we walked in. The second we entered, the room filled with sweet smelling goodness. All the donuts LOOKED AMAZING. We bought 2 dozen for our entire group of friends. So we basically tried every single Donut they had to offer. And I mean I actually tried a bite of every single one.. and I wasn't too amazed. Maybe I was just overhyped? The price was pretty high too. The doughnuts are HUGE.. But bigger is not always better. They ranged from $2-5 depending on which flavor. We ended up spending about $75 for 2 dozen. Most likely I would not come back here again, but it doesn't hurt to try if you're a first timer! I would definitely recommend heading to the east coast if you're on the hunt for real delicious donuts!
Perhaps the only thing wrong with Batch is that they post incredibly tempting stuff on my FB feed every morning. Yes, I could remove them. I recommend everything.
Best donuts ever! My daughter and I go every weekend and she loves their donuts! Every holiday and birthday our friends love this as a gift!

Tried this place out. Staff was nice and attentive. Ice cream was good but nothing spectacular. Prices were high but nothing we got was outrageous. The 1 scoop cones were actually two smaller scoops so bonus. Pricey but not for the strip.

Only two stars, because the fact is that yes, I have experienced better than the pastries at the Las Vegas Bouchon Bakery. The best of what I sampled was the chocolate croissant: it had two ribbons of chocolate in it, which was quite nice. However, the pastry was just a bit too tough when it should have been tender, and it was too greasy. I also took tastes of four different macaron flavors: chocolate, vanilla, raspberry and lemon. The chocolate was far and away the best of the four, but it was more like a brownie than a macaron. The weakest were the raspberry and lemon, which had too much oozy filling. Worst of what I tried: the pain au raisin. Pain au raisin is supposed to be a custard raisin roll, not a raisin danish. Flat, extremely greasy... I will only grudgingly acknowledge that there were enough raisins and that they were soft and tender, but that couldn't salvage the thing. I don't know, maybe I'm holding this place to unfairly high standards, but I know that pastry can be better.

I've always wanted to try Milk Bar, at least the one in NY whenever I make my way there, but when I found out there was one in Vegas I had to stop by. I've tried their cookies when they've been mailed to me as a gift but I honestly should've tried the same cookies there to compare if it tasted even better from the source, next time I will! But I ended up ordering their Milk Bar Pie slice (i believe it was formerly known as their crack pie). I was sorta disappointed with how much smaller the slice was in what looked like a big enough container that definitely could've fit a much larger slice of pie, but ya know, it is Vegas. Therefore prices will be much higher for what you actually get. It was like close to $8 for the slice I got! However despite the price, their Milk Bar Pie was SO good. It had this flavor combo of sweetness and saltiness that I wished I had more of it. So I was at least impressed with what I got. My mom really wanted to try their red velvet soft serve but their soft serve machines were not working that day so that was another disappointment. But I'm sure next time we visit Vegas, I'd still give this location of Milk Bar another try.

Loved the ice cream! So creamy! My husband had vanilla and I had Salted Caramel in a waffle bowl. The bowl tasted like it had just been made, not stale like other places I've been to. Can't wait to return!
The owner is the nicest person I've met . The donuts are delicious thanks for great experience.
great coffee shop, good value, plenty of seats, I am vegan, and do not drink soy milk, so knowing that they offer Almond Milk was a big plus.
I'm a HUGE ice cream fan. The fact that this venue is a long standing joint for PHX, makes me even happier. Solid ice cream, you won't go wrong.

When one in our party suggested we share, I think my reaction could only be described as a guffaw. Seriously? You want me to share this deliciousness with someone and NOT have it all for myself? Please. I had the toffee banoffee. Banoffee is one of my favorite desserts from the UK, in line behind a good sticky toffee pudding. I was not disappointed. I was fending off even sideways glances at my sundae. And there may have been low growling sounds, but I won't confirm or deny that they were coming from me. The ice cream was creamy and genuinely flavorful from the first spoonful to the last. The toppings were generous and equally fresh and flavorful. The bananas, miraculously, were a perfect level of ripeness - not a spot of brown to be seen. I was a little sad when my spoon started scraping the bottom of the cup. The shop has a fresh and bright vibe, and the counter staff were very helpful (offering taste samples) and super friendly. Yes, it's more pricy than, say, a trip to the local DQ, but it's totally worth it.

5/5 for flavor but unfortunately I did take away a star for the experience. I had no idea there was no seating and it was an order up place. Guess I should have read some reviews. Let me clarify there was a few benches that a bunch of kids were jumping off of and their clueless parents didn't care. Another annoying thing was the sign location of their flavor choices...TO ALL PARENTS: please be advised that when you prop you child or children on the counter in front of this sign it makes it very difficult for other to view. Staff was friendly and the four flavors we sampled were amazing! Just wish I was able to enjoy it not sitting on a curb with tons of kids around.

Well...I know that I won't convince many to stay away from this local institution, but if I can convince one, it will make my night better. I waited in line for 1 hour and was at least 20 min away from getting served when I left. Yes, it was Mom's weekend and they wee mobbed but there is such an indifference to the way they do business that I am hoping to convince anyone that reads this review STAY AWAY. The same person who takes the order, makes the order. There are only 4 people working here and the lines are back to the street. The counter person takes the order, walk toward the back with no sense of urgency, slowly fills the cup, talks to his co-worker for 30 seconds, goes to the topping area, same indifference to the 70-100 people in line, finally gets back to he counter and ask the same person what they want next (God forbid he could've made 2 at the same time). The owners couldn't care less that there far better ways to do things. Hire 3 more people. One person, takes orders and money, another makes the order. The time would be cut b 30%. And here's another idea, the teenage workers should actually be managed, Hurry just a little, don't talk to your co-workers, if one of your friends comes to the window, don't spend 3 mi asking about his life etc. CARE ABOUT THE CUSTOMER. But the owner clearly doesn't care about his customers because they wait and wait and wait. Except for one. Yes, I wasted an hour, but you didn't get my money because you didn't are enough to earn it. The service is HORRIBLE because the owner has a "screw the customer, they can wait instead of me spending more money" attitude.

If ever you are feeling down..head to the Sprinkles Cupcake ATM located at The Linq Promenade. Fun, sugary goodness at the touch of a button! I had never been to a Sprinkles location, let alone a cupcake atm and was all around impressed. The door opened and out came a cute little box housing my red velvet cupcake, which might I add had the perfect ratio of moist cake and icing. How can this not make you smile? It is $4.25 for one cupcake but 1. It is probably the best cupcake you have had and 2. This is Las Vegas, a city that capitalizes on tourism (plus the rent is not cheap on the strip). Will I be back? Oh, heck yes...something about a red velvet cupcake sliced in half with red velvet ICE CREAM seems to be calling my name...

Wanted chocolate covered strawberries at midnight for my fiancÃ©e, ran across uptown and couldn't find a place...after a thorough check via YELP, I found Amelies! That is by FAR the best place in all of Charlotte to get a desert, especially late at night when nothing else is open! Thank you Amelie's for being a life saver

I am always in the mood for the amazing treats that await me at Amelie's, I am never in the mood for the wait at Amelie's. If you have time and patience then you are sure to enjoy the amazing selection of pastries, torts, macaroons, brownies, and more. I really wish I knew the secret time to go when I didn't have to wait in that god awful line.

Rule: if there is no line, go and grab ice cream! This was the original Jeni's location in Charlotte and still super popular. The staff are super friendly, masked-up and ready to go. The stand alone building only has counter seating and the line moves through pretty fast. Lots of outdoor tables to sit at or the large concrete steps behind the store. I really only went in here to get a few pints to take home, so I'm not sure how they are handling samples during Covid, but they always gave you separate sampling spoons and the the staff always wore gloves before the pandemic. Southend is pretty lucky to have a cool spot like Jeni's to enjoy after going to one of the many restaurants nearby.

Aside from the small space and limited parking in the front of the store, Churn is an excellent place to get delicious ice cream on a hot day in Arizona, or even not as hot day. The more typical flavors at excellent at Churn but the reason I keep going back is for their Vietnamese coffee ice cream. The texture is always creamy and Vietnamese coffee flavor is intense and strong, making it a perfect desert for a coffee lover, like me. What I recommend: -- Vietnamese coffee ice cream
I'm not fond of this ice cream. It tastes thin to me. Maybe not enough milk fat. A lot like old fashioned ice milk.

I went there and it wasn't as special as I thought it was going to be. Also, what I always see featured the fruity pebble sandwich wasn't available? The ice cream was good but nothing over the top amazing.

My FAVORITE cupcake place, they always have an array of cupcake flavors that are delicious. I live in La Mesa and I drive up to La Jolla to get these cupcakes. The employees are always very friendly and are smiley and helpful when you ask about choosing a flavor. I was also offered a sample of ice cream that was delicious, I think it was the red velvet. It is nice that they have a vegan and gluten free option as well because my brother is a vegan and my best friend is gluten free. They both told me that the vegan and gluten free cupcakes are flavorful and delicious. My only complaint would be that sometimes the icing is hard and I don't like that but I don't know if they can help that especially when they are busy, if you are in the area I would definitely recommend coming here!
They will not let you order the soft serve on the cone and the only way you can get the cone is to pay $2 more to have them put it in upside down in a cup. They also did not have the cold brew float.
Best coconut cupcake I've ever had. Great Strawberry, carrot cake, and chocolate cupcakes as well. Visited their new Orlando, Fl location but couldn't score a cupcake due to the extremely long line.

While I'd like to think I'm pretty good at bringing back souvenirs and snacks from my travels, that's definitely not the case when it comes to my trips to Vegas. Perhaps it's because I seem to be there so often, but it never crosses my mind to bring stuff back. Not that there are a ton of good choices anyways - a Fat Tuesday yard stick/cup? Some cheesy t-shirt? A WIFE?! HA. Thank goodness for Milk Bar and all of their cookies! As you could imagine for obvious reasons, this Milk Bar is just SLIGHTLY different than the original one in NY; the second floor of Cosmo versus a tiny shop in the East Village? Yeah, that's different. However, despite being set in very different places, they're essentially the same in the most important way of all - their goodies! Whether it's their cookies, shakes (both regular and boozy), cakes, soft serve, or their famed Crack Pies, you're bound to find something for your sweet tooth! The first time I stopped by Milk Bar, it was strictly to pick up some of their cookies that I found oh so tasty when I had them in NY. The range of choices seemed to be about the same (Confetti, Blueberry & Cream, Corn, Cornflake Chocolate Chip Marshmallow, Chocolate-Chocolate, and their famous Compost cookie), but, more importantly, they tasted just as good. Of the bunch, the Cornflake Chocolate Chip Marshmallow and Compost cookies were my favorites - SO DELICIOUS! Along with getting more of their cookies, I also decided to try their GRASSHOPPER MILKSHAKE the last time I stopped by here. It had never been high on my list of things to get here, but my friend couldn't stop raving about the one he tried (which says something). While I can't say how mine compared to his, I thought my shake was pretty solid. The flavor could've been a little richer, but I liked the texture (not super thick or thin), how great the minty chocolate flavor was, and that it wasn't overly sweet. Even though it lacks the coziness and charm of their original NY spot, I can't say that there's really anything bad about this particular location. In fact, with how well their cookies keep, stopping off here before flying out of Vegas is practically a must! Which hopefully leads to getting a slice of their Crack Pie...or finally trying their Cereal Milk soft serve! Such a fail on my part for still not trying them yet...

I just moved into the neighborhood and found Handel's last week. Let's just say the staff is super friendly and very conscious of long lines. As they opened more windows to serve the guests faster. The ice cream was the best I've ever had. In fact I brought my family back three times last week and took my aunt and her kids there. I found out the company is from Ohio and so am I. Handel's reminded me of the ice cream stands from Ohio. I will always rave about Handel's ice cream. It will be a weekly stop for my family. Oh and the cones are sky high!!

Since watching Chef's Table I have been clamoring to try Milk Bar in NY, but won't be going for a few months. I was surprised and excited to wander by this one in LV. I do not have a big sweet tooth but was intrigued by Chef Christina Tosi's innovation and passion as portrayed on Chef's Table. I decided to try the ICED CEREAL MILK LATTE and it was sooo good. The cashier confirmed it was not too sweet and she was right. It was not overly sweet but it was amazingly delicious with a slight hint of cereal milk flavor. It was so good I wanted to come back the next day for another one in a larger size.

This place is one of my favorite weekly go-to spots with my daughter. Staff is super friendly and add to the experience significantly. We try not donuts all the time and have never been disappointed by our choices. All donuts are massive in size and perfect in texture. Fluffy tasty donuts! They recently started doing sugar donuts (plain?) and it's probably my my favorite. It's massive!

There is nothing more gratifying than enjoying a scoop, or two. from Honey Hut on a warm summer day! Buck heck, this ice cream would be a treat even in the dead of winter during a snowstorm. You cannot put a price tag on quality, and that is just what you get here with a unique mix of flavors sweetened with - you guessed it - honey! While there are many great places ice cream destinations throughout Northeast Ohio, Honey Hut easily makes the top five because quality and originality are two ingredients that many other places just don't have, e.g., Dairy Queen, Baskin Robbins.
Awesome ice cream!!! I had the butter pecan, my husband had Nutella, and our son had strawberry. All were amazing!!! Very friendly staff. Can't wait to come back.

Run. Don't walk. Run. This ice cream is what my dreams are made of. The strawberry rhubarb is amazing...the homemade pie crust pieces...perfection. The cookies and cream is literally the best I've EVER had. I also really like the sizes. I had the tasters duo and it was the perfect size to satisfy my sweet tooth without feeling guilty or weighed down.

I was debating between a 3 or a 4 star rating, but I went with the 4 because this place was definitely better than a 3. The reason I don't feel that it is a solid 4 is because I felt the selection is very limited. That being said... I loved the decor, the cake I tried was delicious and moist, and the espresso was better than most coffee shops. I will definitely be back, but I hope there will be more options next time.
Just go every weekend and try the new flavor they are offering. The matcha is great. Covid requirements are that you wear a mask and social distance.

I am so sorry Christina Tosi, your dessert bar is just . . .not that great! Christina is one of my favorite celebrity chefs and I love seeing her on tv as well as watching her cooking, her style, pastries, etc just her being a chef! I really wanted to try her place and we came by after lunch for something light for dessert. I saw all the cookie flavors and wanted to try a few but then my eyes caught the spiked milkshakes! So, I opted for the cornflake chocolate chip marshmallow cookie and the White-Russian-Cereal-Milk Shake. The cookie was nothing special . . .and actually, nothing making me want to order it again or try another type of cookie. It was chewy but not a good chewy, and it seems over baked as it was pretty tough. The cornflakes have a very subtle crispness and saltiness, the marshmallow just seems to add sweetness, and the chocolate chips are almost nonexistent. It was just not a great cookie and I expected so much more. As for the milkshake, this was pretty good. The cereal milk flavor is interesting, unique, and pretty tasty! Spiked with the alcohol it becomes a great blend of sweet and . . . umami? Is that the best way to describe a boozy milkshake? I don't know, but it was good! I won't mind trying Milk Bar again, but definitely not the cookies next time.

I was recommend by a local to come to this location. I'd have to say the quality of service was terrible. I was not greeted. No one standing in line but yet I was rushed. As if I should have known to not ask questions to the cashier. I was confused as the amount of money being charged and asked that she repeat order. And I had to tell her she was adding items from another incoming party. After leaving I reviewed the pastries and bill and still had other charges. I had to return to have them correct it. I purchased 4 chocolate crossiants, eclair, apple turnover, brownie. Perhaps it was an old batch but not impressed with either items. Too dry.
The most mediocre place ever... smelled like chemicals when we walked in. A SMALL ass scoop for $5? And $1 for every topping? Gee thanks for my 4 sprinkles.... Never coming back here again.

Chocolate cannoli to die for and actually not to sweet. My baby sis loves her rainbow cake slice and the lobster tails original and hazelnut ammmaZING! It was my dream to go to Carlo's bakery and get one of each and I did and those were by far my favorite but everything was delicious. My dad loved the hazelnut cookies and lemon ones too. My best friend said her fave was the double chocolate chip cookie and carrot cake. I will definitely be making this my go to stop before we leave.
